text: Bottle from Saveur beer. Pours cherry red with little to no head. Aroma is berries, cherry, earthy wood background. Flavour is is dry tart green grape skin sour with a cherry fruit background. Lovely rounded tart finish. Lasting dry white wine finish. Lovely beer.

Piana ≈õrednio obfita, szybko opada do chmurki. Barwa rubinowo czerwona, klarowna. W aromacie sporo tanin w typie starej beczki, wytrawnego ciemnego wina, do tego czerwone owoce, ocet balsamiczny, lekka wanilia... W smaku intensywnie kwa≈õne, lekko cierpkie, lekko s≈Çodkie, jest czerwone wino, ocet jab≈Çkowy, wi≈õnie, porzeczki, ciemne winogrono, drewno, wanilia. Przy tym jest do≈õƒá g≈Çadkie, aksamitne w odczuciu, z niskim do ≈õredniego, drobnym wysyceniem.

Fajnie u≈Ço≈ºone i bogate piwo, dla mnie lepsze od chocia≈ºby ikony stylu - Duchesse De Bourgogne.
Dark brown beer with a huge beige foam. Sour and sweet berry/cherry aroma. Balanced sourness, cherries in the flavor. Quite tasty and not overwhelming.

Hopped and light. Bottled at dusty's. Crisp mouthfeel that doesn't linger too long. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown/red with medium beige head. Nice sour wine-like aroma. Strong but mild fruity sourness, which stays also in the aftertaste.

Ar: Tart pie cherries and wet wood; a bit of juicy fruit and peach skins; tangy, roasted caramels. Ap: Deep amber-red, slightly turbid; small off-white head with low retention, leaves a thin, fine ring. T: Tart cherries, lemon, and roasted caramel; largely clean acidity, which is medium-high; slight vinegar notes, but not unpleasant, adding just a bit of bite; bitterness is low, though there is some tannin structure with a slightly oaky in flavor; strawberries, peach skin, and sour orange juice longer into the finish. P: Light body with high carbonation; finish is dry. O: Excellent Flanders red ale; bright, firm acidity with just a hint of vinegar; lots of lean, underripe fruit flavor mingles well with the tannin and wood background notes; caramel malts and roast flavors are also nice accents, bolstering the overall beer profile without taking over.

Bottle. Pours dark red with tall, long-lasting, foamy off-white head and nice lacing. Nose is of sour dough, funky yeast, red fruit and some caramel. Body is medium and tangy. Taste is very sour, funky, tart, fruity, caramel malt. Finish is long and sour. Too sour for me.

August 12th 2015 bottle. 
Dark red liquid sitting under an inch of foam. 
Smells of both sour and sweet cherries. 
Taste is sour cherries dominant, almost 1 dimensional but what a state to be in. Tastes kinda woody too. 
Light bodied with ample carbonation. 
I dig it.

Petite mousse au sommet de ce liquide couleur de sang, ou de th√© d¬íhibiscus. Nez qui promet de l¬íacidul√©, avec des baies et du bois√© pour compl√©ter. Une bouche tr√®s mince et s√®che, d√ª au s√ªrette et au fruit√© (cerises, canneberges, fraises √† peine m√ªres). Une rouge un peu simplette, mais terriblement efficace dans ce qu¬íelle r√©ussit √† faire.

Bottle at BBW, Umeda. Deep ruby red with beige head. Aroma of vinegar, yoghurt lactic notes, plenty of cherry. Dark woody berry flavour, some sweet cherry, tart tannins, light balsamic. A sour front that transitions nicely into sweet with a spritzy feel, finishing somewhat dry. Easy flavourful drinking, just the right sourness level.
Small bottle from Liberty Wine Merchants on Commercial Drive in Vancouver. A dark brown beer with a moderate pale head. Quite tart, moderately fruity. No bitterness detected. Body is a bit thin. 3.8

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2017 Draft at THC. Pours clear burgundy with a fizzy off white head. Tastes like tart lemon, dark fruits, red wine, slight vinegar, and yeast. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like red wine, vinegar, dark fruits, and yeast.
Tap. Pours clear reddish brown. Aroma and flavor are caramel, vinegar, dark fruit, crisp acidity, light toast, and a dry tart finish. Light/medium body.

Bottled. Dark amber/burgundy coloured. Dense light brown head. Aroma. Sourness, berries, spice, vinegar. Flavour. Dense sourness, vinegar, citrus, berries, tart. Medium to full bodied. Ends rartacidic and sour. Delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amber colour, medium head that fades to a thin layer, good lace. Aroma is acid, red fruits, chocolate, vanilla, apples. Palate is acid, sharp, normal carbonation.. Taste of red fruits, cider, pepper, apples.

Bottle from Bois Cereste in Akasaka. Dark mahogany pour. Some lace. Smells of burnt soy sauce, minerals, apple, strawberry and cherry. Sour from start to finish. Taste is cherry juice, caramel, floral with grassy notes. Still puckeringly sour.
Solide, flemish und kantig getreidesour mit Industriebierkick!! Den Guten üòâ. Azetonoman im Reddystrudel üçèüòÇ ..0,1/1 Jetson. Fassware beim ZYTHOS 2017.
Clear light brown liquid, small head. Weak fruity aroma. Light body, average carbonation. Taste is sweet and sour.

Aroma: vinegar cherry
Appearance: red clear minimal head
Taste: very sour little Bitter
Palate: thin watery
Overall: interesting aromas but overwhelmed by too strong a sour taste.
My 3rd sour ale after the Rodenbachs. Truly taste the apple side of it and I like the ¬íLow¬í % of alcohol which is not too pronounced.

Bottle from LCBO. Pours a deep purple (!) in the glass. This is a beautiful, mouth puckering sour, like a thick & rich sour candy (minus the sugar). Tastes of balsamic vinegar mixed with unsweetened grape kool-aid & sour cherry juice. Really. Decent member of the sour canon.
Couleur rouge-brun√¢tre fonc√©, mince mousse. Ar√¥mes de bois fruits rouge, notes acides, En bouche, un beau m√©lange de bois√©, cerises s√ªres et une acidit√© prononc√©e. Tr√®s bonne.
it has quality and should gain respect, but tastes too much sour even for a sour ale.

Tart fruit (cherries?). Hard candy. Dark garnet. Lots of effervescence. Light tan quickly fading head. Very dry. Very tart. Pretty sure it's cherries. Medium bodied. Lingering sour finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a dark auburn brown with a good, yellowish-brown head. Aroma is slight cherry, sour, balsamic vinegar. Taste is sour, some red, sour cherry, balsamic vinegar, nicely sour. Tad thin and lively.

Bottle from the LCBO. Clear dark ruby copper with a tiny off white head that is quickly gone. Nose is strong cherry, with lighter wood and vanilla notes. Taste is tart cherry and cranberry with a light fruit sweetness. Mouth is medium with soft carbonation and a slow fading tart finish.

8-/3+/8-/3/15

Lambic de couleur rubis, non coup√© et m√ªri 18 mois en f√ªts de ch√™ne, cette bi√®re se veut d¬íapr√®s le brasseur (Omer Vander Ghinste) complexe mais tr√®s balanc√©e et acide. Le nez confirme en effet l¬íacidit√©. A la d√©gustation la premi√®re bouche laisse d√©couvrir une superbe acidit√©. La seconde bouche ne nous en laisse pas pour compte, avec une acidit√© intense. C¬íest alors que l¬íacidit√© s¬íaffirme davantage en troisi√®me bouche pour laisser exploser l¬íacidit√© sur un final des plus lin√©aire. Pour la complexit√© et la bi√®re "balanc√©e", cela reste un myst√®re. Une ode √† l¬íacidit√©. Omer Vander Ghinste a su sublimer le vinaigre. Pour cela salades et autres carottes rapp√©es pourront lui en √™tre reconnaissant.

Aroma typically lactic, traces of vanilla. Tastes strongly sour at first but a softer, fruity taste of dried plums, red currant, cherries and some vanilla quickly takes over and lingers. Very complex and refreshing.  Unfiltered too, I see: will definately keep some to age.
11.2ounce bottle at home. Brown in color, little head. Tart. 09/08/15 date on bottle. Smells yeasty. This does have sour tones. Interesting for the style and overall above average!

Bottle. Copper brown, clear. Small white head. Aroma has rhubarb, raspberry. 

Taste gas sour berry, citrus. Very bitter and sour.

330ml bottle, best before 2015-02-22. Probably bottled on 2012-02-22. Aged 5 years in perfect conditions. Pour dark red with brown notes, minimal no lasting foam, clouds on the surface. Aroma of wood, cherries and notes of balsamic vinegar. Medium body and medium carbonation for the style, but high carbonation for the age of this bottle. Taste is tart, refreshing for a vinegar liquid, fruity and woody.
Bottle at home. Pours black/darkbrown with big beige head. Aroma is sour rose hips. Taste has sour cranberry and cherries. Quite nice and different.
Not bad but it has that weird metallic twang on the back of the palate thst some Flanders have.

Pours with a good, thick foam. Aroma is very gentle and barely noticeable, but fresh and fruity. Has a nice clear cognac color with nice foam formation. Taste is very nice. Tastes similar to a very sour apple cider, but with an ale -like undernote. Palate is again cider-like with good carbonation.Taste has apple, sour cherry, lemon and sour red berries. By reading the official taste description I¬ím able to pick a faint vanilla. Very delicious and refreshing.
Low high lactic acid, yogurt-ish, apples, sour cherries, light caramel, spiky oak tannins (they go to cork like aromatics), dry.

Dark red. Nkce funky light barny on nose, dried berries, dark cherry. Ed bodied, tartness, good glean dark berry fruity, old woody notes. Intense, long lingering finsih. This is really nkce. Good flavours, intense, just the right acidity to stamp that flavour deep into your mouth, but not wnough to get unclmfortable.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle from Calendrier de l¬íAvent 2016 #12 from biere-revolution.fr - Color: deep dark ruby beer with no carbonation and small ivory head. Smell: sourness and sweet domination, fruity as well. Raspberry and blueberry. Taste: tart and light body with strong tart taste, really sweet balance. Balance is not good for me, tart and sweet as extreme. Aftertaste: tart, fruity and wine.

Bottle. Thanks to Werkmeister. Dark reddish brown body with white small head. Aroma is dried red fruits with caramel malts and some sour fruits in the background. Taste is fruity sour some cherries malts and hints of almonds in the background. Aftertaste is nice sour slightly balanced by some fruity and malty sweetness. Nice one.

Medium, bit sour aroma with cherry on earthy background. Darker amber color with minimal naturally white head. Slightly hazy liquid. Medium, averagely balanced taste with sour, bit dry cherry, dried red berries and earthy flavors. Medium taste spectrum and long, dry and sour aftertaste with dried berries. Medium/light body with medium/light carbonation. Overall, bit messy but still straight product.

2017-01-27. Brown body, modest head. Aroma of overdone toast is rather unexpectedly my first impression, followed by cherry and vinegar notes. Flavour is bracingly sour and tart up front, cherry like fruit. Smooth average to thin bodied palate, soft to low carbonation. Tasty, it¬ís not as nuanced as hoped, but doesn¬ít really suffer from it¬ís simplicity. 7/3-4/7/3/15-16 Bottle best before October 2019 shared by Kory.

November 16th, 2014 - The Cuvee de Jacobins gets round I think, since it is one of the most reviewed beers in Brouwerij Bockor¬ís line up. And here¬ís how my written notes begin: "Stupendous!" That¬ís a good start, and the impression comes from the aroma with his dazzlingly rich in overlapping and complementary aromas. I get cherries, barrel wood, strawberry shortcake, cherry pie filling, and even the more subtle nuance of a pinot noir. A considerable amount of time is spent taking in the bouquet of this beer - more than average - and with it a little warmth has moved from my hand to the brew. Appreciably sour, the flavor is acidic but intertwines this acerbic quality with flavors beautifully. A whirling cascade of bubbles also whips into the mix, blending the sugared watermelon notes with the fresh cherry tastes to create a fruity, rich beer that is also light enough not to weigh the drinker down.

Tap @ Konttori.
Pours dark murky red color with a thick creamy head. Ripe fruits and berries on the nose, yeast, some wooden notes. Pleasant berry flavor with nice tartness, some mild citric notes, strawberries. Quite nice.
4345

33cl bottle
 pours amid brown with thin white head
 Aroma roasty, resin, citrus, herbs, 
 Taste is light sour dry long sour finish
 nice beer
12 oz bottle pors dark reddish brown, thin head very carbonated smell is tart cherries and vinegar taste is dark fruits and vinegar very refreshing

[Notes from July 2016] Draught. Pours reddish brown with a small beige head. Aroma is cherry, vinegar, and wood. Taste is very sour with cherries, oak, some vinegar, and a little vanilla. Dry finish. Medium+ body. Medium carbonation. Complex.
Grav√∂l. SB Lund, flaska. Fin laceing. M√∂rr√∂dbrun komplex arom. Bra till bl√•b√§r. Sk√•lade f√∂r sv√§rmor Astrid. 102 √•r begravdes idag. Skulle smakat men inte bett om mer. Och bra till schinken.

Bottle from Beerhive. Pours dark reddish brown. Nose is rich and sour, oak, dried fruits. Taste is very sour and tart, dried cherries, oak, light vanilla, dried fruits, balsamic vinegar. If you like your Flemish sour really sour, you will like this.

Just wonderful. Red oak sourness countered with just enough sweet vanilla as to make it eminently drinkable. Huge mouthfeel in the mouthful. Purple behind the eyes, velvet cushions. Saliva sucking tartness with full-bodied complexity. Gorgeous.

Bouteille dat√©e du 02/09/2015, bue apr√®s 16 mois. Robe rouge√¢tre l√©g√®rement trouble avec un petit cerne de mousse. Ar√¥mes de petits fruits des champs sucr√©s, cerise mure √† point, pomme enrob√©e de caramel, l√©ger balsamique, jeune prune, tarte aux bleuets. En bouche, cerises noires et rouges se c√¥toient accompagn√©es d¬íune touche ac√©tique bien dos√©e, quelques autres petits fruits, citron, bois. Finale qui laisse ressortir des saveurs de confiture de bleuets et m√ªres et de liqueur de cerise. Pas trop acide et bien fruit√©. Texture huileuse, un peu juteuse, corps mince √† moyen. Tr√®s belle Rouge des Flandres.

Bi√®re vineuse brune et sure vieillie en f√ªt - so flamande! Sur base d¬íun lambiek (fermentation spontan√©e) et bien surette, le go√ªt bascule ensuite sur des ar√¥mes plus fruit√©es de cerise pour se terminer vers des go√ªts plus doux. Particuli√®rement bien √©quilibr√©e, c¬íest une tuerie.

12 oz. bottle. Reddish brown that just looks perfect. More sour than I was expecting, combined with a dry body and a light flavor profile. Really good, although I would have loved a little more flavor beyond the tartness.

Nez: Bois√©, cerise
Bouche: Cerise, bois√©e, acidit√©, s√©cheresse, astringence
Une bonne Sour mais ce n¬íest pas trop le style de bi√®re que j¬íaffectionne.
Dark brownish red in appearance. Strong sour cherry aromas and flavors. Very tart and highly sour finish.

Tap @Pu≈Çapka Gda≈Ñsk
Great fruity IPA. A lot of tropical and citrus fruitiness, nice hoppy character. Both taste and the aroma are full of hoppy fruitiness. Medium body, medium carbonation. This one is a 100% to be repeated.
330ml Bottle - Red/brown in colour. Raisins, wood and vinegar feature prominently in the fruity and acidic taste. Some cherries can be detected in the finish.

Pours a deep rubiny color with a very thin head that disappears instantly. Aroma is sour cherries, discrete balsamic vinegar, raspberry jam. Some yeast esters. Cherry liquor with hints of cognac. Taste is mild, tart cherries and vinegar. Light to moderate body. Medium carbonation. Tart finish.
High acidity with low sweetness. Intense palate with a fair amount of bitterness and a toasted taste of barrel. Amazing with food.

Aromat winny, owocowy, lekko octowy z kwasem mlekowym. Smak ≈õrednio kwa≈õny, cierpki, mocno limonkowy, z mu≈õniƒôciem octu winnego. Dalej mamy m≈Çody agrest, sk√≥rkƒô z cytryny. Posmak kr√≥tki, cierpki i cytrynowy.

Presenta marr√≥n claro, bastante trasparente con media corona de espuma, perdurando una fina capa hasta el final, aromas a vinagre, fruta madura, manzanas √°cidas y frutos rojos; en boca entrada suave, refrescante, empieza muy √°cida con largo retrogusto, sigue punzante pero invita al siguiente trago, cuerpo medio y buena carbonataci√≥n, buen ejemplo de estilo.
bottled at home, beautiful sour ale with complicated aroma, and the price is really fair. one of my favourite sour beer.

Visual: Pours clear copper brown with a smallish head, thick ringed retention, clusters of active micro streams.

Nose: acidic sour woody, pukey cherry-prune (lvl-8)-pungency

Attack: immediate puckery sour, light crisp

Mid-palate: brown sugar , sour cherry, soft pukey-woody, red wine vinegar bright acidic

Finish: apple exhale, residual acidity, acidic woody sour dry

Summary: Drinks better at cellar temp, though I¬ím not getting all advertised flavours such as the stone fruit and cocoa. Plenty of acidic sourness but lacking in standout aromatic flavours or punchy depth.

Ar: Notes of cherry, red berries, oak, sour and little bit of vanilla. Very nice!

Ap: reddis-brown with good head that last very long

T: similar to aroma. Plus Some sweetnes. Sour charecter is strong and goes well with sweetnes. Aftertaste is long and has very nice "bite"

O: World-class sour ale. Very complex and strong :)

33cl-fles bij Brouwerij Omer Vander Ghinste. U: Roodbruin met beige schuimkraag. G: Hout, zuur rood fruit, balsamico en een tikje vineus. S: Zoet-zuur. Rood fruit, eik, appels  en melkzuur. M: Zeer volmondig met medium carbonatie.
Bottle in Mort Subite in Altrincham. Ruby with a cream head. Fruity vinous aroma. The taste has tart red wine and cherry notes with oak and sherbet spice. Refreshing and complex. Outstanding.

Robe ruby, peu de carbo, collet moyen fuyant lentement.
Aromes bien marqu√©s sur les fruits rouges aigres (cerises), bois vert.
L¬íacidite se ressent d√®s l¬íattaque bien sur avec en prime les notes bois√©s, mais se poursuit jusqu¬ía une finale bien longue sur les cerises ameres.
Ni trop ni trop peu, un juste equilibre qui fait la difference et qui remporte un vif succes.
Un regal pour amateur de Sour Red

A red pretty sour beer, not much more to be said. Came in a 330ml brown bottle

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap into a snifter showing opaque caramel crimson with sparse white foam. 

The nose is slightly vinous, showing a slight herbal medicinal edge. 

The palate is light bodied and fully carbonated. Moderately tart with a mix of caramel malts, light cocoa, and bing cherries. Flavors are not very rhythmic or put together; it¬ís slightly messy but flavors do compliment each other.
Pours a mahogany color with a tan head. Aroma is of tart with dark fruits, candied sugar, caramel malts, and Belgian yeast. Flavor is similar with the tartness on the finish.

33 cl. best before 10/08/18, aperta il 18/09/16.
Rosso antico, limpida con riflessi dorati, schiuma tra l¬íocra ed il beige fine ma non molto persistente che forma un anello in superficie lungo la parete del bicchiere, da manuale rispetto alla tipologia di appartenenza.
Aroma di aceto di mele, legno (Foeder), un accenno di cannella, mela verde, fichi secchi, ciliegia disidratata, lievemente citrica ed oleosa.
In bocca attacca acidula, sempre aceto di mele, successivamente note speziate, limone con una punta di noce moscata, uva fragola ed uva passa, fichi secchi, leggera albicocca, legno; quest¬íultimo rimane presente con delicatezza anche sul finale insieme ad una lieve astringenza che incorda la mela verde lasciando la bocca quasi neutra.
Mediamente carbonata, corpo medio, bevuta di una pulizia esemplare.
Bottle from Real Ale Store, Newark. Red to mid brown colour with a white head. Aroma is fruity and a slight woodyiness. Taste is light sweet to sour.
Yep, very nice lambic. Cherry are strong in the aroma. The taste is nicely sauer with a lasting aftertaste.
UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 Clear red/brown colored beer with a small white head. Taste is nice sour, berries, cherries, fruity and woody. Nice dry sour afthertaste.

Bottle. Dark reddish color with thick head. Aroma has sour elements, vinegar, oak cherries and berries. Taste is sour with long dry aftertaste. Flavors of cherries, berries, some lactic elements and wood.
Roodbruin/Cola kleur met weinig wit schuim. Geur: wat kazig, zoet - zuur, appels, kers, framboos. Smaak: zuur, kers. Medium koolzuur. Afdronk: wat tannine, droog, kersenpitten.
0.33 l bottle from Alko Hakaniemi, Helsinki. Looks like cognac. Taste is sour as in lambic. Well, this is actually lambic made in the wrong place - Flanders. Colour is darker, though. Great.

Pullo @ Alko. Kaatuu tulppaaniin todella syv√§n punaisena ja "kirkkaana", noin kahden sormen paksuisella vaahdolla. Melkein lambicmaisen hapan ja todella t√§ytel√§inen prosentteihin n√§hden.
330 ml bottle. Clear dark brownish red colour, thin off-white head. Tart aroma of cherry and wood. The flavour is tart, with cherries and raspberries, and notes of oak and apples. Tasty.
33cl bottled. Pours dark red without head. Cherries, redcurrant. Heavily sour, perhaps even overtly so. Really good.
Possibly too sour... But interesting. Might be great with a corned beef sandwich with lots of sour kraut and mustard...  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Beautiful clear red with small beige head. Aroma of sour berries and tartness. Strong sour and tarty taste. Leaves a bit dry. Average carbonation. Very nice

33 cl, bottled. Pours clear red with a nice beige head. Aroma: Tart berry notes, oak barrels. Taste: Pleasantly sour, tart taste. Berries, wood. Notes of salt. Fruity notes. Palate: Medium body, notable carbonation. Excellent.
Very sour which I love. Nice tingle pucker with last fruit. Very nice. Will have again.
Underbart vacker f√§rg i lite r√∂dskimrande. Smak av ahlgrens sura bilar eller n√•got annat surt snask.

Clear deep red colour, small foamy tan head. Aroma has cherries, yeast, vanilla. Really strong, sour taste with slightly dry finish. Light body, low carbonation, a bit watery mouthfeel. Very flavourful, pretty good sour.

Bottle from SB. Somewhere between red and brown color, with white head.
Aroma: oak, grapes, kinda funky, cocktail cherries, dried cherry. 
Tarty and very dry taste, sourness. Lingers in the aftertaste a long time. Low carbonation, medium body. 
In all a very good flanders red, one of the best and very affordable.
Bottle from Alko. Pours dark, ruby beer with a bit tan medium head. Aroma and taste are sour fruity, cherries and apple, and it is very tart. I have had better sour beers, but not bad one.
Nice amber colored beer. Really sour beer. Still not my kind on beer..............
0,33l bottle from Alko. Pours ruby colour with medium long lasting head. Aroma of sour fruits, tartness, cherry, oak. Mediumish body, tartiness is strong here. Very pleasant.

Bottle. Amber in color, offwhite head. Tart and sour berries in aroma, some vinegar, cherries and wooden barrels too. Tart mouthfeel. 
Red berries, tart vibes in taste as well.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BB 22.06.16, from Alko, 20160722) The beer poured dark brown and clear. Its head was medium sized, nearly white and it lasted long. Aroma had malts, berries, wood and tartness. Palate was medium bodied and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were sourness, tartness, berries, malts, cherries, wood and bitterness. Aftertaste was tart and bitter. A good sour and tart brew.
Bottle. Pours clear mahogany to copper with medium frothy off-white head. Aroma is sour cherry, apple, wood. Flavour is sour, acidic lemon, cherry, apple, raspberry, malts. Goodie.

330mk bottle from Park Royal. Pours a dark reddish copper with a tan head. Aroma is sour with cherries and oak notes. Taste is tart, dry, sour, cherry notes. Sour cherries aftertaste. Good beer, but not so full-bodied as other flemish ales.

Super tart sour scent that hits the nose just right. Cloudy reddish brown brew with huge tan head. Rightous sour taste that makes me want to drink more clove and herbs with a touch of something I just can¬ít put my tougue on yet but like. Medium body with great tart carbonation. Love sours and this just adds to what a sour should be. Nice work!

Aroma: aroma of grapes, like wine vinegar, acidic. No hops¬í aromas.
Appearance: great appearance. Beauty deep amber-red-brown color with almost white very creamy thick head. Foam retention above average. Clear liquid. Small to medium lacing.
Taste: no sweetness, no bitterness, high sourness. Taste of wine vinegar. 
Palate: light-to-medium body, watery-to-oily texture, low carbonation, long dry-acidic-vinegar-like finish. The vinegar-like flavor hiddens all the other flavors.
Overall: fantastic appearance. The vinegar taste is not one of my favorites neither can be this beer. But it¬ís fresh and thirst quenching. Probably it nails the style but my low score is because i don¬ít like that kind of flavors.
Draft. Aroma of vinegar, light berry. Deep red body with nice head. Flavor is raspberry, strawberries, vinegar. Nice palate.

Pours red with light foam. Aroma is raspberry, sourness, light cellar, fruits, some spices. Taste is sourish, fresh, berries, cowberry, cranberry, dryness, condiment, sour jam. After taste is very dry, berries and freshness, spices. Veeery good beer! Super!

11.2 ounce bottle. Pours a nice reddish brown with a thin tan head that lasts. Taste is of tart cherries, wood, apples and a lot of sour. Aroma of apples and cherries. Has a mostly full body with a tart and sour finish. Honestly, can be quite shocking at first, but as I drank it the layers unfold and it became quite an enjoyable experience.

330ml bottle from Beervana. Pours a clear dark copper color with a small off-white head that diminishes rather quickly and leaves a small lacing. Aroma is quite fruity and acidic with vanilla-wood undertones. Notes of sour cherries, pommegranate, red grapes, wine vinegar, lactic acid, oak, vanilla and lemon. Very nice and rounded. Taste is mostly sour, with sweet vanilla and wood backbone, mainly in the finish. Predominant flavors of sour cherries, berries, lemon, honey vinegar and red apples. Fantastic. Dry. Woody finish and aftertaste. Truly well-crafted. A fine, delicious oak aged Sour.
(bottle) clear, bright, reddish amber colour with a medium tall beige head; aroma of sourness, bit metallic; bright, refreshing sour flavour with a long, strong sour finish

Bottled. Pours hazy deep amber. Aroma of sour cherry, funk, wood, vanilla and berryish notes. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up bone dry and tart. Light to medium, watery texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Sour. üåüüåüüåüüåü

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2016 (33 cl bottle in wine glass.) Pours brown/red with a whimsical yellowish brown finger head. Aroma is typical of sour beer with lemons and citric yeasts with follows on the palate with a fruity acidity. Like young red apples, sour raspberries with a long finish.

Helder donker roodbruin bier met kleine beige schuimkraag. 
Aroma: hout, rode wijn.
Smaak: zurig, hout, azijn. 
Mondgevoel: licht met mooi koolzuur. 
Afdronk: eerder zure afdronk met een verfrissende ontwikkeling.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Wow, really nice lambic nose with vanilla, red wine vinegar and big oak notes. A little honey as it warms as well. Quite sour on the palate with lots of oak notes and a hint of vanilla on the palate as well. Above average carbonation. Super complex for such a low abv. The barrel character is there, but not overdone. Awesome and exactly what I was in the mood for tonight.

After a long day blogging about the migration patterns of Helisoma anceps I¬ím about tuckered out . Thankfully I found this in my fridge. I can¬ít really make out the colour with these sunglasses on but I¬íd assume if I took them off the lights that are on would give some telltale hints of hues. Fascinating aroma to say the least ----> Slightly sour strawberry, cherry, vanilla, caramel, touch of the ol¬í barnyard, wood, bitter nuts. Pretty incredible. From outside the rim there is a sugary sweet strawberry/cherry blend that hovers. The flavour doesn¬ít take a step back ----> instant drool inducing attack. I already know I need to get more. Vanilla gets wiped out by raspberry, strawberry and cherry tartness but continually pops in and out, vinegar, dank wood. Wonderful. Finishes tart as one would expect.

Red Brown with an off white head, quickly receding. At first reminds me of the dearly missed Rodenbach Alexandre, which is a very good start. Acid dominates the mouth, but becomes nicely balanced with the sugar and the earthy tones. Vanilla as well and of course cherries. A dry fizzy mineral acidity makes up the long finish
Rub√≠ limpio y espuma marfil. Aromas de fruto rojo, madera, frabuela melosa, cereza. Cuerpo medio y maltoso, sabor de fruta roja de acidez redonda y larga con final seco.

.Draft at PreFunk. This style is growing on me, and I¬íll always give a nod to the Belgians. Not much to look at, but a pleasure for the senses. Big tart fruity notes abound, aroma and taste buds overwhelmed, dry puckering finish. A beauty from the originators.

nuts, herbs, grass, barnyard, basement aromas, earthy, cooked vegetables, red, brown, clear, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, creamy, oily feel, medium body, long finish, not my cup of tea. Medicinal and acid.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle poured to snifters, showing a clear, brownish copper color, with a presentable layer of off white head foam that expeditiously reduced to a bubbly ring, and spots of lacing. The nose was tartness, a little barnyard, cherry, and some pit fruit. Medium bodied, with decent carbonation, tart to sour on the palate, and quite dry finishing. A no nonsense Sour.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 13-10-18. miedziano-czerwono-brazowe, przejrzyste, z piana w postaci obraczki. Aromaty intensywne - dzika (skorzana - im cieplejsze tym wiecej) kwasnosc jednoznaczna, duzo ciemnych, kwasnych owocow (porzeczki, winogrona, niedojrzale wisnie i czeresnie ale i cytryna), winne, jakies beczkowe chyba tez. w ustach bardzo kwasne (jeden z bardziej kwasnych flandersow jakie mialem okazje probowac), Octu ani kiszonki nie odnotowano :) mocno taniczne (taniniczne?), po kazdym lyku costam w ustach dretwieje az. Ale powtorka aromatow w smaku tez jest. niewysoko wysycone z jednej strony, ale drobno, co daje jeszcze dodatkowy efekt poszczypywania w ustach. Malo ciala, lekkie, rzeskie, zachecajace do kolejnych lykow. Duze wrazenie robi, z jednej strony moze nie jakies przesadnie zlozone czy skomplikowane, ale z drugiej przesuniete w swojej flandryjskosci do granic przyzwoitosci... ale ich nie przekraczajace. Klasa. Wole je chyba niz dotad dla mnie wzorcowy, bardziej wywazony i stonowany Rodenbach Grand CruRami Rami is drinking a Cuv√©e des Jacobins Rouge (2016) by Brouwerij Omer Vander Ghinste at Saska KƒôpaMocno kwasne, troche ciemnych owocow, takie straghtforwarddwie zupelnie rozne butle (4.1 i 3.8) to usrednie sobie ocenkeOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Appearance: red-brown clear color. minimal head.
Aroma: cherry, caramel, vinegar, nutty, chocolate, strawberry, raspberry.
Taste: high acidity, slight small sweetness.
Palate: medium body, thin texture, average carbonation, acidic finish.
Overall: when a geuze and a brown ale fell in love they had a baby, and this is that ofspring, atleast that is what it feels like.

Bottle from LCBO. BB 10.02.2019 (I wonder if it¬ís Feb or Oct). Pours dark, ruby reddish-brownish with smallish creamy white head. The aroma is tanninic, woody, cherry-ish, acidic and almost vinegary with some more delicate notes as indeed vanilla... Tastes really woody dry, tart, notes of cherry and oak, overall an underlayer of soft delicate sweetness and finish of tart sourness. Thin active carbonation and softish medium body, dry tart and tanninic finish. A very good Sour Ale, lives up to expectations but not much more. Stylistically pure.
Bottle. Dark copper with small lasting head. Aroma is cherry, wood and vinegar. The same in the taste, but theres some malt in the taste as well. Very sour.
33cl bottle from saveur-biere.com. Color is brown red. Thin beige head. Taste is medium sour, light sweet. Body is medium. Aroma is red fruits, barnyard, light cocoa and wood. Quite good.
On tap. Thin to disappearing white-copper. A-sweet and tart fruit-cherry, wood, some mallt. T-tart fruit-cherry, some acetic, wood, malt. Slight puckering and drying on the finish.

330ml bottle. Pours a clear red-amber with a small, creamy, long lasting, beige head that laces nicely. Aroma of tart cherries, oak, red wine and Brett. Sweet fruity flavour of cherries, red wine, oak and Brett with a dry, sour, acidic finish. Light to medium body with an oily texture and average carbonation. A very nice Flemish Sour.

I¬íve given the other beers from this brewery less than 2.0 , but this was a wonderful positive surprise. Dark cherry red-brown body, thick and even brown small-bubbled head. The aroma is woody, fruity, green apples, dried figs. The taste is mouthwatering. Average dryness. It¬ís incredibly balanced while multi-dimensional at the same time. The taste is cherry, champagne. Just lovely palate, it sticks to your tongue.

Bottle. Pours reddish brown, lift bubbly head. nose is horse blanket, funk, my dads feet lol, palate is rhubarb, stawrberries, estery stuff. Beautiful mouthfeel and carbonation reminiscent of sparkling burgundy. Very nice !

Poured from 330ml bottle after cellaring for over a year. 

Clear, but very dense, very dark red/mahogany with a thin a khaki head and good lacing. 

Aroma of tart cherries, berries, light funk and a hint of wood. 

Taste is pretty much the same. 

Medium body and medium/high carbonation. 

A very nice balance of sweet and tart makes this beer continuously interesting.

tap. Sweet and sour aroma and flavor, pretty oaky and heavy on the dark fruit\plum aspect more than cherry. While nice, didn¬ít really stand out in the style. Earlier Rating: 9/27/2014 Total Score: 4.2"stumbled upon this on tap at Pangea in Sac w/o realizing it was a wishlist brew! quite sour in smell and taste, with a lot of apple vinegar and sweet cherries and oak. pretty good example of a flemish red. somewhere in the 5% range, but alcohol is definitely irrelevant with such flavorful brews. good stuff."

I love this spl beer with taste of sour like tart cherry. At first sip my lip pucker and I can taste many rock fruit blend of cherry, apricot or even peach. This beer I select from store at recommend from shop owner who know I am a man who like full boost flavour. He tell me this is spl b¬ícoz of aging in barrel like fine wine. I think this is one of my new favourite beer. I wish it have more alcohol b¬ícoz at 5.5% I think this is low boost.

Pours clear red-amber. Poor head retention. Aromas of cherry, dried fruit, medium-intense sourness and a hint of brett. Taste is very slightly sweet, heavily sour, with presence of apple, cherries, and subtle hints of oak lactones. full body, slick feel, average carbonation, long astringent finish. It makes you salivate like hell. Best sour ale I¬íve had so far

pours dark copper-brown color, clear, with creamy off-white biegehead. visually high carbonation. Aroma: intense lactic acid, sour cherry aroma, some green apples, grape...
Flavor: funky; sour cherries, green apples, grape, grapefruit, lime, with notes of honey, vanilla in the backgroud, which steps forward before finish and with long dry acidity in finish.
Body is moderate medium, texture soft, carbonation is medium.

Aroma is dried dark fruits, funk, barn house and earthiness. Taste is sweet malts with heavy sour notes and funk. Finishes with puckering sensations. Appearance is a dark clear amber with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.

On tap at Mekong. Aromas of sharp lemon, red berry fruit. Murky dark red complexion with a mostly fading white head. Dry, sour, acidic. Light-medium bodied.Earlier Rating: 8/3/2014 Total Score: 3.9Aromas of cherry, vanilla, caramel, cola. Hazy red with a mostly lasting khaki head. Tart rounded out nicely by vanilla notes. Light-medium bodied, acidic but smooth, fluffy carbonation.

330ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Clear brown color. Tiny size, white head, stays. Vinegar, sweet, fruity, sake, apples in aroma. Complex aroma. Sour, acidic, fruity, twiggy, sweet in taste. Crisp mouthfeel. Sweet acidic apples and tannins in aftertaste. Nice full body. Very drinkable brew.

330ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut!
Very pleasant sour aroma, gently woody, but not over-oaky, some berry hints. Very sharp palate, lovely sourness, but no vinegar fortunately - this is ageing done correctly. Finish magnificent, the sharp berriness hangs around for ever, and mellows to a lovely sweet red bruin. Balance between sweetness of the base beer and the sourness from the ageing is just right.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2016 Pours dark amber with beige head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sour, fruits, citrus, lemon, some vinegar. Flavor is sour and somewhat sweet, acidic notes, lemon, sour cherries, vinous and slightly woody. Finish is sour cherries with touch of malty sweetness. Overall: good.

Dark reddish amber beer, small off-white head. Nose is fruity, tart, some sugars, red berries. Flavor is tart, dry, woody, berries, fruit. Very tart and dry finish, some citrus, lingering wood and slightly sweet malt. Slightly vinous mouthfeel. Not overly complex bit nocely balanced.
Funky sour smell, ruby red and hazy. Taste is sour and winey, fairly rich body, not too funky, really nice and smooth despite the acidity.

Dark red body with brown reflections; fine bubbles; rather hazy; light beige foam very fine and quickly fading while remaining. Aromas of candied sour cherry, sour apple, woody. In first place, flavors are the same as aromas - delicious; ending is round; a lot of body, with the vividness of sourness. Actually complex and balanced, as indicated by the brewer. Matches very well a pot√©e lorraine.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 23B). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown (BBF 13.10.18). AROMA: moderate-high sour aroma, more forward than a moderate orange and red fruits/wine aroma. APPEARANCE: red body with orange highlights and translucent. moderate ivory head with average retention. TASTE: initial sour and acidic flavor with notes of aged red wine, red wine barrel and faint vanilla from wood. malt notes almost absent. low bitterness with an acidic finish. PALATE: medium-low body with medium carbonation. OVERALL: a red flanders with less fruit and malt presence than other examples, giving more emphasis on the sour profile.
Big fluffy light brown head. Clear dark amber color. Fresch lemon acidity. Apricot aroma. Dry finnish and tiny bitterness.

Rounding out a week of sampling new new world sours, I grabbed an old world one just before departure. Poured warms it is heavily carbonated with that thin head of a good sour, champagne brown body. The aroma reminds me of my tour in the Cantillon brewery some years back - musty, wood, summer heat in a Brussels park. The flavour is an absolute perfect mix of sourness - light and intense citrus, leaves no cloying notes or weird hints of something else. This is the sour to measure all others by - way up there for sure.

Deep red colour and a thin head. Aroma of glac√© cherries, wood and sherry vinegar. First sip is intensely sour but it seems to mellow out slightly later. Fine, intense carbonation. There¬ís just enough sweetness to tone down the sourness. The cherries are not overwhelming either so in the end it¬ís alright.

Bottle from 2014. Best before May 22 - 2017. 

The liquid is clear, mahogny, deep red-brown color with a thin, beige head. 

Nose: Fruity, apples, cherries, oak, vinegar, vanilla and funk. 
Taste: So good! Sour, funk, vinegar, oak, vanilla, red berries, cherries, dried fruit, caramel malt and red apples. 
Mouthfeel: Light, crisp carbonation. Fresh. Tart. Medium body. 

This is a perfect sour beer! Light but very mature. Great, full taste with a deep, oak taste of the 18 months barrel aging. The nose is amazing!

Deep red orange, clear, not many bubbles. Aroma has sour cherry, vanilla. Taste is remarkably juicy - cherry, other red berries. Sour off the bat, easing off into a semi-sweet finish. Bit of a woodsy finish. This is very, very tasty. Ever so slightly syrupy mouthfeel.
Bottle at home, 13th February 16. Pours deep brown red. Aroma is sherry, berry, oak, wood, balsamic. Taste is barrel, balsamic vinegar, sherry, vinous, rounded and delicious. Lovely beer

Robe brune, brillante, tr√®s belle mousse cr√©meuse. Nez puissant et complexe o√π l¬íon retrouve des notes de caramel, de balsamique, de cerise acidul√©e sur un fond de fourrure et de bois. Bouche tout aussi r√©ussie avec une attaque fra√Æche, fruit√©e, acidul√©e, fine bulle et longue finale sur le bois et la cerise. Une superbe "flemish sour ale" typ√©e et complexe.

(Bottle) Reddish brown colour with frothy, beige head. Fruity, sourish nose with oak wood, sour cherries, apples, balsamic vinegar, caramel and pink grapefruit. Fruity, tart taste with notes of oak wood, apples, cherries, caramel, balsamic vinegar, a touch of vanilla, citrus and a tart and dry finish with low bitterness. Medium body, dry. Well made sour ale with a fresh acidity. An excellent example of the style. Lovely beer.
Reddish brown, clear, moderate carbonation. Malty and a tart cherry flavor. Slightly dry.
330ml brown bottle. Reddish brown colour with a small collar of beige foam. Nose has tart cherries. Taste of tart cherries, vinegar, woody, acidic. Sharp and very tasty.

Pour from bottle. Spicy aroma, but complex cherry sour palate. Not fruity per se, but certainly rich and sour. This is a good one.

Dark red in colour with a slight cream head. Tons of vinegar on the nose. Sour and very balanced tangy and a licker of the lips! Totally delicious.

Ruby red colored, medium beige frothy head with nice lacing. Aroma is candy sugar, lots of dried fruits, tart and Brett. Taste is medium sweet dried fruits, brewing sugar, sour cherries, bit oaky, funky, tart, medium sourness, dry finish. Medium bodied, lively carbonation, crisp.

330ml bottle pours a slightly hazy amber color with a finger of off-white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is cherries. Taste is a cherry tartness with a malty sweetness. Medium bodied with generous carbonation. More complex than I can do it justice. This is a world class sour ale that must be tried.

Btl pours hazy red color with a tiny off white head that dissappears quickly leaving no lace on glass. Aromas of apples,berries,vinegar, earth and wood. Tastes of sour apples,grapes,tart cherries and plums. Full body, high carbonation, soft yet effervescent mouthfeel, dry astringent mouth puckering finish. This beer truly has an incredible flavor profile. Almost to many flavors to describe. It is not to sweet as many other sour reds/browns seem to be and that¬ís a good thing. Very pleasing and refreshing beer that will wake up your sensory perceptions. Sour power!

4 oz pour on draft at Spacebar. Clear brownish orange with off-white head. Aromas of grapes, light tart notes. Tastes of red grapes, sweet cherries, light tart acidic notes. Medium body with a dry finish. Nice Flemish sour.

Bottle from JefVerstraete, thanks! Red fruit in abundance - raspberries, redcurrant, cherries (together with the stones), balsamic vinegar, blueberry jam and dark malts. The aroma is nothing short of amazing. Very rich stuff but also very sour and astringent, more so than many lambics that I¬íve drunk. Definitely high quality stuff though.
Olut expo sunday. Pours clear copper with low head. Aroma is red berries, malts, hops. Flavor is sour. Vinegar apple hay.

Bottle. Deep Amber. Sour cherries, some lemon tartness, grape skins, dark malt. Intense and balanced. Excellent.

Small, fizzy, white, fully diminishing head, virtually no lacing. Normal, medium amber body. Moderate malty aroma, with notes of nutty and molasses. Light hoppy aroma. Moderate yeasty aroma, with notes of barnyard and earth. Notes of cherry, red wine and cask wood. Moderate sweet, light bitter, heavy acidic and acetic (vinegar) initial flavor. Average, light sweet, light bitter, heavy acidic and acetic (vinegar) finish. Light to medium body. Watery texture. Lively carbonation. Light alcoholic, moderate astringent finish.

1/2 pint on tap @ One Pint Pub. Pours deep amber with a high off-white head. Aroma is sour malts and some fermented fruits. Flavor is very sour malts, berries, vinegar and some acidic, tarty notes. Great.

(bottle - 330 ml) Dark copper pour with a puffy white head. Heavy tartness in the aroma with some dark fruits and a light sweetness. Big sour cherry flavor at the start with a nice tartness throughout the flavor leading to a sweet and sour finish. [9/11/15]

33 cl bottle @ home. Clear red-brown beer with a small, beige head, bit adhesive. Aroma is tart, sour cherries, wood. Medium to high carbonation. Taste is tart upfront, sour cherries, lemons, but sourness quickly fades to dry and some sweetness. Aftertaste is bit lemony and dry. Very promising start, but too bad that the sourness faded away so quickly.
At the legendary Tornado in San Diego. Mahogany rose with thin head. Tart, acidic, sour cherries... Flavors cascade and layer over the tongue, makes you pucker and smack your lips... Delicious!
From bottle - Thanks Martin! Aroma of red berries, dust, a bit of nail polish remover. Taste is lots of red berries, really sour, a hint of acetone, red currants. This is a way better than expected!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2016 Bottke at home. Pours reddish brown with a white head. Aroma of cherry, sour Berrys, dusty, hint of acetone, musty. Taste is sour cherry, dried fruit, quite vinous, quite sour, woody. Quite complex and sour.

From bottle on board Fridtjofen 24.10.15. Dark ruby. Beige head and lacing. Sour aroma, with hints of berries of the forest, vanilla and brett. Similar taste, with spur cherries. Medium high carbonation. Dry and astringent. Well-balanced, complex and not extreme in any way. Refreshing.

mahgany colour with ruby notes, moderate sized beige-ish head; aroma of citric an woody notes, sour cherry and tart; taste is dominated by citric sourness with sour cherry, tannins, tart and some moderate bittery notes; excellent sour ale

Reddish brown colour with nice head on top. Smallish lacing also. Oh boy, this is sour. And awesome! Aroma has red berries, ripe fruits, extreme sourness and slight roasted feel. Sour red berries, sweet berries. Slight dark fruit flavors. Medium body and very high carbonation. Excellent sour beer!
On tap @ The Craft Bar...Pours a nice dark red with minimal head. Aromas of vinegar, cherries, & wood. Funky sour cherry woody vinous tastes with a great pucker finish.

Bottle @ home. Ramata con riflessi rubino, limpida. Schiuma beige fine di brevissima persistenza. Aroma intenso, fruttato, di frutti rossi, ribes e lampone ed amarene, aceto, polvere, vaniglia e cacao in polvere. Gusto acido, intenso, amabilmente dolce, poco/nulla amaro. Finale lunghissimo. Astringente sulle gengive, spigolosa, calda ma non alcolica. Corposa e di carbonatazione fine ma decisa. Equilibrata ed estremamente armonica.

Crystal clear, deep red-brown, no head. Aroma of sour cherries, wine, oak, balsamico vinegar, burnt sugar, and a hint of vanilla. Taste is incredibly sour; delicious. The mouthfeel is light, and the carbonation is moderate. Long aftertaste with balsamico and wine-like notes.

Bottle at home. Cloudy chestnut brown colour, creamy beige head. Sour cherry and berry fruity, balsamico, tard, vinous, oaky, caramel malty base. Great flavours, especially considering the low abv. Lingering aftertaste, fruity and tard. Good body, medium carbonation.
Clear caramel colour with almost no head. Cherry, wood. Medium sweet, tart and dry finish. soft carbonation, medium body. Well balanced between sweet and sour, very refreshing.
Bottle on Brussel Beer Weekend 2015. The best sour beer I¬íve ever drunk. Very sour and a little sweet begining,good carbonated body and dry and nice end. Very refrrshing and complex beer.

Dark red amber, clear, nice beige head. Light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, tastes of sour berries, dry cider, stone fruits, hints of apple and vanilla. Full body, lively. Very nice, complex, and yet fresh.

Bottle. It poured a dark reddish/amber color with an off-white head. The aroma was of tart dark red fruits, some cherries, oak and acidity. The taste was similar to the aroma with more sourness, tartness, oak, vanilla and cherries. Good stuff.

Bottle, bb 31.03.2018. Pours dark amber - red, clear, with nice yellowish head. Aromas of sourness, fruits, some cherries. Taste is moderately sour, quite dry almost no bitterness. Lively carbonated, medium bodied.

330 ml bottle, as Cuv√©e des Jacobins Rouge, brewed by Brouwerij Bockor. BB date 26.08.14. From Vinmonopolet, Nettbutikken. ABV is 5.5%. Deep reddish brown colour, moderate off-white head. Aroma of oak, red wine, red wine vinegar and brettanomyces / farmhouse. Sweet and sour flavour, notes of red wine vinegar, sour cherries and lemon. Don¬ít think I¬íll buy this one again.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2015 One of my absolute favourites, especially given how cheap it is in my area -- the bang for the buck ratio is insane. Dark red with a nice whitish head. Aroma: a bit weak initially, but gets stronger after a few minutes in the glass; cherries, light smoke, vanilla, fruity, somewhat funky. Medium body. Sweet-sour taste, sour cherries, plums, hints of vanilla. Vinous. Strong dry finish. Overall: very enjoyable, balanced and complex.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2017 [7378-20150711] 330mL bottle. Fruity light malt aroma. Clear, bright amber brown body with a quick foamy off-white head. Fruity malt and toasted sour yeast flavour with a lingering aftertaste. Medium body is fairly sour. Interesting. (7/3/7/3/15) 3.5
(c/o tuqueboy)

[9003C-20170127] 330mL bottle. Light malty vinegar herbs aroma. Clear, golden amber brown body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Soured barrel and fruity raspberry vinegar flavour. Medium-full body is fairly sour. Good. (7/4/8/4/15) 3.8
(c/o KoryV, w/ him, jercraigs)
Overheard: "Hey Kory, are you stupid? ... Unfathomably stupid?" "No." "Are you fathomably stupid?"

Dark, tawny-amber color, with a reddish glow in the light. Good clarity. Thin tan foam quickly dissipates to a ring. The aroma hits the nose as it is being poured. Very intense, dominant tart cherry and raspberry notes, with hints of ripening. Touches of oak, faint herbal hops, a bit of earthy funk. Awesome aroma. 

Strong cherry fruit character in the taste as well, moderately tart, but balanced slightly by a vanilla caramel sweetness. The flavor doesn¬ít seem too heavy on the oak. Alcohol seems low. The carbonation is just strong enough for the style, and the body has a touch of syrup-like character but is mostly clean with a light to medium thickness. 

Overall a very nice example of the style. The flavor is quite intense and enjoyable. While the light sweetness gives a good balance, it hangs slightly in the finish, and I think I would have preferred it to lean even further in the sour direction. Perhaps a few more months in the bottle would round it out nicely.

Bottle from Systembolaget
herbs, caramel, woody, cherries, tart,red, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,
bottle from Bi√®rerie Illkirch-Graffenstaden. Red-brown colour, beige head. Malty start with an omnipresent fruity sourness, not too sour to be unpleasant, though. Quite well balanced.

Bottle at vjohans Summer tasting. 
Pours redish and clear. 
Synthetic cherry, tart and sweet.

Bottle.
Dee red, white head.
aroma sour, cherry, caramel, lambic feeling
Sour, cheery and Carmel, strawberry.
Nice!
Amazing aroma of red wine, cherries, pours a reddish brown color not much head. Amazing taste, fruit, hints of cognac and wine with a tart sour finish, medium body.
Bottle from Saveur Bi√®re. Almost no head. Red/copper body. Smells of sour apple, yeast, cherry. Tastes very sour and fresh, apple, cherries. Sour finish.

Bottle from SB 150718.
Pours a dark copper with a beige head. Very complex aroma and palate with sour cherries, red wine, vanilla, oak, prunes and a heavy but very nice sourness. I love it!

Taste this many times first @ home on nov. 2011.
Brown reddish color, with good beige head.
Aroma: sour, woods, wine touch ?,dark red fruits.
Taste: very great old brown !, fruits (aplles, red fruits, oak, lovely sour,.

Bottle..Pour is copper with a cream head..Nose is funk, cherries, spice, wet oak,dark fruits...Taste is soggy oak, wet oak, spice, funk. cherries, dark fruits..love it

On tap the the Republic in Minneapolis. 
Deep red-brown body; clear with a thin head that soon reduced to a ring. 
I had a typical reaction to this in that the aroma was a bit unappealing but the flavor was good However, in this case the aroma was nearly neutral (but too much ¬ívinegar¬í) and the flavor was very good. Nicely tart and moderately fruity,

DRAFT at Bad Apple in Chitown. Short pour with brown / red body. Bitter / sour nose....tart cherry and caramel. Taste is a wonderful sour. Definitely a GREAT beer.

12 oz draft pours hazy brown with a off white head. Aroma of fruit, oak and malts. Taste is malts, fruit, vanilla and tart.

Puckkker power! That is a nice Flemish Sour Red. Pours a clear red-brown with a bit of white head that reduces to a ring, which sticks around because it just doesn¬ít want to leave this poor beer alone. The nose is all sour goodness of grapes, wine, a little vinegar and a touch of cherries. Big sour taste, very sharp, but with wine, cherries and a lemon. 330ml bottle from LCBO, Parkway Mall, Scarborough, ON. 5.5 % alc. / vol. Pours a clear deep amber color with a small white head which recedes to a ring. Bottle - 330ml. Dark copper body with ruby glints and an average off-white foamy head. Nice malty/hoppy aroma with fruity and oaky hints. Its robust sour taste carries fruity and woody notes. Ends with a long, strong sour finish. Awesome Flemish Ale.
Draft to taster at craft and social pour dark copper with thin white head. Nose sweet malt and moderate tart sour. Taste tart sour up front, then sweet malt.  Mostly reasonable sour.

Real ¬íOud Bruin¬í... almost perfect!! 
Nice head, perfect colour, incredible nose, ...
full strength tartness, perfect carbonation, hint of vanilla, nice blend of sour cherries and wood tannins in the mouthfeel...
Has all the characteristics of a flemish sour ale...
Lacking a little bit of depth and fullness to its¬í taste but otherwise... no comments.
A 4 star beer in my book for sure!!

33cl bottle. Clear amber red with a thin ring of white foam. Flavors are vanilla, cherry, apples and oak with fruity and acetic notes. Strong acidity. Light to medium body, soft carbonation, slick texture.

Pours reddish amber with a small beige head. The aroma has cherries, vinegar, cream, lemons, vanilla, mild oak and some smooth malt. It has a fairly light body with a crisp bite and some mild carbonation. The flavor starts with sharp berries, strawberries, cherries, oak, peppery spice, lemon acidity and mild apple cider vinegar. All of that is offset with smooth malt, oak and vanilla. The finish keeps the nice balance with the pepper, acidity and cherries staying up in the front. Excellent.

330ml bottle from the LCBO in Peterborough, Ontario. Deep amber in colour with a thin off white head, good lacing. The aroma is of cherries, wood, a bit of vanilla. The flavour is of tart cherries, berries, wood, acidic. Finishes long, some sweetness turning tart. Very good.

Bottle at home. Pours a murky brown with light brown head that fades quickly. Aroma is complex, leather, dried fruit, faint tart apples and wood. Taste is cherry, tart Apple, moderately sour, faint vanilla. Pleasant aftertaste. Medium body, full carbonation, a bit of effervescent feel. Moderate acidity. Very nice beer, well developed flavor and not just a vinegar bomb.
Pours crystal clear ruby red in color with very slight head pinkish-white. Aroma has some cranberry, cherry. Taste is smooth, with intense sour and fruitiness.

Aroma: sour, winey, barnyard
Appearance: clear amber-ruby, tan head
Taste: heavily sour, light sweetness, cherries
Palate: medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish

Flaska. Konjaksf√§rgad med ett litet smutsvitt skum som snart f√∂rsvinner. Dofter av k√∂rsb√§r, j√§st, jord och nejlika. Smakinslag av k√∂rsb√§r, citrus, julkryddor och tr√§. Torr munk√§nsla, fruktig avslutning. Njutning!
On tap at Madison Craft Beer Week. Aaaanddd, it¬ís good. Dark red brown body. Cherry oak aroma. Big tart cherry flavor with hints of vanilla and oak.
LCBO bottle BB 13.01.18. Pours a clear deep-brown red. Nose is fresh and sour, berries and some wood. Taste follows the nose. Sour, fruity, wood, vanilla. Crisp, dry and quenching.

Decent malty background some cherry tartness, oak, caramel, dried fruits, kinda light roastiness. Moderate sourness with moderate to light sweetness, quite dry finish. Refreshing and highly enjoyable sipper.
Smells weird, kind of like a typical sour red mixed with minerals. Taste is pretty sour with intense lactic and acetic sourness. Medium sharp carbonation with light to medium body.

330ml bottle from trade with JefVerstraete. Many thanks! Pours a deep red with bubbly pink head. Simply gorgeous. Perfectly balanced with a soft fruitiness, robust sourness and cheek sucking tartness. An absolute joy to savour.
Very sour balsamic smell. Appearance is flat and black. Palate is sour yet even. Taste is very nice vinegar and sourness. Excellent!

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 Taster at whole foods. Pretty great sour. Complex and balanced with a pleasantly sour finish. Pours a pleasant warm hued reddish brown. Definite warmth from the oak and vanilla and nice fruit notes (cherry, raspberry) round it out. Caramel, green apple and a dose of vinegar. Plays the balance card perfectly. One to drink and ponder. Note to self- buy some quality aged cheese and pair with this. 
 1/26/2017   Bottle while redoing shifter cables on road bike.   Enjoyed just as much as first time around.  Really sour and complex.   Delicious.

On tap at trio on the outer banks in North Carolina it is an amber color with a slight head. The aroma is sour cherry and the taste is a strong sour flour that finishes like a tart green apple Not bad since I am not a fan of sour beers
On draft at Trio in Kill Devil Hills NC. Pours a clear amber with an ecru head. Tart cherry nose. Flavors of sour apple and cocoa. Sour finish.
Medium Dark Reddish color and nearly clear with a little head. Strong cherry aroma. Cherry less noticeable in the flavor but still there. This is a sour beer for people who like sour.

Pours clear deep chestnut brown with a medium beige head, excellent retention. Aromas of tart cherry, citrus, plum, caramel, and bread. Medium light body, gentle carbonation. Moderate sweetness, strong puckering sour, very little bitter finish. Delicious!

Bottle 0.33l at Cika Alberto in Pozarevac after Boban Tasting in Vranovo Serbia.01.04.2015.Taste with my bro ippopotamo36!Bottle aging in Pozarevac for few months.Bought at De Hopduvel Ghent Belgium.Pour it reddish color with small white head.On the nose dusty cherry.Taste and aroma of cherry, sour little bit annoying, but ok all together is not bad.Maybe is after so many beers this was not a moment to try.
R√∂tlich, braun. In der Nase Beeren, Balsamico, Holznoten, dunkler Zucker, Apfel. Am Gaumen Balsamico, sehr sauer, Himbeeren, Zitron, Holz, Beeren, etwas unterkarbonisiert. Sehr gut.
Bottle from Whole Foods in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is wine, vinegar, green apples. Taste is raspberries, dry oak, currants, vinegar. A quality Flemish sour.

Brownish red colour, low crown. Sour, winelike smell. Pleasant feel, much taste of red currant, wine, green Apples. A bit of vinegar, but well balanced. Nice, lasting aftertaste of vinegar and currants. Very pleasant with and after good food, or desserts.

0,33 bottle courtesy of markoijelena from Belgium. Thank you man. In Pozarevac-Serbia. Pours reddish Amber clear with ivory foamy head. Nose: little vinegar far away, strawberries, sour notes. Mouth: extremely tart in a way, red fruit, syrupy with a sour overall palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The smell is sour and berries. The flavor is citrus, berries and some sweetness. Good bitterness in the aftertaste that fills the front of the mouth forever. Not so hard to be a sour beer. More right, I think. Good anyway. Follow me @ Kung av √∂l @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 9/30/2014. Pours crystal clear deep ruby red/brown color with a 1-2 finger dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big sour cherry, raspberry, cranberry, green apple, red wine vinegar, hay, straw, caramel, toast, light cocoa, oak, leather, musty funk, light pepper, and yeast/oak earthiness. Fantastic complexity and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, dark malt, and oak barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of big sour cherry, raspberry, cranberry, green apple, red wine vinegar, hay, straw, caramel, toast, light cocoa, oak, leather, musty funk, light pepper, and yeast/oak earthiness. Large amount of acidic sourness on the finish; with lingering notes of sour cherry, cranberry, raspberry, green apple, red wine vinegar, hay, straw, caramel, toast, leather, musty funk, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, dark malt, and oak barrel flavors; with a nice sweetness/sourness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, and acidic mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely incredible Flanders red ale! All around fantastic complexity and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, dark malt, and oak barrel flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink even with the high level of acidity. An insanely delicious offering.

Bottle a red brown colored beer with a white head aroma malts spicy fruits berries raspberries red fruits some candy and sourness flavor malts spicy berries raspberries red fruits some sweetness some candy and a sourness aftertaste

Draft to taster at Dutch¬ís. Pours a clear dark reddish amber color with a small off white head of fine bubbles. The aroma and flavor have tart dark red fruit, cherry, oak, some vinous character, some acidity, solid sour red/brown that carries enough tart/sour character while still being drinkable.

from beerplanet.eu clear brown amber, small light brown head.sweet vineagra aroma. wild notes, faint rubbery notes. flavor is tart vinegar, wood, faint boozy note, has aged quite well (bottle was bought in 2012) fine sour belgian.

Attractive ruby red with copper highlights, a tan, one-finger head that lasts a few minutes before vanishing in true lambic form.
The nose is vinegar, sour cherries and hints of vanilla oak. The palate doubles down on the vinegar, with suggestions of celery, cucumbers and peaches joining the cherries, along with acid and traces of leather.
It¬ís sour without being mouth-puckering, with a pleasantly slick feel. But it also gets in its own way. There¬ís underlying sugar that doesn¬ít compliment the sourness so much as fight through it. And the vinegar becomes more pronounced with aeration, diminishing the potentially nice palate.
This is certainly OK, but a trifle disappointing.

Bit hazy ruby, foggy head and lacing ring, tiny sparkling. Nice sour aroma with red berries (cherry, red currant), bit funky, wood. Sour, starts sweet but dries, light body, long sour finish with berries. Really tasty, sourness gives refreshing effect to this, good balance, natural feel.

Bottled. Quite much red colour with a mediumsized reddish beige head. Aroma is dry wood, some mild sweetness as well as some vanilla, cherries and some sourness too. Flavour is very similar, but in a very nice balance, also has some slight yeasty and earthy notes. Somewhat dry palate. Very pleasant Flemish sour.
Bottle at Carsten. Clear red. Aroma medium malty (caramel, barrel, fruity). Flavor medium sweet and acidic. Medium body.

330 ml bottle
Mahogany brown to ruby red clear beer with some beige head. Aroma has lambicish sour vinegar with light amounts of cherry, oak and sugary sweetness. Flavor is very sour with vinegar, gastric acid and woodiness. Palate is medium full with heavy carbonation. Finish has medium bite of bitterness. Aftertaste is very sour with vinegar and gastric acid, also sugary sweet with some oaky woodiness.  There¬ís some good aromas and flavors but the sourness overpowers everything.

Serving: from bottle--purchased at The Beer Junction.

Aroma: light peach aroma.

Appearance: Very thin, fizzy, off-white initial head that disappeared within seconds and no lacing. Clear, dark-orange body.

Taste: heavily sour cherry initial flavor and heavily sour cherry, leathery finish with short duration.

Bottle @Albion. Pours amber red with very small beige foamy head that disappears immediately, cheesy aroma, sour taste, medium carbonation, long sour finish. Quite enjoyable sour brew.
Very intense sour flavor. Not my cup of tea. A big vinegar presence is noticed with each sip. Will pass on this one.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Poured into a snifter. Pretty clear red brown color with a small, quickly dissipating head. Nose is sour raspberrys, sweet malts, oaky vanilla. Very nice. Taste is sweet rapsberry jam, sour berries, lots of vanilla oakiness. It¬ís the most sour flanders I¬íve had, but oh how fine it is. Would appreciate a bit more funk though.

Aroma is wine, cherries and tart red fruits of your choice. The taste is really sour, with red currants and cherries up front and underneath is an earth tone that makes me think about leather and wood. I¬ím thinking of not grading sours at all, cause it fucks up my system, but for good measure...

Flaska fr√•n SB. Brun, svart rostig f√§rg med gyllengul skumkrona. Syrlig frisk doft av r√∂da b√§r. Frisk, stram, syrlig kropp med bra kolsyra. Kraftfull smak av r√∂da vinb√§r, sura nappar belgoj√§st och stall.

Bottle shared 30/4/14. Pours slightly hazy auburn deep ruby, small head dies. Nose of sour cherry, sour apple, cheesy tartness, red wine, deep caramel. Tastes almost light sweet deep caramel, heavy sour, cherry, green apple, red wine, red wine vinegar, balsamic, tart cheese, some funk, buttery oak. Medium light body, slightly sharp carb, looooong finish full of all that sour and slightly sweet fruit. Delicious, a really nice ¬íbetween styles¬í beer.

Bottle. Amber, hazy, small and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, sourness and some cherry fruitiness. Body is light to medium, malty and dry flavor, sourness and light cherry fruitiness. Finish is short to average, malty and dry, sour with light cherry fruitiness, light valinna (oak). Could use more body to balance sourness.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2015 Ruby-mahogany with thin, fine yellow-caramel-dust head that sticks around. Slow rate of decay. Pleasant island of head. Aroma is vinous, light caramel/toffee, light acetic acid (balsamic), touch of old cedar, touch of strawberry. Body is is medium-light-to-light, lightly syrupy-watery with moderate carbonation, semi-creamy. Flavor is light balsamic (fruity berry strawberry variety) under a touch of caramel sweetness and a blanket of tannins (very winelike in this respect). Finish is all pucker and no bitter, still, acetic is not overly present or harsh. Crisp finish. An excellent Flemish sour! Perhaps could use more complexity in the flavor. Just light enough to allow the whole bottle to go down without misgivings about the intensity of sourness.
It¬ís very cool. Very rich and powerful sour! Wine notes are felt. Great sour beer.

I feel that with a slightly sweeter beer this would acquire that body I love about the Flemish reds. I would take this over Bourgogne des Flandres any time, though.

The pure, lambic-like ¬ífoederbier¬í from Bockor, normally used for the production of their fruit beers. Loose, snow white foam, warm golden colour, cloudy.
