text: Brown-orange color with a big persistent foam collar. Aromas of wild yeasts, sour, wood and red fruits. Flavors of wild yeasts sour, red fruits and wood. Couleur brune-orang√©e, beau col de mousse persistant. Nez de levures sauvages, "sour", bois et fruits rouges. Saveurs de levures sauvages, "sour", fruits rouge et bois.

Sampled on draft at Hou Thou this beer poured a dark plum-red-brown with a small foamy off white head that left good lacing. The aroma was sour, malt vinegar and tart berries. The flavor was red wine vinegar, very sour, soy sauce and berries. Long tart berry and vinegar finish. Medium body. Decent.

Aroma of cherries and some raspberry jam with a hint of tin foil. Appears a dark ruby red with a thin ring of foam and a little lace. Taste is slightly bitter up front of hay and some toasty oak that quickly slides into a strong sour cherry followed by a lingering slight vinegar taste which is all complimented with a nearly hidden sweet vanilla in the background. Palate is fizzy and mouthfilling, very nice. Overall, good.
UPDATED: MAY 13, 2015 Tap. Dark blood red. Bit of lingering head. Very sour nose. Mild vinegar, strong cherry notes. Refreshing.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a clear, dark red-brown with a short lived head and no lace. Aroma is tart, cherry and light oak. Taste of tart, cherry skin attack with oily palate and a sour finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

U: klar vackert koppar/brunr√∂d smutsvitt gulnat skum. 
D: s√∂tsyrlig doft med balsamvin√§ger, vingummin, r√∂d gele, ekfat, lite kn√§ck och choklad. 
S: s√∂tsur med balsamvin√§ger, vitvinsvin√§ger, mustade √§pplen, r√∂da str√§va b√§r,ek, lite karamell. 
M: medelstor till st√∂rre med mjuk kolsyra och en len och lite fet/oljig textur. 
T: skitbra flemish red, men lite f√∂r mycket vitvinsvin√§ger f√∂r att det ska bli topp.

From BA review on 2-19-12 - 
Poured from bottle into chalice style glass

Appearance ¬ñ A deep red-brown color which formed a moderate head upon pouring. There was a bit of lacing on the sides of the glass upon the loss of the head.

Smell ¬ñ A sour cherry aroma hits you up front and persists throughout the aroma. Toward the end a more vinegary aroma mixes in to the sour cherry.

Taste ¬ñ A nice sour cherry taste meets the tongue. The taste matches the smell quite nicely, and as soon after the sour cherry hits, a bit of more vinegary/acetic acid taste comes into play. It leaves a very bitter and sour taste on the tongue. While sour and bitter it is surprisingly very nice.

Mouthfeel ¬ñThe sourness mixed with the bit higher level of carbonation which when combined make it a a slower drinking beer. The thickness is rather moderate, but again, due to its sour nature, it is one to sip and enjoy over the long haul.

Overall ¬ñ A nice dryer sour. It has lots of sour cherry flavor and some nice aromas. A good slow sipping light abv. brew.

Poured into a tulip (the glass, not the flower), this ale displayed a reddish brown body with a bubbly tan head. The aroma is sour cherries (stems ¬ín¬í all) and some rust. The flavor is tangy with the cherries and also seems to carry a splash of vinegar. Sour and refreshing, this is a very nice beer.
Cherry, some cocoa, tart but with semi-sweet finish, mahogany hue, refreshing, great representation of the style.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2014 Welch¬ís grape juice on the nose. Deep ruby red in color (might have been lighting in the pub I was at). Minimal frothy white head. Mouthpuckering sourness up front, tasting of sweet tarts: little sour cherry, some bitter chocolate, oak. Finishes incredibly smooth with plum and apple cider flavors. Crazily complex. Palate: refreshing carbonation with a light body. Finishes long....
Dark reddish brown, beige head. Red berries like cherries, lemon juice, green apple, vinegar, tart, some wood. Refreshing.

Pours a beautiful red color with low off-white head. Aroma of cherry, redcurrant, red wine barrels, light tart brett. Taste is medium tart and fruity with lingering sweet finish. Light, crisp body with average carbonation.
Tap at the Coffee District. Reddish brown pour with a white head. Vinegar aromas. Tart with sour cherries, vinegar, and malty notes. Average body and mouthfeel.

Location: Draft at Mekong, 5/2/14


Aroma: The nose is vinegar, sour yeast, and fruit, with some woody and malt notes

Appearance: It pours a mahogany color with an off-white colored head on it

Flavor: The flavor is heavy vinegar, plenty sour, with some tart fruit and yeast/spice notes

Palate: The body is medium, but it doesn¬ít have a great drinkability or mouthfeel for me

Overall Impression: 
I¬ím surprised I never rated this one, so here it is now. This isn¬ít my favorite type of beer within this style just due to the overwhelming vinegaryness of the flavor, and personally not quite loving that type of sour. Still, I can appreciate this one, even if it isn¬ít totally for me.

The bottle from SB cons 2014-05-06 G√∂teborg
AR: kriek sorbe, tartness 
AP: dark ruby/mahogny, wee fizzy ofwhite head
F: sparkling carbonation, kriek sorbe, cherry seeds roughness, white american oak, a hint of vanilla, Tom Collins extract, tart
Amber coloured and clear. Has an off-white head, lasting. Heavy acidic aroma, yeasty, breatt and fruits. Flavor starts acidic with light sugar sweetness, cherries? Lightly syrupy texture.
light barnyard and cherry aroma,golden, red, clear, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, light sour soft cherry finish.
Bottle. Reddish colour with a beige head. Sour, fruity, earthy, vinegar, cherries, oak, vanilla. Need I say more? Lovely stuff!
UPDATED: NOV 6, 2016 330ml bottle. Dark mahogany body with a brief medium head. Tart, dried plums, blackcurrant leafs.

Bottle 3 at Tool Tasting Night from Cotteridge Wines; dark copper pour with a frothy off white head, light vinegar and fruit aroma, taste is glorious juicy fruit really complex, right amount of lip puckering sour backed up with cherry and apple, some woody action and a dry mouthfeel.

APPEARANCE: clear red beer, small stable off white head.
NOSE: cherries, sour, wood.
TASTE: cherries, sour, balanced, decent!
@ZBF; sour, wild yeast, wood, old cask, sour bitter. cherry, fruity, sourness gives a real kick in the end. great old brown. love this.
Dunkel r√∂tlichbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch sauer, fruchtig, Geschmack s√§uerlich, reife Fr√ºchte.

How: Bottle.
Where: From Systembolaget, had at home.
Appearance: Amber colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Fruit, vinegar, sour, cherry, berries, citrus.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Vinous, sour, cherry, grapefruit.

(Bottle). Clearly tangy scent with a not entirely pleasant aroma of citrus and toilet cleaners. The taste is fresh and tangy with flavors of fruit, cherries, barrel aging and citrus. Not really a beer in my taste but even I¬ím impressed. A really good and nice beer in its style.

Bottled. Pours clear, dark red-brown with a short head and minimal lace. Aroma is cherry and light oak. Has an unpleasant earthy vomit-like funk. Lets call that cheese. Very tart cherry skin attack with sticky-oily palate and a sour finish that goes and goes.

Rated Easter at apt Buffalo ny (Marys first easter). Pours a deep red with a foamy head. Aromas of sour cherry, candy apple, cask imperssions, light fruitiness and some tartness. Flavors highly sour with smooth barrel cognac impressions, and green candied apple. Flavors follow with a big tartness. What a journey this beer has been through during those 18+ months. Don¬ít find to much sweetness but a crisp tartness that fades quickly in the finish. The dark cherries show through differently in the nose than the palate but are the dominant flavor and aroma besides the tart sour. Well done attractive looking brew.

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Pours a clear amber fluid with some head that quickly fades away. Lots of red berries, some vanilla and balsamico on the nose. Taste is nicely balanced, not overly acidic like some other sour reds. I get cherries, almonds, vanilla and some earthy leathery notes. Very enjoyable.

Pours mahogany with low disappearing off white head
Aromas of raspberries, cherries, caramel malts, hints of bicarbonate
Very nice taste full of red fruits, citrus, sour yeast

April 16, 2014 - on tap at Hollander. Clear reddish brown pour with some head. Aroma was fruity, sweet and a bit sour. Taste was consistent with aroma, but a bit heavier on the sour. Smooth and easy drink.

Bottle. Clear red amber beer with a medium sized beige head. Aroma is spicy with notes of acidic pears, apples, cherries and woody vanilla. Flavor is fruity with notes of cherries, vanilla, wood and leather. Really great.

M√∂rk b√§rnstens f√§rgad med ett orange-brunt skum som snabbt faller. Doft: Funk, reng√∂ringsmedel, tr√§, r√∂da b√§r, √§ppelmust. Smak: Funk, tr√§, omogna krusb√§r och √§ppel kart, v√§l lagrad balsamvin√§ger, lite sockerkaka. Koncentrerad, god smak.

Bottle. Pours a clear reddish dark brown color with a small off white head on it. Nose is definitely sour with a little malt and oak peaking through to complement the sourness. Taste is very sour, but has a few hints of sweetness throughout. Very pleasant drink.

Bi√®re absolument surcot√©e sur le site¬†!! D¬íailleurs la cote belge la plus haute est √† 4,4
ce qui veut dire 88 au grand maximum, et non pas 99¬†!!! Ceci change tout ...
Certes la fermentation spontan√©e et le m√ªrissement pendant 18 mois en f√ªt de ch√™ne
constituent des proc√©d√©s de fabrication tr√®s respectables, et m√™me dirons-nous originaux
et contraignants, mais ceci ne donne pas un laisser-passer au niveau de la d√©gustation¬†!!!
Le brasseur d√©finit sa bi√®re comme une bi√®re acide complexe.
Couleur roux vineux assez joli.
Clart√© nette. Bulles fines nombreuses partout, pas mal vives.
Mousse beige qui tombe et nappe.
Ar√¥mes de f√ªt de vin, vinaigre de vin, lierre, vigne vierge, pointe de piment d¬íEspelette.
1√®re bouche assez liquide sur une aigreur de vin (entendez un vinaigre), avec une pointe
de muscade.
Arri√®re-bouche assez vineuse, f√ªt ancien, pomme, cerise du Nord.
2√®me o√π la cerise du Nord et la pomme verte passent en avant.
Arri√®re-bouche de f√ªt de ch√™ne.
3√®me avec un fondu un peu plus important, mais nettement sur l¬íacide.
Arri√®re-bouche sur du fruit rouge, airelle, groseille rouge jeune.
La longueur n¬íapporte rien d¬íautre, aigreur, acidit√©, avec un peu de muscade et de moutarde (?!)
La levure est absente (fermentation spontan√©e).
L¬íalcool est banal¬†: 5,5 % abv. Il ne peut aider en rien.
La finale pourrait faire pleurer (comme les oignons quand on les p√®le...) et pour cause...
CONCLUSION¬†: si vous aimez un verre d¬íacide ayant la couleur du vin rouge (jeune) d¬íun
banal vigneron de quartier, alors plongez sur la Jacobins rouge, mais de gr√¢ce arr√™tez de lui
donner des cotes de Ch√¢teau Margaux. Comprenne qui pourra ...
Fint skum som l√§gger sig snabbt . M√∂rkr√∂d. Sur! Lite k√∂rsb√§rstoner. God.

Bottled:Eye: Clear, deep orangey red with a mid-sized head.Nose: Sour cherries, rhubarb, lingon berries.Mouth: Sour and lively.Tongue: Sour cherries, sour grapefruit, oak barrels. Brain:Sour and delicious. I¬íve had lambics that were less sour than this one!
Bottle from a friend. Dark ruby color, white head. Sour taste with cherry, tart, tannins, oak, acidic notes and vanilla. Sour finish with cherry, vanilla and oak. Excellent flemish sour ale.

Bottle. Pours a red-brown color with a finger high off white coloured head. Sweet and vinous aroma with notes of balsamico and strawberries. Taste starts out sour and ends sweet with heavy notes of green apple and strawberries. Medium dryness. Also small notes of balsamico and wood. A nice, light sour that may not be the most complex beer; but is on the other hand very drinkable.
12oz bottle. Similar characteristics to wine. Natural carbonation.. Sour and aged taste. Fruit flavor like plum or berry. Not a fan of sours.. So don¬ít judge me.
bottle. Poured a clear dark amber-red with a thin tan top that quickly dissipated. Taste of cherry, wood, vinegar, tart, and quite sour. Medium carbonation, medium body
nice sour, taste and aroma of sour cherries with a slight oak background sourness lingers forever in a good way
3 finger beige head, red-amber. Nose: Barnyard, raspberry, vinegar, cherry and balsamic. Aroma: Vinegar, raspberry, strawberry, woody notes, balsamic and cherry. Long, sour ending.
Ruby/rust pour. No head to speak of. Aroma of green apple, wild sour berries, sweet caramel. Very sour taste, some malt sweetness in the back. Medium body.

1- dark fruit, cherry, plum no hop characte2- 
2- dark red burgundy, no head, quite still
3- cherries, almonds, cough syrup, some caramel sweetness
4- medium body, acidic aftertaste
5- overall a very nice example pf a Flanders Red. I would have liked a little bit more malt sweetness to balance the acidity.
On draft at The Ginger Man, NYC. A sophisticated blend of old lambic, oak and sour funk. Mild sweetness balances the sour flavors with oak. Lingering finish. Very nice!
Fruktig, syrlig, kanske k√∂rsb√§r? Kraftig i smaken, lite vagare i aromen. Fint r√∂d/brun i kroppen.

@ Vino Bellissimo / Lima OH --- Clear very dark amber, nice 2" head that drops to a full off-white cover in 2-3 minutes. Taste is malt with a bit of sour cherry, pear, and maybe a little vanilla that turns beautifully sour in a lingering finish. An exceptional sour ale, maybe the best I¬íve encountered.
Jajam√§n, det har var en riktigt trevlig upplevelse. Smaken var fint balanserad och komplex med toner av syra och b√§r. Som sagt, en trevlig upplevelse det h√§r.
Excellent to-style Flemish sour. Cherry meat and pits with notes of oak and a sublime light vinegar tartness. Truly a great beer.
Dark red, quite clear. Sour cheeries in aroma and taste. Nice sourness, fresh, really good!

Gift from Rune, bbf my50th anniv., thanks man! 
Brown bottle 33cl pours a light beige 2-finger head
that makes some lacings, on the ruby-copper clear body.
Sour grapes, grass, some malts, winey stuff, to the nose.
Sour berries as redcurrant to the tongue, sour green apple, fruit wine stuff. 
High carbonation disturbs me a little.
There is some bread in the finish, under the dominant now sweeter redcurrant juice.
I guess it is meant to be this way, acc2the style. 
Nevertheless, I don¬ít know this style, so my points are probably very subjective.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Spare off-white head and amber-coloured. Aroma is dominated by raspberry, brown sugar, vanilla and vinegar. Palate-feel is lively and chalky.

Lovely ruby red with almost no head. Smells of tart cherries. Tart cherry and vanilla on the front and more darker flavors like cocoa (yeah I read it first and the power of suggestion is strong) at the end. Mild effervescent with a tannin like dry finish.
Flaske fra SB S√§len. R√∏d/brun, nesten uten skum. Masse kullsyre, aroma av kirseb√¶r, frukt og grape. Smaken er veldig syrlig - eddik og sitrus/grape. Lang, syrlig ettersmak. God!

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Mahogany red with no head. Vinegar, some caramel, vinegar again. Taste is for me way too sour, and sour in the wrong way. It¬ís sherry vinegar with some input of cognac / cherries.
Red brown color with no head. Sour fruity aroma, vinager. Acidic taste with lots of fruit, sweet.

Draft @ De Klein Duyvil. Cherry red, little white head, no lacing. Aroma is typical sour- vinegary, but also fruity, of cherries. Flavor is much the same. Quite sharp, nicely carbonated, with a lasting soureness that bites the palate. Nicely complex sour. Really good.

Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. CLear reddish brown, brief beige head. Fruity red berries aroma with some wood and vinegar. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Semi dry with a bit overwhelming acetic acidity.

Pours cloudy burgundy with a large, quickly settling off-white head. Aroma is cherries, tartness, figs, red wine, slight red fruit and vanilla. Taste is sour cherries, red currant, tartness, slight roasted notes, vanilla. Mouthfeel is crisp and dry. Aftertaste is cherries and slight funk. Very good!

330ml brown bottle, poured into a tulip glass. Appearance is clear dark red with a small beige head, that reduced quickly leaving no lacing. Aroma of ripe apples, red currants and table grapes. Flavour of green apples, red currants, table grapes, cherries, vinegar and oak wood character. Taste is light sweet, light bitter and heavy sour. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and soft carbonation. Overall a great beer with strong complex flavours, refreshingly light on sweetness and with a striking sourness.

March 10, 2014. 330mL bottle from LCBO. Aroma of sour cherries, grapes, apples. Lovely reddish brown colour. Tart apple and cherry flavour with a touch of sweetness and lingering bitterness. Smooth. Very nice.

Draft at Meadhall in Cambridge, MA. Tulip. Pours a deep, almost sparkling red with a pinkish thin head. Aroma is sour cherries, yeasts, oak barrel, and other fruit. Taste is mostly sour, dry cherries with some other fruits coming through as well. You get the oak barrel at the finish. Moderately to heavy tartness and a clean taste all around. Finishes almost dry, but refreshing. Moderate carbonation, light body.

Bortled from Systembolaget
Deep copper with a small head. 
Sweet and sour aroma and flavour; vinegar and brown sugar. 
Rather fresh and tart.

Pours a beautiful burgundy with low off-white head. Aroma of cherry, redcurrant, red wine barrels, bretta. Taste is medium tart and fruity with lingering sweet finish. Light, crisp body with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Blood red with little head. Pungent bittery sweet scent consisting of red wine and dried fruit (particularly cherry). Heavy and quite sour, with a mild lingering bitterness and fizz. Cherry flavour certainly present, dried fruit, raisin. Good.
Bottled. Pours amber with a small light brown head. Smells sour, candy malt, fruity, nuts. Tastes sour, dry hoppy, green apples, vinegar with a sour vinegar finish.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2015 Flaska fr√•n systembolaget. B√§rnstensf√§rgad v√§tska med minimalt skum. Syrlig doft av √§pple j√§sta k√∂rsb√§r och kryddor. M√∂jligen √§ven arrak Frisk och h√§rligt syrlig smak bla √§pplekart . V√§l kolsyrad med en trevlig str√§vhet

Aroma: Smelling of vinegar, apple, red fruits and stable.Appearance: A clear chestnut colored beer. A off-white head with small lacing and some curtains.Taste: Tasting sweet fruit bread, red sour marmalade and rhubarb peel.Palate: Medium low carbonation, a soft texture. A medium body with a good dry finish.Overall: In all very rewarding, sour, complex, refreshing.Note: Bottle 330 ml at home. Reviewed 2014-03-14.
UPDATED: MAR 15, 2014 H√§rligt v√§lbalanserad. Angen√§m doft och munk√§nslan ger en riktig fin k√§nsla. Grymt syrlig och farligt l√§ttdrucken.

Very bubbly, with red color and very short head. Actually smells and tastes like basque cider. Not sure at all that I like this. It is like mixing wine and beer, not my stuff and hard to objectively rate.
@ √ñlprovning p√• Havregatan 7 mars 2014. Fruktig, k√∂rsb√§r, torr, alldeles f√∂r syrlig, vin√§ger.
This roodbruin beer has aromas of lactic acid and fruit (cherries or krieken) with a touch of wood. It is a complex, well-balanced sour beer with an after-taste of vanilla and red fruits.

Nice looking brew. Dark copper to light brown. Whispy off white head. Sips moderately lively. Chocolate, big sour cherry which moves towards ginger in the aftertaste. Low abv makes this brew very easy to drink. Mostly dry and parching like palate with low levels of sweetness. Great brew, but for 10 bucks a glass I¬íd prefer a little higher abv.
Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Copper colour, small head. Oaky vinegary nose. Mid sweet with distinct acidity with clean, rounded mouthfeel. Vinegar, some cherry and wood. Low bitterness.

Pours a dark redish brown with a medium head. A sour aroma with a fresh and fruity taste. One of the best sour ales I've tasted :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a clear amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy caramel oaky aroma. Fruity spicy tart sour caramel flavor. Has a fruity sour tart caramel finish with oaky hints.

Ar: lovely tartness, vinegar, fruity, berries, 
Ap: ruby colour, small beige head.
T: noticable tartness, mid-sweet, just lovely in its tart fruitiness.
P: medium body, small lively bubbles, lovely tart finish.
O: impressive.
UPDATED: MAR 8, 2014 Kastanje brun med lys skum som forsvant fort. Lukter surt eddik og r√∏dbeter?? sprudlen og frisk. Syrlig smak.

Ruby red with a decent off-white head. Aroma is malt vinegar, red currants, strawberries, caramel. Medium bodied, slightly sweet to start on the palate with a nice background sourness. Taste is strawberry and cherry sour candy, malt vinegar, red currants. Tasty
Bottle from SB. Reddish brown with a small off white head. Fruity and woody tones. Fruit, wood and acidity. Medium body with a nice, bitter/sour finish.

Eftersmaken domineras av en kvarvarande angen√§m syra.

Bottle @ home. Pours clear deep red/brown with a white coke-like frothy head that dissipates really quick leaving no lacing. Aroma of tart cherries, vinegar, some vanilla and oak. Strong wonderful and puckering sour flavor of lemon juice and zest, with red apple peel. Tart cherries, grape and oak in the background. Light body and sticking carbonation. Finishes dry with oak, dried fruit and some vanilla lingering.

this is a great flanders red. a lot of acid bites through an oaky and almost slightly milky sweetness. it¬ís been great when i¬íve had it on draft but the most recent bottle i had was quite a bit more tart and a little more acetic and less rounded out than on draft. may be that the kegs were more aged??

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear red with a small off-white head. Aroma is tart cherries, oak and vanilla notes, caramel, Sour with a rounded sweet background, dry tart finish with a nice fruity sweetness.
Good sour taste, strong but not over powering and gets smoother as it goes down. Nice overall

Bottle to snifter. Pours a deep amber with a short lasting thin foam head. Aroma of sour fermenting grapes, vanilla, vinegar . Taste is light and pleasantly super sour and tart. Sour flavor so strong you can taste it on your lips after a small sip for a while. Strong yeast character with a dry finish. Nice balance, light Mouthfeel.

Aroma - Strong cherry and tart fruit with some subtle hints of vanilla and oak

Appearance - Brilliantly clear. Thin off white head. Deep burgundy color

Taste - Strong acidity and puckering sour notes dominate. Incredibly tart - getting lots of sour lemon juice 

Palate - acidic and puckering. Light-medium bodied with a Very dry finish

Overall - great sour beer. Hits the upper end of the spectrum for sourness and acidity. This one is for the true sour heads

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Excellent fruity aroma, and while the colour was highly appealing I wanted a bit more head. Flavour was quite tart and multifaceted. I sipped too slowly though, and did not enjoy the beer as much once it got near room temperature.

Bottle 33 cl.
Brown with a small tan head. Sour, with notes of dried fruit, cherry and even candy. Fizzy to the mouth, a bit on the thin side for my liking. More sour, medium sweetness, and acidic. Lingering taste.

Music:The Aller V√¶rste ¬ñ Rene Hender

Bottle. Clear dark ruby with an off white head. Aroma is sour cherry, musty funk and vinous. Taste follows suit and adds some vinegar notes. Medium sticky mouthfeel. Really coats the mouth. Very good.
Draft. Pours dark amber, redish color with very small head. Smell is sour apple, lemon funk, cherry, huge bret. Taste is apple, lemon, old sour cherries, very tarty, dry finish. Excellent.
330mL bottle at BierCraft. Clear light ruby, off-white bubbly cap. Aroma of sour cherry, oak, stuffy attic. Taste is quite tart and mild sweetness. Well balanced.
Best sour I've ever had, and I've had all of RRBC sours as well as many many others.

P: Dark ruby cola appearance with a thin layer of micro bubble off white head. Small amount if active bubbles floating to the top. 

S: Tart lemon zest, stone fruit, vanilla oak, and bing cherries. Dry powdery yeast and a faint aroma of dried slobber like after you wake up and realized you slobbers on the pillow. 

T/M: Super tart lemon zest, apples, oak and vanilla. Hoppy stone fruit, white grapes and bitter apple peels. Light-medium sharp body and super aggressive carbonation thar really brings out the tartness. A puckering finish lingering apple peels and floral notes. 

O: Wow! This is by far the best Flanders red I have drank. Super sour yet underlined fruit notes that bring this all together quite nicely. Hops and yeast really makes this better than an average Flanders that is just straight sour. Get this when you can. Cheers!

Thin disappearing beige head over deep dark clear red-brown beer. Pronounced aroma of sour cherry, mature red fruit and sweet spices, the sourness hinted. Lively carbonation with a medium minus bodied palate hits dry and wonderfully acidic and sour, underripe berry with a faint sweet fruit and sweet exotic spice developing by the midpalate into the long finish. Extremely refreshing and moreish.

Tap at Grill Next Door. Pours amber brown with a nearly white head. Smells of dried cherries, candied sugar. Taste has a sharp lemon acidity that carries all the way from the moment it touches the tongue until well after the swallow. In the middle are dark cherries, caramel, a hint of cocoa. This is delicious!

SHHHHHHHH! Please keep this one a secret. Much like Petrus Pale this beer is highly under rated! Smells of old gym sock. Tastes like rainbow effervescence, this one is the real deal. Seriously, the wife loves it, and I do to. Consider this a gateway to the sour world!

great savory sour, berry, cherry character up front with nice yeast flavors and complexity. I also got wood and tobacco . Tartness continues with a more savory tomato character. Finishes clean with a similar aftertaste.

Pours a clear brick colour with a thin off white head. The aroma is heavy on the sour cherry, oak desk drawer, alcohol, very tart. The flavour is very tart aswell, astringent almost, sour green apple, sour cherry, vinegar, oak. The carbonation is lively, dry mouthfeel. I keep trying to get into sours, but I really struggle to find the appeal for me.
On draft at The Sierra Grille. Poured a reddish brown into a stemmed glass. Excellent sour with notes of cherry and oak. Not too sour, not too sweet.
On tap at Riverside. Poured restroom with light white head. Super sour aroma. Med carb and bod. Sour caramel taste. It¬ís ok.

DAA; Pours clear reddish brown with a fast deminishing off-white head. Aroma is sour, malty, dried fruity, vanilla and alcohol. Flavour mirrors, adding sour, cherry and caramell. Body is medium, texture is oily and the carbonation is soft to avarage. Yes, its a complex, beautiful sour beer with a lasting sour, fruity finish.

0.33 bottle, 5.5%. Dark brown ale color, filtered. Smell of cherries. Fruity taste with a hint of oak in the finish. Bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fruity smell. Colour like a dark red wine, fresh, white foam. Wow! Taken by storm. An incredible fruity taste comes over me. Lemon, lime, orange. Mayne something sweet. Mild bitterness, medium sweetness, extremly sour. Good to share

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft - Vintage 2010 - Red sour grape, little cherry and some oak. Clear mahogany with a thin beige head. Sour grape me oak, but there is something missing which a in the smell. Just a bit flat and boring. Still good, just not the WOW I was hoping for.

Bottle. Nice and tart. Well done not stupid sour. But nice warhead like sour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at rattle n hum. Dark reddish brown color, some white head. Sour aroma, cherries, berries, apples. Sour taste, berries, cherries, apples. Nice sour taste.

330 ml bottle. Pours a clear deep amber brown-red with a resilient beige head. Aroma is fruits, acetic acid, wood, vanilla. Flavor is red berries (by the ton), wild yeast (also by the ton), vanilla, wood. A true delight. Finish is brett funk, moisture, sour and tart as hell. Full bodied, soft mouthfeel, weak to average carbonation. Even my girlfriend would¬íve had the whole bottle, and that¬ís saying a lot. I¬íd say I consider this a masterpiece.

From 12oz bottle (thanks, Rob). 

Pours a clear dark copper with lots of head. Classic sour aroma featuring cherries. Tastes like a sour that would get a darn good reception from those who like sours. 

Sadly, I am still learning a taste for sours (apparently I am a slow learner)...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured on tap from Poppy¬ís in Estes Park, CO. sour and a bit of malt on nose: tastes of red sour fruit, vinegar, sweetness (fruity) underneath, really nice finish. as it warms, there is more funk on the taste, but stays underneath the sour fruit lambic character. Super delicious.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2015 Appearance: deep dark ruby color, clear, pours with a medium head that√¢¬Ä¬ôs kind of beige Aroma: sour, tart, red grapes, hint of funk Taste: strong tart, strong sour, wine grapes are there too, aspects of red wine in there, green apple Palate: lively carbonation, leaves mouth dry, lighter mouthfeel Overall: this is an intensely sour and tart beer, very delicious to me even if I√¢¬Ä¬ôm missing the complexity that√¢¬Ä¬ôs apparently in there, very subtle hints of wildness, has that kriek cherry Taste to it ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ambr√©e fonc√©e, effervescence moyenne-faible, col tr√®s fin. Cerises tr√®s s√ªres, pommes, plut√¥t bois√©e, vinaigr√©e. Pas mal dans le genre mais un peu trop acide √† mon go√ªt.
Deep ruby pour with a persistent off-white head. Aroma is tart cherries, green grapes, wet wood, and cinnamon. Tart raspberries, cherries, and oak, with just enough bready malt sweetness. Quite good.

On tap at O¬íRiley & Conways, pours a clear dark red with a thin head, the aroma had all kind of funk and fruit with quite a bit of vanilla from the barrels too, the flavor has a tart front end with quite a bit of vinegar in the finish, but in a good way, almost reminds me of the first time I tried La Folie, really nice.
Pours in red body with huge creamy foam. Aroma is sour cherry, sweet blody orange. Taste is very sour, almost vinegary. Palete is torwards sourness, no sweet. Body is light, carbo high. Pickles.

11.2 oz bottle. Aroma is fruity (plum, raisin, banana), funk, vinegar. Pours clear ruby red with minimal beige head. Taste is mouth-puckering (9/10 on a sour scale) and acidic backed by some overripe fruity sweetness. Fine fine sour ale.

Bottle. Dark reddish brown pour with a finger of red. Oak, balsamic vinegar, Bordeaux, dried cherries, vanilla, spice, nuts and dark berries. Acidic but with wine like body and medium carbonation. Almost refreshing. Good smooth finish. Complex

Packs a sour punch with the cherry flavor and reminds you of balsamic vinegar.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brings to mind the flavours and aromas of great balsamic vinegar - in a good way! Vanilla, cherry, and raspberry on the nose and tongue. A deep red mahogany in the glass with almost no head but some lacing. Citrus and fruit on the nose. Sour taste predominates. Complex. Not for everyone, but interesting.

Here¬ís a post-midnight wink for myself, a bottle of a style I love dearly but haven¬ít had in a while. Nose is beautifully tart and sour with balsamic character, deep cherry. Pours deep blood red with a soapy off-tan head. Taste is puckeringly sour and tongue-stripping, strong fruit character that rewards the back and non-lingual organs of the mouth as much as the tongue, cherry with some raspberry and strong grainy smooth wood. Fat body, little carbonation, nice firm burn from the acidity, good acetic, too. Mild funk throughout (actually tends toward the cleaner side of that scale), light lactic.  Much more than others, this has quintessential essence of cherry stones! Unexpectedly aggressive, but delicious and worth seeking out.

330ml Bottle. Pours a nice amber/brown, with no head, no lacing. Aroma is complex. Leather, wood, tobacco, and raspberry. Taste is of pungent sour fruit, starts sweet and finishes very sour. A seriously sour beer!

Advent beer #18: 11.2oz bottle - Jacobin: I associate it with the political club (featuring Robespierre!) during the French Revolution. Sour nose - no specific ingredient. Sip adds soopa cringe to muh face. Sourness aside, I get red berries (the unripe kind). My nose is sweating. I get no Cognac, vanilla or cocoa. Again, I don¬ít know why I have sour ales in the Beer Advent Calendar; AndyReynolds was there with me at Sergio¬ís when he suggested I get a Duchesse de Bourgogne. He saw my face when I tried it and he finished the beer. I get a sour apple aftertaste. As it warms and I acclimate to the sourness, it gets better, but not 3.91 better: my rating went from a 2.7 to a 3.2 in about five sips.

Bottle sample at sour beers tasting at Beer&Beyond shop. Clear amber-brown with a nice head. Smell - funky, grapes, sour, wood and berries. Taste - sour, with wood, cherries, raspberry, green apples, dry finish. Medium-bodied, easy to drink, delicious. Great beer.
Pours a very clear orange hued brown with little lasting head. Aroma is stone fruit, apple, funk and sour cherry notes. Taste echoes that with the slightest woodiness. Very nice and lingering.
Great crisp sour aroma with fruit: cherries apples and more. Sour cherries taste. With a nice dry yeasty finish. Wonderful.

Bottle. Very little head formed and what did disappeared very quickly. Smells like a flanders should smell. Taste is very sour, big time pucker on this tart beer. Some berries on the flavor. Good beer, great example of the style.
Frothy white head with a red body. Sour cherries, grape skins and wet earthy aroma. Tart, red velvet chocolate, licorice. Very tasty and quaffable. I would highly recommend this Flemish Sour.

33 cL bottle from the LCBO, served in a stem glass. Pours clear copper-brown with a moderate tan head that fades to a thin cover and leaves a moderate amount of lace. On the nose there are notes of cherry, sour fruit, toasted malts and a touch of cocoa. The flavour is moderately sweet and tart at the same time, becoming more tart towards the end. Oak barrels come through, along with further sour notes of apple and perhaps peach. The finish is long, sour and fruity with a touch of malt. On the palate it is medium in body with a smooth, watery texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a decent sour red ale with nice cherry and apple notes. Well brewed and refreshing, though the tartness does begin to dominate after a while. 2013-06-12

Dark brown appearance; some head, but dissipates immediately. Smells sour. The tastes of cherry and plum are most prominent, with a particular focus on the sourness of both fruits. Some sweetness, but more subtle than the lingering tartness.

11.2 oz bottle- Pours autumn amber to ruby red with a crackly white head that reduces immediately leaving almost nothing. The aroma is tart cherries and plums, a fair amount of funk, graham crackers. The taste is much more tart than I was expecting, mouth puckering, cherry, plums, wood, I wouldn¬ít have gotten the cocoa if not for the description above, but maybe subtle dry cocoa powder. Body is medium and carbonation is medium high. Nice beer.
Tap at The Trappist, Oakland. Colour is deep reddish brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, berries and sourness.

Bouteille de 330 ml d√©gust√©e au Brouhaha (Montr√©al, QC) au co√ªt de 13,00$. Ar√¥me: Odeur de cerises s√ªrette. Apparence: La couleur est rouge avec une faible densit√© de bulle. Smells sour, red color, fizzy white head, tart/sweet very slight oak, very good.

Bottle. Pours brownish-burgundy. Nose is tart cherry, rhubarb, red wine vinegar. Flavour is more of the same with woody, vinous, prickly. Finish is relatively dry but the sourness lingers longer than Rodenbach Grand Cru (my favourite). An intense sour, my friend hated it but what does she know I¬íve never once seen her drink vinaigrette from the bottle.

-Jass√• du vill ha n√•got surt? s√§ger bartendern p√• Moeder Lambic. D√• ska du testa den h√§r.
SUUURT!!!!! √Ñttika och ciron. Balsamico och lite kola. Brutalt sur. Skrynklar ihop hela nyllet p√• ren reflex. Man kan skada sig.

Hint of cherry, rose, roasted smell, beautiful residish, brown color, that sour, yeasty, tangy taste, with a great after-swallow sour then bitter taste is perfect. Not enought ABV at 5.5%, I think more ABV would give it a hint of sweetness it is missing.
UPDATED: NOV 20, 2013 330 ml bottle. Copper color with off white head. Aroma fruit, light tanginess, malt and slight acidity. Taste is sour, lemon, lime, vinegar and sour fruit. Fantastic acidity!

11oz bottle. Pours dark red/brown with a small head. Nice sour farmhouse nose. Flavors of cherry vanilla oak and apple. Delicious.

Smells sour and fruity. Nice reddish color with little or no head. Extremely sour, almost overpowering. Flavors definitely linger for awhile. Too sour for me.

Bottle. Pours light. clear brown with red hints, minimal to no white head. Smells very plumy, wood, slight sourness, cola. Has a really great balance with sourness and flavor. Rich, vanilla, good carbonation, medium-bodied, has a definite cola taste to it. It¬ís an exceptional beer!! Highly recommend!
Good dark brown sour. Great aroma....good flavor. A solid sour....give it a try!!

330ml bottle, dark ruby-red, mahogany color, with a rocky fluffly beige head, nice mild red cherry sourness nose, with some wild funky yeast, wet oak barrel, faint red wine tannin accents, with some light balsamic vinegar, passion fruit, sweet and sour red berry, faint cherry jello notes in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a very good sweet and sour red cherry fruitiness, red wine tannin, funky wild yeasty, woody character, with some rhubarb, lemon juice, red berry tartness, subtle chocolate, passion fruit, sharp cherry acidic flavours, leading towards a wild yeasty, red cherry fruity sourness, oaky, faint vanilla, dusty, red wine tannin, red berry acidic finish.
Bottle 11,2 fl oz. Small white soda head disappearing. Fizzy with dark red color. Aroma is tar, fermenting onion and sour mix. Taste is rhubarb, citrus candy and sour mix again.

Bardzo dobre piwo mocno kwaskowate, wisniowo octowe. Lambicj prawie ze. Fermentacja spontaniczne i lezakowanie w drewnie przez 18 miesiecy odcisnelo swoje pietno na smaku tego zacnego trunku. Nie kazdy je odbierze nalezycie i doceni, ale to piwo jest wielkiej klasy. Godny przedstawiciel dzikich czerwonych Ale.

On tap at Ol Beer in Walnut Creek, Ca. Lots of carbonation in it. Nice on the palate. Get the cherry flavor right up front. Solid.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Half pour at √∏L. Aroma is cherries, vanilla, oak and Brett. Flavor matches, but with a much brighter oak and carbonation than Intense Red. Still, I have to say that I like it better. Great beer.

Poured from a bottle with almost no head or lacing. Beautiful ruby color. Med to light body with lively carbonation. Lightly tart with notes of oaky tannins and cherry vanilla. Would def drink this again.

Pours a deep dark reddish brown color with big off white heads. Tart aroma with some dark fruit type character. Flavor is sour, tart, and has a lot of fruity type flavors...cherry mostly and light cranberry type bitterness. One of my favorite "easy to get" sours, hands down.
Intense sour beer with a delightful fruity layer and a nice hint of oak. Sticky mouthfeel. Very good.

Aroma is barnyardish and kinda funky. I also get some cherries.
The flavor has prominent cherries and apples with some slight flavors of chocolate, vanilla and oak. One of the best sours i¬íve had!

On tap at Dutch¬ís. Clear, beautiful very dark red color. Thin khaki head, leaves good spread of lace. Medium body, lightly sticky. Lighter, lightly prickly carbonation. Great dark fruit, cherry, oak, vanilla, woody spicy notes. Good prickly bigger sour taste, creates a light buzzing sensation in the back of my head. Light sweet. Good long sour sticky fruity aftertaste. A fantastic belgian sour red, maybe one of the best I¬íve ever had.
Pours red with low head, very nice Flanders red, a nice amount of tart and sweet fruits, love it!

Sample from bottle at the Beer Enthsiast stand at N√¶rb√∏, √òlfestivalen 2013. Clear mahogany colored body with no head.. Chutney nose and mouth. A bit thin even a hint of chlorine is detectable. Medium bodied with a long pleasant finish.

Arome tres timide des petits fruits. Mousse tres peu dense qui se dicipe tres rapidement. Les gout n¬íest pas tant acidule mais tres bon. Belle couleur rouge brunatre. Bonne biere mais...faut pas virer fou.
Tap at the Jeffrey. Pours reddish brown with thin soapy head. Nose of cherries and vinegar. Tastes of balsamic, rhubarb, cherries, funky, vanilla, and earth. Sweet finish and a sticky palate.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2013 Bottle: muddled, deep shade of brown with some dark ruby all around. Big-bubbled cap with a soapy formation that sinks to a skin quickly and leaves a little bit of lacing in the process. Aroma is fantastics; sour & rich black cherries, grape skins, wet oak, vinegar, tart lemon flesh, a touch of vanilla, & even a bit of back-end cocoa powder. Extremely vinous, tart, & slightly acidic. Taste is fill of sour cherries, balsamic vinegar, grapes, oak, faint lactic acid, & oak-induced vanilla smoothness. Sour & puckering, quenching & delicious with a finishing oak & cherry tartness that keeps you thirsty for more. Dry finish. One of my favorites of the style, & the availability is great.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2014 Bottle. I love a good sour and this is a great one. Pours a beautiful mahogany with a light head around the edges. Smell is rich and complex with cherry, tobacco, chocolate and more. Taste does not have the sweetness that the aroma might lead you to believe. It¬ís impressively sour with just a slight touch of sweet -- exactly what I want from a Flanders Red.

Tap at the Bad Apple, Chicago. Poured a clear dark amber with a thin broken white head. The aroma is citrus fruit sour. The flavour is medium spit with an acid citrus weak vinegar like palate with a tiny hint of barnyard.

Draft sampled at The Bad Apple, Chicago. Pours clear dark bet with an off white head. Aroma of tart fruit, toffee, raisins, light malt,
Oak, vanilla and red berries. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and heavy acidic. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Cuv√©e des Jacobins is een 100 % foederbier. Dit is een onversneden lambiek, en heeft 18 maanden gerijpt op eikenhouten vaten. Het bier heeft een robuust karakter maar heeft een mooie en gesofisticeerde inhoud met een afdronk van vanille, gedroogde kersen en cacao. Dit is een complex, maar zeer gebalanceerd zuur bier.

Light vanilla and fruit aromas. It pours an opaque deep red color with no head. The flavor is very tart with moderate sweetness on the finish; like a sour cherry with a hint of vanilla. The body is medium, mostly still and leaves some lingering acidity on the tongue. Very good, very sour and very complex flavor

A: Deep Reddish Brown Hue, Passes Almost No Light, Off White Head, Decent Lacing

S: Dark Sour Cherry, Black Currants, Cranberry

T: Dark Sour Cherry, Black Currants, Cranberry

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Sour, Mildly Bitter

Overall, a really solid Flaunders ale with a nice sour dark fruit nose and taste.

Bottle 330 ml. Wow, that certainly is a sour one! Pours very dark red (almost brown), with small off white head, quickly disappearing. Aroma is of cherries and some balsamics. Amaing (and a little overwhelming) sourness, along with a touch of sweetness. Explosive.
Sample at SBWF. Sour and fruity smell. Very tart taste with red berries. Very interesting taste.
Very nice, quite strong and very smooth to drink. Thick however and very dangerous if you dirnk it easily.

Draught @ Rattle & Hum, NYC. Pours clear ruby with small off-white head. Clear vinous aroma with notes of citrus and grass. Vinous flavour with lambiclike notes. Sour aftertaste. A really good sour ale!

Bottle (33cl). Lovely deep rusty red colour. Small off-white soft head, settles as a stable ring, no lacing. Sour-sweet aroma with cherry fruit and crushed kernels, aged vinegar, blackcurrant. Medium body, modest/flat carbonation. Rich, sweet/tart/vinegary taste, amazingly well-balanced. Mild vinegar burn (pleasant!) in the finish.
Bottle 33 cl. Deep red with a short-lived lightbrown head. Cherry aroma with some sence of sour green apple. Taste, sour and sour with sour green apple ending, spes
This is a really nice sour. Definitely grab some if you see it. Very drinkable and tart.
Une belle couleur ambr√©e avec des reflets rouges. En bouche une acidit√© ma√Ætris√©e accompagn√©e d¬íun fruit√© assez rond. Toujours en bouche un c√¥t√© vineux pr√©sent assez longtemps.

Bottle: Chesnut color. Toffee froth that dissipates. Sour nose but loads of richness and fruit. Cherry, glazed and dried fruit. Malt. Old oak. Spice. Touch of Brett and obviously VA but relatively clean. Cold black tea. Medium sweet,low bitterness and moderate to high level of sourness. It is balanced and clean. Medium weight. Long . Rich complexed bright. A bloody good beer.
Pours a clear dark red colour with a beige head. Aroma is malt, fruit, citrus, yeast, vanilla and some woody notes. Taste is sour fruit with some woody notes leading to a tart finish. Awesome!
Draft at Howells & Hood. Deep caramel with a tan head. Strong, tart, funky aroma. Tart cherry, sour and wood. Slight vanilla.
Smaker surt og har mye kullsyre, ingen ny favoritt akkurat. Litt artig, men mest rar.

Pours a red purple beer with a not very long lasting white head. Smells berry and cherry. Heavy sour. Nice. Average carbo, thin body and a sticky texture. I might find this one too sour. But overall a good beer.
UPDATED: APR 10, 2014 Deep red. Aroma is a sour smell. Taste is sour sweet in balance, zing, lovely and drinkable. Palate is clean with a lingering sherbert. Overall, great malty sour here.

On draught at the Blind Tiger. Arrived a deep lightly hazed red with a thin off-white head that lasted through the first quarter of the glass and left light lace. Very pleasant aroma of mild wine vinegar, malt, cherry and oak. The flavor is sour but not excessively so and is complimented well by some lovely malt, cherry, and oak. Bright, well rounded and luxurious on the palate. Excellent.
Has a good tart aroma with a pretty sour taste. Not much to the taste besides sour, but it¬ís really good.

[bottle from LCBO]
Sour, vinegary aroma with a little pickle juice and ethyl acetate and lots of fruits; complex. Crystal clear mahogany under a lacy, off-white, shiny cover. Sour flavour up front with a touch of vinegar and then cherries as well as some red life savers. A touch of sweetness follows the sour, that may be a bit of back sweetening--hard to tell for sure. Complex fruity accents include sour grapes. Light body, moderate carbonation, mouth watering sour finish.
R√∏dlig vinfarve med lite skum. Lukt av r√∏de frukter og b√¶r. Smak av frukter. Bitters√∏t avslutning. Vinmonopolet.
Frisk duft av kirseb√¶r og gj√¶r. Fin dyp r√∏d brun farge. Lite skum, noe p√• kant. Nydelig syrlig smak av kirseb√¶r. Fruktig og god.

Pours deep red with no head. Aroma of raspberry, plum, balsamic vinegar, wood, funk. Taste is very tart up front, with light sweetness and astringency following. I¬ím not big on sours but this one is really nice.
Dark red pour with a small white head. Sour cherry and oak in the aroma. Sour cherry, lactic sourness, apple, oak, tart raspberry as well. Medium body.
Dark cherry color with little carb. Strong effervescent sour nose. Crisp refreshing taste with lasting flavor.
Aroma sweet fruits, appearance is dark amber, taste is sour sweet, lingers a little and gets sweet great beer

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2013 On draft from Tornado in SF- Rated on 6-5-13. Pours dark red / orange with white head. Good lacing. Aroma is dark cherry, alcohol, vanilla. Sourest beer I?ve ever head, light sweet. Nice long, dry sour finish. This and the RR sours are the best I?ve had of the style.

Darker pour with a medium tan head. Strong sour cherry aroma, very fruity on the nose. Very sour taste, not at all unpleasant with complex flavors that are fruit forward. Carbonation sharp on the tongue. A challenging beer if you are not already familiar with or into sours.

Would I drink again? definitely.
Would I buy/order again? maybe. sours are still a mystery to me and I would order anything I¬íve never tried before something I¬íve already had.
Dark brown pour with a thin cream colored head. Nice nose of cherries and malt. A bit sweet, but tart in the finish. Medium to full mouthfeel and a nice lasting finish.

his pours a slightly hazy dark brown with hints of read and a smaller fizzy short lived head. The smells are very tart and vinegary, sour cherries, brett, some barnyard funk and a hint of vanilla. The feel is medium, high carbonation. The taste is amazing, extremely tart / sour, almost overwhelming, but then you get a hint of sweet balance, some vanilla, plenty of sour cherries.

pours clear light brown ruby with a very nice light beige head, excellent retention and beautiful lacing. cherries, spices, wood, tingling acetic and pepper, powdered candies - sourheads *TM, quite fruity and balsamic, bit of nuts, coca-cola, some earthy notes and dust. medium acidity - cherry-like citric acid - a tad disturbing, notes of acetic too. hint of sweetness. low carbonation, light body - oily, nice acidic and spicy-herbal-grassy finish. very nice!

330ml bottle. Pours a beautiful clear ruby with a one finger beige head. The nose has HUGE sour cherry notes, very light balsamic, and a faint earthiness. The taste is enormous, again with sour cherry notes, and pomegranate in the finish with some lovely carbonation. It¬ís hard to believe this is the product of wheat, and barley because it just flat out tastes like a fermented fruit beverage. I love it. SO, SO good.

Bottle: Poured a red color ale with a large pink color foamy head with good retention and minimal lacing. Aroma of oak, sour cherries with tart notes is quite nice. Taste is a very drinkable mix of oak and sour cherries with some tart notes and very little acidic notes with light lingering sugar notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. This si a solid version of a Flander red beer.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours amber with medium beige head. Some lacing. Aroma is of sourness, fruits, cherries. Taste is of sourness, fruits, sugar, slight acid, some hints of metal. Palate: Light-medium body. Overall: Very nice. Refreshing. Clean. Good fruits. Not cloying, enjoyable.
2013.08.17 - Gents Bierfestival - donkerrood bier -neus : rood fruit - mond : fruitig en zuur
Bottle, pours a dark red, nice head, aroma is kind of sour cherry, the flavour is nice and sour and a really nice offering

Pour is clear ruby red with little beige head and little lacing. Aroma is lots of tart cherries, light cranberries, oak, sourness. Taste has lots of cherries, a bit of grapes, sour, oak, light caramel. Low body and good carbonation. Nice one!

16 13 on the back of the bottle.
Appearance: The body is a perfectly clear ruby to garnet with a tall tan head that settles into a creamy full coating with a dense ring.
Aroma: Sour and tart cherries with hints of oak and upon swirling I can pick up sweet vanilla. Boy this smells amazing.
Taste: Whooaoaoaoaoaooaoasokasoks Holy fuck this is fucking amazing. The intro is very unassuming, hints of malts with a touch of vanilla. The mid-taste hits hard and very intense with a strong red wine vinegar and sour cherry. The first sip it¬ís really all I can discern. The second sip I find some vanilla underneath it. The finish hints at some cocoa, but lingers with a puckering red wine vinegar. Holy hell. This is wonderful.
Palate: Medium bodied with moderate to high carbonation.
Overall: I would have passed this up had it not been recommended just a week before. This is everything I¬íve been wanting in this style. Puckering sour with layered complexity. Duchess was my favorite, but this is my new favorite.

Bottle. Pours mahogany / ruby with no head. Aroma is lactic, tart cherries, ripe fruit, a hint of vanilla and ... brown sugar? Shrug, if you say so nose. Big sweet stone fruit taste up front tempered by an even bigger acetic, face-puckering sour. Apples and cherries. Lasting tart finish. Whoa tart. Damn. Full body, slick texture, finely bubbled, prickly carbonation. Overall: excellent, if a bit extreme. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2013 Pours a clear amber with a nice offwhite head that leaves some patterns on the glass. Aroma is lacking a bit of refinement with bold lactic and wood notes. Taste is heavily sour and oaky. Flavors of green apple or some other sour fruits show up. It is refreshing with its "over the top" acidity and light bodied. Quite good but not meeting my (seemingly high) expectations,

Edit (2013-08-20): A second bottle was much more appreciated, not sure if it was my palate that was shot or if the bottle itself was problematic. Bumping this to 3.9 from 3.7. It seems a lot more approachable now. Still quite acid but it seems like it is more mellow than bold this time around.
Klar m√∏rk brunr√∏d farge. Smskeer veldig syrlig. Hint av kirseb√¶r, sitron og eple. Veldig syrlig ettersmak som henger en god stund. Kansje i overkant syrlig.

Small bottle. Pours a very pretty deep ruby pour with off white head. Aroma of cherries, a hint of vanilla, light ascetic acid, woody. Taste is sour, fruity, lots of cherry, clean acidity without the muddy fruitiness beers like duchesse have for example. Very clean and refined. Easy drinking and quite tasty.
Delicious tardiness. Perfectly balanced oud bruin. Slight Apple nose. Fine effervescent carbonation

0,33 l bottle ordered from Vinmonopolet Nettbutikk. Pours a beautiful clear burgundy brown body, under dense, quikly fading tanned head. Mild vinegar fruity nose. Fresh acidic red berry-accented flavor. Notes of cherries and vanilla. A distinct underlying sweetness. Smooth in the mouth. Light funky acidic-sweet berry finish. Quite sweet, yet a very fresh and highly drinkable Flemish Red.

330ml bottle from the LCBO.clear red pour, with a slightly tinged beige head. Beautiful acidic, funky aroma, with hints of cherry, and oak. the body is great, and the carb is soft. the finish is quite a bit more sour than i expected. some good notes of funk, and a big dose of acidity.Notes of oak, cherry, tart berries round it out. very impressed and surprised.
Nice sour tartness. It has a really crisp and clean taste. This is very enjoyable. Not super funky, just sour & tart.
It is a caramel brown color and looks syrupy. It has scents of sour tartness. It has a sweet floral, light syrupy taste with a nice tart finish.

Pours a deep rich red color with an opaque look to it. Aroma is of cherries and oak alcohol. Taste is sour, with a hint of vanilla and sweet cherries. A sour finish with an easy drinking finish. No distinct aftertaste.

Nice deep red appearance with small white head. Smells sour,funk, red wine, fruity, some barrels. Huge sour, fruity, vinegar mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Nice lingering sourness with alot of complex cherry, some barrel. Overall: so sour, so complex.
Pours a deep red colour with and off white head. Aromas of sour cherry, dark fruit, malt vinegar, and earthy wood notes. Pulls your jaw pretty good. Nice and sour but also has good depth. Good sour.
Au Brothers Beer Bistro. Ambr√©e rousse. Tr√®s acide. Fruit√©. Framboise. Pomme verte. Levure sauvage. Bois√©. Vineuse. Vinaigre balsamique. Surette. Cerise. Vanille. D√©licieuse.

Bottle [330ml]. Pours a deep orange-amber with an average size long-lasting frothy beige head. Nice aroma, sour and funky, with dark fruit, vinegar, caramel malt, wood and earthy notes. Flavour of sour fruit, balsamic, lemon, wood, earthy notes and a long tart finish -- quite flavourful. Medium bodied. Better then I expected, super solid!
