UPDATED: JUL 17, 2013 Pours a deep amber red with off white head. Sour, fruity and malty aromas. Cherry, vanilla and vinegar flavors. Wonderful sour finish.

One of the best sour beers I have had ever..... Smell of cherries and the aroma. Is amazing!!! Makes you pucker right up.... Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2013 A refined flemish sour loaded with all the complexities expected from the style, very nice

A vibrant garnet body, which transitions to a deep amber when fully illuminated, sits beneath a quickly fading 1" light khaki head, the lower portion of the glass covered in medium sized bubbles sprinting upward
-
Flavors and aromas are nicely balanced and cohesive, layers of acidic earthy barn, lemons, sharp tart cherry, raspberry jam, white and red grapes with creamy yogurt rounding out, all expressed through a smooth medium body alive with sourness and controlled carbonation creating a slick, sweet and sour coating on my palate, a deeper sweetness appears in the residual reminiscent of chocolate covered cherries

11.2 oz bottle code 16 13 at 50¬∞ into TeKu

Bottle 33cl, a dark amber beer with good creamy head. Nose is very oude bruin like with vinegar and cherry notes, well engaging. Aroma is quite acid, red fruit notes such as blueberries and redcurrant, blackcurrant, dry, less wood touch compare to Rodenbach for instance, vinous, some diacetyle. Enyway a nice beer, better when not too fresh.

Bottle from Charleston Beer Exchange. It pours deep ruby with a quickly dissipating off-white head. The nose is earth, wood, vinous, acetic, damp wood, red berry and jammy fruits. The taste is tart, juicy cherry, vinous, lemon sherbet, Granny Smith apple, wood, some crisp acidity, red grape, faint jam and sour candy with a dry finish. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Really nice juicy tartness going on. Pretty delicious stuff. Bravo Bockor!

Draft at capones..red crimson hue..nose is quite nice..hints of apples..dried fruits.cider..mouthfeel is spot on..funky acidic notes shine through with a sour finish indeed....quite enjoyable and glad to have had this after my palate was literally set ablaze by habanero wtf sculpin...this was quite complex indeed..

On tap at Stone World. Pours cherry red, translucent, with a small head, no lacing--looks nice. It smells tart, various fermenting fruit aromas, complex. It has a light body with medium carbonation, no hops or alcohol present in the taste--it tastes a lot like "sweet tarts" candy, and raspberries. I¬ím coming around to this style, this is a very nice selection.

Aroma is of vinous cherry. Cherry might slightly dominate the sour smell, but still great. Very sour taste, but cherry and oaky/woody fruit flavors balance very well, not as pucker sour as say la folie. Lower carbonation, but not too noticeable. Everything just works well with this beer. Near perfect, and a must for sour lovers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from the LCBO. Rusty red-brown body with a small and quickly descending head. Flavour and aroma both have big notes of sour cherry and balsamic vinegar, with supporting oakiness and a hint of sweet vanilla. Crisp body, and a long, dry, tart and refreshing finish. A stellar sour!
Pours a deep burgundy. Sour red wine vinegar and cherries, along with oaky notes too. Similar flavours. Nice and sour. Very good.

Bottle from LCBO. Pours crystal-clear rusty brown with a thin tan head. Pleasant sour cherry and caramalt aroma. Sour/tart flavours hit the tongue immediately, giving way to subtle fruity notes and a super-clean finish. Big body, silky smooth. Great.

Bouteille de 330ml. Bi√®re brune-rouge avec un filet de mousse. Au nez des effluves de bois, foudres, fruits rouges et d¬íacide. La bouche est suret comme on l¬íaime, bois√©e, elle fait saliver. Finale suret-aigre, fruit√©e. √† consommer avant 06-02-2015. Vive les Jacobins !

Really nice! Pours dark amber with limited head and some lacing. Nose is sour and some fruit. Notes of sour candy, some fruit. Tastes medium tart and very light sweet. Lightish body with lively carbonation.

Pours a dark ruby with a very thin head that fades to nearly nothing.
Smells sour with fruits.
Taste is fruity and sour with a dry finish. Very bubbly carbonation. 
I¬ím sure it is very true to the style but I¬ím not a fan of the sour.

pours an opaque amber brown with a bubbly white head that dissipates. nose is tart brett- i know im about to get heart6burn from this brew. taste is... yep- heartburn. you get used to it and its quite tastey but the acid on this is in-tense.

Maybe it¬ís because I haven¬ít been able to get any Flemish Sour Ale here in years, but jeez - I love this brew.

Beautiful deep red with a moth watering fruity sour aroma. taste is aggressively sour with a nice lingering tang that doesn¬ít overpower.

Fantastic!
This was an interesting experience since I didn¬ít know anything about the Flemish sour ale. Most likely an acquired taste.

Pours a deep raisin colour, with minimal head. The aroma notes include fig, sour apple, toasty malts, and raisins. The tasting notes include sweet fruity sour, blended with a complex mix of fig, toasty malts, and has almost a Sherry character to it. Excellent! My favorite Lambic to date!
One of the all-time classic Flanders reds. So many of them taste like saccharine fermented cola, but Jacobins is nuanced, tart, authentically fruity with cherry pits, and woody without being tannic.

Bottle. Dark amber, creamy tan head. High delicate carbonation. Aroma of dark fruit, cherry, jam, yeast, hints of oak and lilac. Medium sticky. Fruit sourness and slightly herbal. Very delicate Brett character without overpowering. A little cloying on the finish. Probably should have let this sit. Still, very nice.
This was my favorite beer of the 8 I tried at Prohibition Taproom¬ís Sour Event during Philly Beer Week. This was an awesome sour!

11.2oz served in a snifter. Lots of speckled lacing.

A - Pours a reddish brown with a thin cap of tan bubbles.

S - Very acetic sour aroma, old wet basement wood, good amount of funk, old bruised fruit, tart raspberries, some sweetness as well.

T - Slap your Grandma sour! There¬ís a brief second of sweet malt upfront but then the lacto sour slowly builds reaching it¬ís toe curling climax at the very end. Lots of tart and fermented fruit going on. Highly acetic but a great blend of light brown sugar sweetness. Raspberries are the most notable fruit. Salty wood and balsamic hit right at the finish.

M - Light bodied, crisp sour finish.

Wow this was lip smacking sour with just the right amount of sweetness. More funky brett presence than I expected. My favorite Flanders Red.

Serving type: bottle

11-02-2012

2013/06/20 - Pours a clear, deep red mahogany color with a foamy off white head. Aroma is vinegar, cherries, barnyard and smoked wood. Taste is very subdued compared to aroma. Tart cherries and lemon with a slight barnyard aftertaste. Oily body with low to medium carbonation and a puckering finish. Not my style, but a surprisingly smooth sour ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Muchas Gracias Mr. Senn! Une bouteille de 33 cl √† consommer de pr√©f√©rence avant le 6/02/15. Une belle robe rouge qui scintille et qui montre un col de mousse bien accroch√©. Un nez tr√®s all√©chant de cerises aigres, de transpiration bois√©e et de notes malt√©es justement douces. Sur les papilles, une ascension fortifi√©e du ch√™ne et des notes fruit√©es aigres. Des cerises et des framboises touch√©es par des notes balsamiques. Des malts n√©cessaires qui ne prennent jamais trop de place. En bouche, un corps bien serr√©, un p√©tillement vif et une texture huileuse. Une finale remplie par des notes aigres-douces qui s¬í√©tirent en longueur et, dans une moindre mesure, en intensit√©. Vivement une autre bouteille de ce nectar si facilement aimable.

wonderful. It is perfect to me. Not too sour, cherries, slightly creamy. Leaves a slight tart on the palate
I love this one and my previous favorite was the Panil sour. This one is mellower and finishes very clean. I would drink 20 of these if I could. I¬íll buy this little beer every chance I can get. Cherry and a smooth light lemon hop that stays behind the cherry. Slightly sweet even.
So good you want to down it but so good you have to stop and savour and roll it on your tongue for a while.

Bottle at Amundsen, march 26th 2013. Clear mahogny body, no head. Aroma of wood, malt, red fruits. Malty and acidic taste with fruits and cherry, chocolate, a rather high sweetness softens the sourness a bit. Finishes with cherries and chocolate. An interesting beer.
For the $$$ you cannot beat this beer if you like big viniger sours with a deep complex flavor. I buy a case of this for $118 every 4 months or so. What a great beer
Cheers Joe. Mahogany pour with a frothy white gead. Sour, cherry fruit aroma. Little hint of roastiness. Sour bitterness with a pleasant refreshing finish. Sickly sweet. Just not my style.

(330mL bottle from the LCBO) Poured a sort of pale mahogany, clear with ruby highlights and a tiny whitish head. Aroma acidic, sharp, sour cherry, balsamic vinegar, barnyard, some sweet fruit lingering along with overtones of lemon and wood, pretty complex. Flavour quite sour with some caramel malt sweetness coming through later to accompany a tart finish. Sour cherry, green apple, grain, lemon, some yeasty earthiness, faintly woody. That sour/sweet/tart finishing sensation lingers, but not a ton of flavour lingers with it.  This is quite a nice sour overall, fairly low carbonation and an oily texture. A bit more barrel character would be nice given its extensive ageing.

330 ml bottle from LCBO, served cold in a tulip glass. BB 06 02 15.
App.:  Deep mahogany with a modest tan head.
  
Aroma:  Lots of tart cherries, some oakiness, a bit of barnyard/funk/wild, earthy brightness, some sweeter cherry/fruit notes, pretty nice for the style.
  
Palate:  Medium body, gentle effervescence, slightly puckering and astringent.
  
Flav.:  Lots of rich and tart cherries, some darker malt notes too, a bit woodsy/oaky, a little earthy, nice; dry with fairly assertive tartness and a long, fruity finish balanced by some nice deep malt notes.

I like this style and I think this beer is a pretty good example.

Sweet and sour is a good way to describe the nose on this one, quite a bit of the barnyard type sour notes and a candy like sweetness. Clear dark beatiful dark ruby color, fairly quickly fading white head. Caramel sweetness comes through as expected on the nose first, followed by some green apple tartness and a lemony sweet finish. Not overly complex and a bit too sweet for my liking, but clean flavors make this one still great. Medium bodied and average carbonation.

330ml bottle. Dark amber body, medium yellow head with good retention. Aroma of yeast, sour cherry, herbal hops, spicy and some woody notes. Taste is extremely sour, watercress, sour cherry, herbs, green apples, yeast and a touch of caramel. Extreme experience.

Pours a clean copper (seems deep amber sometimes) colour with a big off-white head that goes down slowly and leaves a bit of lace. A nice thin coat tops the brew. Sour nose with hints of cherries, earth and wind going through a farm. The mouthfeel is very, very sour with a little tart in the finish. Sour taste. feels like eating rhubarb, with notes of mild caramel in the background, cereal grain, cherries and other wild berries. Not getting much from the oak barrels.

It pours ruby with mahogany highlights; the head is tan and foamy. The aroma has notes of: pungent acute barnyard funk, lemon-juice, toffee, hay, and sour berry. The taste is very-heavy sour  and medium sweet and high acidity; there are notes of: lemon-juice, sour berries, toffee, and red-fruit jam. The palate is full-bodied, has light carbonation, and really long sour and sticky finish. Overall, it¬ís extreme pungency is a welcomed change from more subdued sour beers.

330mL bottle lickbo. Clearish red with a huge beige head. The aroma is spot-on for the style with loads of acidity and cherries. Flavour hits right away with very sharp acidity and musky cherry. Somewhat woody although it¬ís in the background. Finishes sweet and then quite tart. Feels lightly carbonated for the style. Over-all very well done, albeit a style that I don¬ít typically get much out of.

Very well put together. The berry-balsamic tartness is powerful, acidic. Some stemmy tannins from the wood.

I find it lacks the deeper stone-cellar funk and cherry-fruit complexity / spicy overtones of Goudenband, so for my own likings I won¬ít be picking up a lot to drink. But would make awesome carbonade.

Bottle pours dark red with quickly dissipating brownish red head. Head is completely gone after a minute or two. Barnyard, spoiled vegetables, cherry, red wine. Very sour with medium body. Tartness gives the impression of crisp body, but the medium body is actually kind of smooth and syrupy. Very nicely done.

330 mL bottle. Pours a reddish brown with a thin white head.  Aromas of apple, sour cherry, nectarine, a touch of vanilla and oak, and a fragrant tea-like note. Full on sour with a fine mouth feel and medium body. Lingering sourness and minimal hop bitterness or aroma.  Complex and smooth, undoubtedly well made. A great sour.

330 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a clear dark brown with orange tinge and decent-sized, tight, light tan head.  Aroma is modestly sour fruit with defined cherry note and hints of oakiness.  Flavour absolutely bursts with cherry, quite sour, gentle woodiness, some hints of other fruits (maybe apple and plum) and a little saltiness.  Cabonation is fine and somewhere between average and lively.  Very flavourful and drinkable.

330 ml bottle - clear copper =red ale smallish cap goes quickly to a surface lace. Aroma is sour cherry over hors blanket. Peppery moth feel, dry and puckering. Flavour has big sour fruit in front ...mid palate some complexity with apple, stone fruit, cocoa, vanilla light wood tones....finish dry an puckering with a sour cherry kiss at the end. After finishing my last Rodenbach Gran Cru last night I can say this sour red is brighter and a bit more complex

Bottle 330 ml 
Aroma: very nice set up made of sour cherry fruit with hint of hay and woody cask. Touch of brown sugar,  hazelnut and soil. Splendid.
Look: poured as amber with red hints. Large thick, dense tanned cap. Some lace. Nice presentation.
Taste: quiet tart front. Thin bodied yet with plenty of character. More sourness than in aroma. Cherry is hidden a bit. Salty grainy blend. Soft on top. Medium plus carbonation.
Excellent sour.  Like candied cherries in vanilla Greek yogurt.  The bite from the sour is so light you¬íll find you¬íve sipped this away too fast.

330 ml bottle from the lcbo. Pours deep red with a lasting off white head. A stunningly complex and refined sour ale. I¬íll be back for more and make additional comments but the is edging toward perfection the more I drink.

Brown/reddish shiny pour. Almost no head. Aroma is sour cherrys. Taste is both sour and sweet. Taste is too complex for my humble tongue to comment on, but it¬ís one of the best sour ales I¬íve tried.

330 mL bottle.  (bb 06 02 15).  Clear reddish brown with very little head, which seems to be fairly typical from what I¬íve seen.  Lots going on in the aroma, especially in terms of fruit flavours.  The flavour is a little more reserved, though.  Nothing particularly stands out; it¬ís just very pleasant and drinkable.  Well constructed.  I dinno.  Maybe I just don¬ít know enough about the style.

Poured into a tulip. The number "01" was printed on the back label, but I don¬ít know what it means.

3.5 A: Nearly clear burgundy color. Short beige head came and fell quickly. 

4.25 S: The nose on this is extemely well balanced. Great mix of fruity, earthy, and sour. Cherry and mixed berry start things off with toasted malts and a rotting wood funkiness not far behind. Acetic and lactic acid in good proportion to the other aromas. 

4.5 T: Taste is even better than the nose. Like the nose, the flavor profile is completely balanced to the point of perfection. Sour tinge that gets your attention, but doesn¬ít block out other flavors. Fruity cherry and berry via lactic acid. Toasty malts with a light caramel sweetness. Rotting wood and basement type funk and oak from the barrel. 

4.0 M: Lighter medium to medium body. Good moderate carbonation, which falls midway between spritzy and bity. Light pucker on finish.

5.0 D: Easily in my top five most drinkable sours. It¬ís not the most flavorful, but it is perfectly capable to keeping my taste buds entertained. The beauty of this beer is that I keep wanting more well after I finish my last sip.

Serving type: bottle

03-01-2013 02:41:39
Thanks to  bart at my home dark red brown colored body with an off white head and a sour fruity aroma a nice sweet fruity sour taste  with a sour  slightly bitter finish
Great balance here. Nice sour plum and cherry aroma. Finishes sour but abrupt - nice effect at the end. Pours red with decent head and lacing. Soft carbonation. On tap at Blue Monk.

On tap. Pours a dark brown/red. Absolutely delicious and on point sour. Excellent

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Hopleaf.  Pours dark reddish brown with a thin tan soapy head. Really nice looking beer. Aromas of cherries, vanilla and wood. Taste is foremost cherries but there¬ís a pervading vanilla sweetness with other notes of sweet fruit and a funky woodiness. This beer is incredibly well balanced and has a great finish; bright and sour. I really enjoyed this beer.
Probably my favorite sour.  It tastes like a bunch of sour gummy bears.  Probably the most sour beer I¬íve had but also one of the best.

11.2 ounce bottle purchased a year ago at Bine & Vine ($5.99).  Pours a really nice clear garnet hue with one finger of fizzy grey-khaki foam that quickly reduces to nothing.  Aroma of raspberry vinaigrette, spicy soy sauce, tart cherry, and a mild woody funk.  Flavor of oaky red wine, tart cherry, tart raspberry, tart cranberry, vinegar, sweet-sour green apple Jolly Rancher, and a bit of caramel.  Overall, the tartness beats out the sweetness by a fair margin.  Semi-dry finish with lingering fruity sourness.  Not to the level of Consecration or Duchesse (correlation with ABV?...this is rather low alcohol), but still a fine representative of the style.  (514, 791)

Pours a hazy reddish brown from the bottle with thin ring of off-white lace that doesn¬ít really stick. Aroma is sour tart funky fruit. Taste follows, not overly sweet and well balanced. Pretty damn good.

Dark chestnut colour with a small, but lasting off-white head. Aroma of cherry, caramel, brown sugar and balsamic vinegar. Dry and acidic flavour with cherry, vinegar and a touch of oak. Rodenbach on speed!

Pours a very dark red body, almost brown. The egg-white head is very long-lived and ends up as a partially covering film and a foamy ring that leaves a good amount of lacing. The aroma is quite strong and sour, with mostly fruity notes. Once again I feel that my sour ale vocabulary is rather limited, but I think I find an interesting mix of tart fruits, like sour cherries, and more overripe stuff, like fermented apples. The taste is initially light sour, and the sourness increases in the finish. There is hardly any sweetness, and any bitterness in the finish is covered by the sourness, an acetic feel and a moderate acidity. The sourness and the acidity might be a bit demanding, but the flavours are actually quite gentle and easy to like. There are hardly any complex barnyard notes or anything like that, it¬ís mostly nice fruity stuff. Again tart cherries, fermented apples and lots of acidic lemon. Also some apple cider vinegar. The mouthfeel is very refreshing. The body is medium, the texture dry and smooth and the carbonation is moderate. A nice one for the summer! 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 15 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Ullev√•l, Oslo]

Appearance: Clear dark brown and subtle red color with a fine frothy tan head that leaves some lacing.Aroma: Rich sour fruity.Palate: Medium body. Dry and a moderate bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Balanced sour fruity. Balasmico, vinegar and wood. Immature apples.Overall impression: A fresh and tasty sour ale.Personal stats: Bottle from Vinmonopolet Oslo - Vika in Oslo, Norway.
Bottle. red golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is sourness, berries, malt, yeast. Flavour is funk, sourness, berries, malt, cherry, yeast, wood. Nice beer.

Bottle, bought @ Delirium, Brussels.
Pours lovely, clear chestnut with a small, creamy, off-white head. Aroma has caramel, toasted, cherries, sharp tartness. Plums and vinegary apples. Highish carbonation, fine dry and fairly light mouthfeel. Flavour is very tart, very fresh, caramel, apple, cherries, lactic, orangezest. Really nice.

Sour, fresh, fruity, raisins, caramel even.
Dark copper, clear. Tan / beige head, average volume, not lasting.
Rich fruity taste, fresh, sour, pickle. It was an explosion when it reached my mouth, but I¬ím not able to describe it. Fizzy mouthfeel, medium bodied, sticky sourness.
Bottle share thanks to Ian, nice amber pour with a white head. Aroma of malt, cherry, other dark fruits. Taste is some cherry, wood and nice tartness.

Bottle 330ml.Clear medium amber - red brown colour with a average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, caramel, moderate cherry - raisin, dried fruit, wood, vanilla notes. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and moderate acidic with a long duration, cherry, cherry stone - wood, dry, baking yeast notes ! Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Lovely :O) [20130216]

Bottle shared at a tasting at DSG¬ís place. Pours red to clear brown with a small head, aroma of brett, lemon, leaves, freshness, flavor is sourish, delicate and tasty with barnyard and fruits, medium bodied
Red pour at drinking bird.  No head. Super tat and sweet taste. No idea if this is good. Drinking it anyway

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013 On tap at Choice City.  Deep reddish brown with a small white head.  The aroma is tart and fruity with light vanilla, cocoa and wood.  Medium body with a smooth, creamy feel and soft carbonation.  Flavor follows the aroma and packs a nice sour punch.  Fuck yeah!
Bottle shared at a tasting at DSG¬ís place. Pours clear brown and headless. Sour, olives, cherry, sugar and vinegar. Tastes sour, medicinal and salty. Medium body, smooth texture, no carbonation.

Very nice sweet and tart flavors that are reminiscent of Sweetarts.  Has a hind of wild flower honey.  Overall very balance and quite delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At a tasting, thanks DSG, no head, clear brown colour with dark reddish hues, aroma of wood and red wine vinegar with touches of spice and fruit, flavour of apple vinegar, sour cherries, unripe fruit and spice, quite sour but not overwhlming with some complementing sweetness. good and fun to drink sour ale, just right.

Deep mahogany with off white head.  Malt and oak in the nose.  Nice sour, mouth puckering first sip.  Carbonation helps the malt coat the tongue and dissipate the sour.  Clean finish leaving your mouth puckered and wanting more.  Top notch sour.

Bottle shared at a tasting at my place. Deep red color with a beige head. Aroma of sour cherries, funk and oak. Sourish and slightly sweetish flavor with lots of cherries, a bit of berries, oak, lemony notes, and faint astringency in the finish. Medium-bodied, silky mouthfeel. Lovely.
On tap at Hot City Pizza, foamy head, fruit and vanilla come through strong, slight farmhouse.

One of my favorite beers, I¬íve drunk this a whole bunch of times and I keep coming back to it! It¬ís so good I struggle with saving bottles... Anyways dark reddish, small head, sweet & sour aroma of forest berries and cherries. Flavor is rich and it fills your whole mouth with yummyness, cherries & oak. I love the brett tartiness of this beer. Long and great sour aftertaste... This is one brew I just can¬ít get enough of,  I love it!
Love this it screams sour patch kids :) anyway light carbonation dark brownish red color very bitter tastes of cherries no head
Pours a dark reddish Amber, nose of cherries, grape juice, and some mild earth tones. Taste is dark sour cherries and ripe plum, followed by some green apple. Man this is good!

Bottle: Brown color with reddish hues and no head to speak of.  Aroma of barnyard, oak barrels, ripe apples, and a bit of yeast.  Delightful flavors of apples, vinegar, wood, tartness combine for a solidly classic Flemish sour.  Lots of carbonation and acidity are also present but not too much.  This is up there with the Dutchess!
Dark ruby red with off white head. Aroma is cherry and vanilla. Tast is tart... sweet and sour. And maybe a little more sour. Fairly dry finish.

11 oz bottle from Payless in Carmel. Beautiful dark ruby earth tones. Sizzling off white head. Rich deep oak and wild cherry , slight grapeskin, vanilla. Taste is citrus peel , woody, pure cherry extract. Makes the mouth water. Refreshing and memorizing. A wonderful beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At Holy Grale. Pours amber and red clear. Nose is very tart, vanilla, oak, caramel, maltz. Flavor is tart lacticity, sweet malts to balance, medium slick bod. Flavor is tart and acidic but not acetic. Nice drinkable sour and easy but complex. This is quite the drinkable sour.

Draft at Brasserie V.  Deep burgundy-brown, stained glass look.  Massive steady beige-red head.  Intense funky sour cherry aroma, some lemony citrus.  Sour citrus flavors, but also a soft, delicate malt body.  Excellent stuff, world class all the way.  Twangy red raspberry, cherry flavor, lots of sour depth.  Mouth puckering, some lactic vanilla tones as well.  The lactic sourness sticks with you.  Phenomenal.

Bottle (12 oz).Deep cherry-brown color with a small quickly vanishing off-white head. Aroma is of sour cherries, wood, balsamic notes and slight chocolate presence. Taste is slightly sweet and moderately to heavily sour. Strong sour cherries, balsamic notes, wood, slight chocolate and some tobacco notes. Mouthfeel is dry and mouth puckering. Good Flemish Sour Ale.

Bottle thanks to Dallas. Pours a deep cherry color with a medium white head. A big aggressive nose of fruit, woody and sourness. The flavor is a solid Flemish sour with brown malts, tart cherries, some yeasty dryness, a bit of sawdust bite in the finish. Really good. Has that big malt base to balance out the sourness, and it drinks quite well. Excellent.

Deep ruby and clear with a small head that quickly vanished leaving a fine ring of lacing. Tart and fruity.  Good body and flavor with a complex mixture of fruits strawberry citrus and oak.  Really nice.

Bottle shared by Mike 
Appearance: Clear brown with a small off-white head and spotty lacing 
Aroma: Dark ripe fruit 
Taste: Tart cherries, dark fruit with a very dry finish 
Nice
Poured from a 330ml bottle, thanks to Mike. Cherries, apple, chocolate, citrusy, slightly sweet. A very nice beer.

Deep red/copper, clear, beige head. Toasty malt and tart cherries, acidic sourness, some tannic grape-skin impressions, finishes dry. Tasty Flanders Red with pronounced sourness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured a dark reddish brown with a small head. Aroma of fruits (cherry and apple) and hints of malts. Taste starts sweet, caramel flavors then starts to get a bit sour from fruits nice balanced beer. Quite enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2013 Great sour. Almost a sweet, rich balsamic vinegar taste. The aroma is sour, of cherry, and a faint funk. Pours brown with little head. Taste is of light cherry notes, balsamic vinegar, sweet, and a mouth aching sourness. Finishes dry, sweet, and sour. Really good.

Bottle at Rattle n Hum.. Pour is a deep red with light white head that dissipates to nothing. Aroma is vinegar, sour cherries, slightly yeasty. Taste is oak, dark fruit, tart and crisp. Light mouthfeel with moderate carbonation.. Very nice.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2013 0,33 l bottle. Clear dark cherry amber colour with small off white head. CHreey and apple in aroma, some clorin all the way back there, the taste reminds me of a candy i had when i was a kid. Dried fruit and more cherries, a very nice balance between the oak, bitterness and sourness from the lambic . One of my favorite beers, can never get enough. See myself nipping to this many nights in the future
deep red-brown, minimal fizzy head. apple cider vinegar, barely spoiled red wine, tart cherry, plum. crisp, acidic, medium-light bodied and lightly carbonated

02.03.13
Uts: m√∏rk r√∏dbrun, moderat skum og kullsyre.
Duft: tydelig brett-preg, m√∏rk frukt og solid syre.
Smak: syrlig, meget frisk, kirseb√¶r og bringeb√¶r, langvarig og snerpende ettersmak.
Bottle at home. Pours a deep red with minimal head. Aroma is dried fruit, old leather; pleasing. Taste is tart and characteristically light. Enjoy

Dark brown, tanned head. Smells of tart fruits, funk, cherries, caramel and malts. Medium sweet, then medium sour, nice tart fruits like apples and cherries, some caramel. Moderate bitter, mostly fruit bitterness. Very nice fruity beer, quite well balanced. Also the caramel is very well integrated. Love this one

Robe limpide, cuivr√©e aux reflets rubis. Nez oxydatif et gourmand √† la fois (impression d¬íun vieux balsamique de Mod√®ne). Bouche √† l¬íattaque tr√®s acidul√©e (pomme Granny), d√©veloppant ensuite beaucoup de fruit√© (p√™che blanche). Finale longue et complexe.
Very rich nutty sour beer with black cherry, chocolate, balsamic, and light vanilla.  Very tart and acidic but a nice maltyness balances things a bit.

Bottle. It pours a small, dense, light beige head over a clear, amber body. Cherry, wood, lemon and some oxidation in the aroma. Lightly funky. It¬ís dry on the palate, medium bodied and soft, with cherry, some oxidation, wood and lemon. Fruity, sourish, cherry finish that lasts for some time. A quite pleasant one, but not impressive. It sort of lacks a bit on most things. 130216

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear reddish amber with an off-white head. Very sour, Bretty and funky nose. Medium body, tart berry-like character, loads of Brett and acid, with a sour astringent finish. Very enjoyable. 160213

Bottle. Pours brownish with a small off-white head. Aroma of funk, berries, sour grapes and lemon. Flavor is puckering sour and red berries with some vinegar and malt. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 330ml @ fonefan
Pours clear deep amber with a off-white head. Aroma is sour with notes of malt, sour cherries and wood. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium sour with a  dry finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy reddish amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, wood, cherries and sour fruit. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 160213

Bottle. Clear dark brown/amber with tiny off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, cherries, sour and a little vanilla. Flavour is malt, sour, vinegar, caramel, cherries, little sweet, little tart and oak.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is ruby brown. Aroma and taste are sour cherries, vanilla, wood, fruits, malt and has a nice citric finish. Yummy.

Smell of fermented hay (silo). Sour berries tickles the nose. Looks georgeous, seetrough reddish brown with a thin white head. Taste is sour cherries mixed with a smooth vanilla flavour. I'm not normally into sour ales, but a friend said you just have to taste them enough times. Turns out he's right, I really enjoy this one :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Grumpy¬ís Nordeast.  Strong sour aromas.  Palate is electric with sweet tartness.  Dark ruby color. No head.
Great nose, proper color, perfect amount of sour taste, clean finish, what more could you ask for in a sour.....too bad I got the last pour before the keg blew.

This beer is very sour. It¬ís a red flemish sour ale with complex flavors. it aged in an oak barrel for 18 months. Not one of my favourite beer types but if you like sour ales you should try to find this one. It¬ís a very special beer.
UPDATED: FEB 9, 2013 On tap at capitol beer. Color is dark ruby. With off white head aroma is vinegar and fruit. The taste is slight vinegar with a tart finish.

(bottle, 33cl) Clear, mahogany colour with a firm medium-sized tanned foamy head. Mildly woody malty aroma with caramel, a balanced level of acidity and fruity notes of morello cherries, red berries and citrus. Moderately sour and delicately sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a soft carbonation. Vinegary sour-fruity taste with a delicate caramel-malty base; very lasting sour-tart, woody and slightly tannic finish with present notes of cherries. An awesome Flemish Red. 11.I.13

Deep red pour, no real head.  Sour wild yeast on the nose.Tangy/bitter.  Dark fruit and wet stone, with young citrus on the tongue.  Dry finish.  Little too sour for my taste, but I would like to try it with food.

Aroma is ascetic - wonderful sourness. Pours a transparent red with no head or lacing. The taste is gloriously sour - makes my taste buds stand up and say "Thank you!" Medium body and medium carbonation.  Overall, an exceptionally pleasing sour beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Reddish brown with an off white head.  Fruity sour aroma with a hint of vinegar.  The vinegar aroma does not transfer to the flavor, very sour and fruity flavor.  Very nice sour.
Draught at Rattle & Hum NYC 2012. Really dark amber beer with a small offwhite head. Sourish, fruity aroma with some rubber notes. Sourish and fruity flavour. Really nice one :-)
muddy amber color, aroma of tart berries, vinegar, bread, grain, same flavors, notes of nuts, vanilla, caramel, very good brew and easy to drink
Bready and nutty, but still super sour, very rustic tasting, pretty good, go Belgium!

Bottle at Ultime Atome (Brussels, Belgium)
Aroma: Cherries, sweet fruits, some vinegar, and some chocolate.
Appearance: Dark maroon/brown with a small off-white head.
Taste: Tart with a medium sweetness.
Palate: Medium body and an average carbonation.
on draught at wob ft. myers. poured brown with hints of red colour in the light.  smelled very light but very acidic.  tasted very sour with hints of cherries. great sour

Bottled. Poured lovely garnet with a short beige head. The aroma picked up sour wood and cherry notes with accents of fruity funk and lesser cheese.. very interesting.  The flavor found sour cherry vinegar and aged oak throughout.. more tart on the edges.. finished dry with oak and sour cherries. Light-medium bodied, dry, and sour on the palate.. tasty and engaging.
Bottle from Jenny.  Reddish brown pour with little to no head.  Sour, but bearably so.  Brown sugar, lots of berries, tart cherry, and some woodiness.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle obtained through trade with JStax.  Pours translucent crimson with small off-white head.  Little lacing, mediumi/thin body, low carbonation, and sour aroma.  Taste is complex sour, and wonderful fruit (mostly cherry).  Not as sour as some, but very good, thanks JStax.

Amber lambic with a light tan head. Immediately acerbic. Cherry, chocolate and apple appear in the palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft in a CCB snifter. Pours very dark red. Vinegar sour cherries on nose. Very nice. Flavor follows suit. Really flavorf cherry vinegar with a clean crisp finish. Easy drinkind and relatively light mouthfeel. Good stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pour deep  reddish brown with a smallish head. Potent sour cherries, yoghurt, vanilla and marcipan nose, which are repeated in the mouth. Not too extreme what regards dryness, still with a good blend of caramel as a balance to the fruity sourness. Quite a nice surprise from Bockor!

Nice ruby body, thin white head.  Nose is lactic sourness, oak, balsamic, strawberries, cherries.  Flavor follows, lots of nice lemony lacto character, balsamic, really juicy berries, aspirin, wood.  Great balance.

Flaske 0,33l fra Vinmonopolet, Troms√∏ Langnes. Drukket i heimen 21 Nov 12. Amber. Pen, litt farget skum som fester seg til glasset og varer en stund. Frisk syrlig fruktaroma. Smaken lever opp til aromaen: Stikkelsb√¶r. Det dukker imidlertid opp en litt kjemisk undertone som drar ned helhetsinntrykket. Avslutter syrlig men forblir forfriskende.

Bottle, as pictured.  Poured a deep somewhat-clear ruby red.  Had a strong cherry taste to it, slight sourness, but very balanced.  Not overly-puckering sour, but enough to let you know it¬ís a sour beer.  Went over very well with some of my non-beer-drinker family members as well.

Brown redish colour with a thin white head. Caramel and sour fruit aroma. Sweet malts, some hops. Sour strawberries, vinager. Nice finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours red with a somewhat funky aroma of malt and some hops. Quite sour taste with raspberry and malt. Decent palate for how sour it is.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared by ygtbsm94. Thanks Brad.

The beer is orange to copper in color with 1/2" of off white head.

The aroma offers cherry pie, cherries, pie crust, oak, vanilla, stone fruits. It also smells musty, in a positive way.

The flavor is a mixture of sweet and sour cherries. Yum. Why have I not tried this before?!? Additional notes of vanilla and a bready, pie crust. Delicious beer.

The feel is acetic and sour, but not overly so. A touch of vinegar in the finish.

Overall, this is a beer I would like to have a case of in the cellar, so I could pull one out and enjoy every now and then.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-04-2012

From the singles cooler at Lemon Tree. For a $2 bottle of Belgian funk, what have I to lose? Spicy notes just from pouring it into a small chalice. First idea is of cinnamon, or perhaps coriander and clove. Close up, I only get a hint of sourness, mainly a note of sweet malt and just a little fruit juice. Reddish brown reminiscent of an old bottle of cherry juice, which is kind of to style, thin fizzy head. Taste has some sweetness to it, but there¬ís the sourness, too. Mostly cherry, smattering of cocoa. The tartness comes in waves, sometimes puckery, sometimes like SweeTarts candy. But never overboard as in Warheads candy. That would give me an excuse to get a few more bottles to lay down for comparison, but right now I have, believe it or not, an overfilled cellar.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Manglerud enjoyed at home
Dark brown, tanned head. Smells of tart fruits, funk, cherries, caramel and malts. Medium sweet, then medium sour, nice tart fruits  like apples and cherries, some caramel. Moderate bitter, mostly fruit bitterness. Very nice fruity beer, quite well balanced. Also the caramel is very well integrated. Love this one

Draught. Nose is sharp lactic acid with light malt notes and a vague fruitiness. Deep mahogany with no head. Flavor is sour with a slight sweetness. Notes of cherries, cranberries, raisin, and caramel. Medium bodied. Slow finish.

Pours a deep ruby brown with a finger of eggshell fizzy foam. On the nose its  earthy, tart and full of dried cherry and a touch of vanilla. On the palate its a lot of the same with a elegant delicate balance between sweet cherry fruit and tart earthiness. Nice dark woodsy touches in the finish.

Bottle, 9C. Deep red with a beige head that¬ís soon a wisp. Aroma of apples, cherries, under-ripe apricots, wood. Tart apples, some cherries and dried berries. Tart rather than funky, finish is of old vinegar and wood. The sourness builds up and left it feeling just a little thin, but vivid and refreshing.

Funky smell, but not too much. First mouthfeel is very sour and a bit less sparkly than i expected. The aftertaste is very rich and balances the sourness in a great way. Good at low and higher temps up to 10 c.
Dark brown red colour, medium carbonation. Very sour, balsamic vinegar, sour cherries. Very refreshing and full of taste.

330ml bottle picked up at Vinmonopolet Langnes. A deep ruby shade to a dark brown coloured body. Bare naked surface. Dusty sour aroma. Dry vanilla oak and tart, red berries to the taste buds. Tart and sweet ending. Well, well¬Öok, I thought, without drinking it all (Troms√∏, 15.12.2012).

The aroma is tart, sweet, and fruity with a touch of body odor and wood. The appearance maroon with a fizzy head that fades away. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is fizzy. Overall quite flawed but as the style goes quite drinkable.

Pours ruby red with an off-white head that is gone almost instantly. Aroma is pleasant with cherry being dominant.  Nice body and sour through and through. True Flanders tradition. My favorite beer as far as readily available goes.

Pours a nearly opaque reddish brown with a small off white head.  Aroma is tart cherries, green apples, and wheat.  The taste starts out cherry sweet, then green apple tart and finishes nearly vinegar sour.  Very good lambic/sour.

Deep dark ruby red, medium but fast settling head. Smells like cherries with medium level yeasty funk. Tastes Tarty and sour , but fruity cherry styles.  Enjoying this with fresh manjimup cherries. Yes.

0.33l bottle. This is a near-clear deep red one with a medium sized top that completely fades within seconds and leaves behind a thin sidesticking film. It has a aroma of cellar, sweet&sour red berries with traces of apple cider vinegar and wood. Not bad at all, but it still does not reach up to my top references-beers within the genre. It¬ís average on the carbonation and slight oily on the mouthfeel. More sour&sweet in the taste. Some paint-thinner thingy going on also with wild-forest yogurt. It¬ís sharp with a vinegar sting, brett, lots of sour limes berries pop up; red currants and cherries. The taste really grows on you reveling new layers of flavor for each sip. A really fine one! 07.11.2012
Wonderful sour beer. Strong sour flavour and powerful aroma makes finishing the bottle a challenge!
UPDATED: DEC 19, 2012 This beer was just fantastic! The way this bubbly beer works your mouth is nothing short of legendary! It is a sour ale that is just straight up delicious.

330 ml bottle. A clear deep red body with a dense off-white head. Strong aroma of fruit, acidic berries, wood, dry fruit and vinegar. Flavor is vinous acidic, berries, fruit and wood. Fine body with a tart aftertaste. Gives me a clear hint of cellar notes, a complex beer that feels both refreshing and a bit demanding in a well balanced way.

Pours a redish brown colour with a small white head. Aroma green apples, vanilla and oak. Flavour is strong green apples, vanilla, oak and spruce. Sour finish. Great complexity and balance. Really a great beer.

on tap at st. sour day at the holy grale, this isnt the first time ive had this beer and hoperfully it wont be the last. It pours a solid ruby color with little head but nice solid ring of bubbles. The smells of sour, sour fruit and hints of brett depending on when you take a whiff. There is a little toffee smell every once and awhile. the taste is all sour patch kids, awesome biting sour and hints of fruitish flavors. This is a great beer and it really shines all the way through the sip. Bites of acidity and fruit with no medicinal traits no paint thinner no sulfur. The palate is bubbly and lively, not too much at all. Overall this is a score a pure home run, its a beautiful sour beer that any sour lover would enjoy. This beer was an intro sour for a friend of mine and it changed his entire perception of what beer can really be.

Bottle. Pours a clear deep red-hued mahogany brown body with a medium creamy beige head. Looks great. Nose is plums, dark berries, light balsamic, wood, figs and hints of leather and sour funk tones. Taste is light wooden vanilla and red fruit tones up front, then transcending into a lemony tart lactobacterial landscape flanked by figs and plums. Lovely mild, yet tart finish. Medium carbonation, slick mouthfeel with high drinkability. A splendid Flemish red ale, and I have a strong suspicion this will become one of my go-to beers if it stays accessible through Vinmonopolet.

Bottle. Pours dark brown color with quickly disappearing head. Aroma is vinegar, cork. Flavor is very sour, sparkling wine, red wine, wood, dry. Unfortunately the sourness supresses other flavors too much.

12oz bottle $5.99. Dark red-brown color, good head at first and then a film of bubbles. Smells a bit like cherries, wood, brett adn possibly pedio(?), I anticipate it will be sour. Taste is more complex than I expected with the wood playing a good part, sour but not completely mouth puckering. One of the better Flanders Reds that I¬íve had.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-15-2012 02:26:51

Light aroma notes of bread and apples. Decent palate, leaves Granny Smith tartness on the lips. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

No idea how I overlooked this beer for so long. This is a great sour ale and wasn¬ít nearly the price of some of the others I¬íve come across. Complex flavors. Fruits and vinegars. Citrus and pome, sweet grapefruit and grapes. The yeasts are present in the flavor. Not a whole lot of astringency. Great finish.
UPDATED: MAR 29, 2014 Dark purple colour. Sour aroma, cola. Sour taste, with a touch of sweetness. Vinegar and apples. Overall quite a nice Flemish Red, though I still prefer Duchesse.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours clear dark amber with a good sized creamy off-white head. Aroma is funky fruity, barnyard, wood and red ripe berries. Taste is fresh and dry fruity, crisp and tart, very well balanced, lingering dark red berries, good one.

On 35 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet Stovner.
Amber color, ok foam.
Aromas from red fruit tea
Medium body & high complexity .
High intensity sourness and ok bitterness.
Very enjoyable

3 nov 2012, tap. Brown/ruby, clear. Nose is vinaigrette and cherries. Thin body and mildly fizzy. Cherry lifesavers up front and vinaigrette finish. Rather tart.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2013 Flaske kj√∏pt p√• polet i vika.m√∏rk r√∏d farge uten skum, smaker kirseb√¶r, vanilje,eik,druestein. En veldig god sourale

Medium tan head.  Clear brown body.  Vinous wooden red berries
aroma with yoghurty notes.  Sweet-acidic wooden wild berry taste
with yoghurty notes.  Mid-bodied.  Mild, soft mouthfeel with
astringent sting.  Dry-sweet-acidic wild berries aftertaste with
wooden yoghurty notes.  A good one.  Clean and highly drinkable,
but still subtle.  (0.33l bottle, wine monopoly, Triaden
L√∏renskog.)

330 ml bottle. Dark reddish brown colour. Crystal clear.  Medium-sized white head initially, but it falls down quickly. Nice sweet vinegary aroma with dried fruit and a little funk. Nice acidic flavours with a good dose of candy-like flavours. Red berries, vanilla og cherries. A little too sweet and slightly artificial, but overall a really nice Flemish red.

Pours dark reddish brown with a tiny off white head.  Aromas of sour cherries, barnyard and a little caramel.  Tons of energy on the palate - a cascade of sour berries, barnyard funk and those sour coke bottle candies that the kiddies like.  Also lots of grapey, winey flavours.  A delicious sour- I¬íll be having this one again.

Beautiful taste, dark, ruby color. Thirst-quenching yet nuanced and delicious. Subtly sweet and sufficiently tart.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2013 Poured into snifter. Pours an opaque ruby brown with a finger of tan head that disperses quickly. Decent lacing. Aroma is sour, cherries and grapes. Flavors of cherries, plums and grapes with a nice tartness that lingers. Moderate to strong carbonation and light body give it a refreshing mouthfeel. Overall, a delicious flemish sour.
Colore rosso ambrato, schiuma abbondante e persistente. Aroma acido, acetico e lattico; fruttato, ciliegia. Al gusto acida, fruttata, con note di legno

Bottle: &nbsp Deep ruby, moderate tannish head, foamy, little lacing. &nbsp Oakish and immature cherries on the nose, tart yet somewhat sweet. &nbsp Sweet and tart on the tongue, seems like a mix of young and old cherries, on oak, with a dry backside. &nbsp Very simple, but enjoyable. &nbsp Seems a little artificial in its sweetness tho. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are average. &nbsp Very dry and tart finish. &nbsp Good, but simple.

Absolutely stunning a delicious sour beer! Found on a dusty shelf in a small beer store in New Jersey, those people don¬ít know what they are missing. Aroma was great. Strong must, vinegar and stale malt. My mouth watered at first whiff. Pour was a murky dirty red with no bubbles or head. Taste was perfect. Mouth puckering sour and full of flavor. Heavy sour cherry that never ventures into the "sweet" territory with strong doses of vinegar and malt. The finish leaves the top of the mouth feeling the sour sting for quite some time after the swallow. Carbonation was mild but fitting. Wish I could get this regularly.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Pours dark amber-red with a smallish light tan head.  Nose is woodsy, sharp, with a creamy undertone.  Cherries and vanilla ice cream.  Sweet and sour flavor.  No bitterness.  Medium mouthfeel.  Slight barnyard funkiness in the end of the nose.  Very good.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2015 Had this today again, yum!  Old rating: Had this on tap at vintage, nice place.  Beautifully sour or tart aroma. Oh, looks like rodenbach.  Yez, tart olfactory greets my nose and makes my mouth water. Very yummy crazy sour thing happening. Yes, very yummy. Fun tart experience. What a drink, need more. Finish? What finsih, its all gone. Balderdash. This was a real great beer drinking experience. Not over the top like so many tart beers, just right. The bst beer I¬íve tasted in a long, long time. It reminded me why sour and wild beer is my favoritie style.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
11.2 oz bottle served in a Darkness Tulip. Batch 01.

A: Pours a transparent mahogany with a light hay colored head. The body is bubbly and supports a nice frothy head with solid retention. The finally subsides to a thick collar and leaves some splotchy stick.

S: Tart grape skins, cherry pits, slight acidic berry. Earthy malt and oak flavors. The nose is spot on.

T: There is slight pucker up front from the acidity, but it quickly gives way to sweet malts, tart cherries, and dry grape skins. There is an earthy oak flavor towards the back end and the tartness sticks to the back of throat.

M: Creamy and smooth with mild puckering on the backend that tickles the through. Medium carbonation and body.

O: Very solid. Complex flavors, but goes down very smooth. I don¬ít typically like this style, but this was very delicious.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-25-2012

Bottle. Moderate grain for the malt, light to moderate flowers for the hops, faint barnyard for the yeast with sour apple, red wine vinegar and mixed berries in the background. Head is small, fizzy/frothy , white with some spotty lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is clear dark mahogany. Flavor starts heavily acidic and very sour, then finishes moderately acidic and lightly bitter and still sour. Palate is light to medium, watery with a soft carbonation and a very tart finish. I think I¬ím getting used to Sour Ales...this one wasn¬ít horrible.

Bottle, poured into trappist glass. Dark, dark red yet pretty clear, with a khaki head that dissipated pretty quickly, leaving just a little knot-stock of foam in the middle. Nose is fresh, tart cherry, bits of wet wood and slight apple cider vinegar. Hints of vanilla and, surprisingly (I didn¬ít expect to agree with the bottle description) chocolate round out the puckering tartness. Really nice sour.

pours a plum red smell of sour cherry.  extremely tart, mixture of sour cherry, sweet cherry, blueberries,raspberries. very pungent,wouldst be able to drink more than one but could see this pairing well with dessert

Pours a deep plum red with a light tan head.  Aromas of oaky vanilla, cranberries, cherries, hints of peppery barnyard, and slight acidity.  Perfect medium light body, that finishes crisp and blows your taste buds into heavenly oblivion with flavors of: sour cherries, cranberries, blackberries, raspberries, lots of balanced acidity (lactic and just enough acetic), tons of tannins from the wood, and a bit of barnyard all balanced out by some residual malty sweetness.  In my opinion this is the best Flemish Red I¬íve ever had and one of my favorite beers.  This would be killer with goat cheese, cheesecake, foie gras, or lobster.

Tried it on tap at Mongoose versus Cobra in Houston. Very tart, sour cherry notes. Drop kick to the taste buds!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Balanced tart desert. Layers of tart candied malt, sweet berries, sour apple, light bitter carbonation, with a long sour finish that doesn't overwhelm. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of tart black cherry and slight funky yeast.  Pours deep deep red with slight film.  Taste is super tart and sweet with sour apple, cherry and a nice yeast.  Fantastic sour beer.
this is a very enjoyable ale. Can be both enjoyed with or without food. I bought a 4 pack of this just recently and am enjoying every single drop of this delicious elixir.
Solid sour. Quite puckery, a touch of sweetness but not much. More carbonation than normal.
Red brown color with thin white head.  Cherry champagne aroma..Complex layers of sweet raspberry, cork and sour candy flavors.   Nice lingering tart and dry palate.

On tap at La Porte Noire, Brussels. Pours a hazy deep red colour with a small off-white head. Aromas of berries and cherries, not far from a kriek. I also sence some wood, sweet berries and honey. Nice balanced and lasting flavour of sweet berries, raspberries, leather and salt. Has a slick mouthfeel, and is not especially bitter. This is a fantastic sour ale with a lot of taste in every drop. Feels like a sweeter version of a kriek.

PIcked up 2 bottles of this in Belgium. Best by 2/15/14. Enjoyed in a bordeaux glass.

A - Very light red pour into the glass. But in the bowl, it¬ís red to dark brown appearance. Nice clarity, no yeast or haze cloudiness.

S - Cherries and tart funkiness on the nose. Hints of oak and a slight hint of that notorious Rodenbach yeast strain. However, it¬ís weak as far as picking things out. It took a lot of work to pick out what I smelled.

T - Lots of cherries, oak, vanilla and a hint of pineapple. Lots of tropical / passion fruit going on here. Very sweet, very tart and zero hints of vinegar at all. It¬ís a solid tasting beer!

M - Medium carbonation, light body. Easy to drink.

O - This is a great tasting beer. Very earthy and rugged but tasty and enjoyable!

This is a fun Sour Ale! I loved it! Aroma is strong and sweet, with minimal head. Color is deep red and slightly opaque. My first thought about the flavor and palate was that I had just popped a Sour Cherry Warhead into my mouth, thats pretty sour. Good blend of flavor and palate.
Aroma is sour, but full. Pours dark red with almost no head. Palate is robust, can detect the alcohol, and sweet. Ends with a sour punch, making it fun to drink.

Draught at Rattle&Hum, NYC. Clear amber/brown beer with a beige head. Vinous fruity aroma, sourish, red berries, grapes, rubber, banana, hop notes, citrus. Sourish fruity flavor, hay, herbal, grapes, rubber, grapefruit, lemongrass, barnyard notes, red berries, woody, peach, sour. Really fresh and lovely to find this complexity in a rather low alcohol beer.
Tap @ Brussels Beer Weekend, 2012. Pours clear amber with a creamy head. Fruit, barnyard, caramel and oak. Lambic like notes. Dry, tart and crisp. Balanced. Lovely!

Pours red brown with a large light tan head. Smells mildly sour and mildly sweet. Taste is sour with a very subtle sweetness. Medium-bodied with an astringent texture and prickly mouth-carbonation, Bockor Cuvee des Jacobins Rouge finishes with subtle fruit and fair amounts of sourness.

P: Deep brown ruby red with a lacing for a head. A: vanilla, sour apples and funky yeast. T: stone fruits, green apples, cranberries, lemon, pretty sour and tart but not overpowerin. M: full body and dry. A really enjoyable flanders.

Sour, somewhat vinegary, but great flavor. Rouge color. Love this beer. Blah blah blah. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear reddish brown colour, slightest white head. Aroma of wood, caramel, fruity, cherry, sour notes, light coffee, red fruits, quite tart. Tart flavour, citrus, acidic, wood, brown sugar, vanilla, red wine and light redcurrant. Finish vanilla, redcurrant, red grapes and citrus.
Nice one!
(From 33cL bottle @ De Kluizenaar, Nijmegen)

Blood red body, thin pinkish-white head, quickly receded to a thin tight colar. Only a few stray trails of lacing.  Nose is full of bold cherries, grape soda, oak and a hint of dark chocolate and lactic notes.  Flavor is a bit cleaner with cherries and grape soda taking center stage.  Mild sourness complements of a blend of acetic and lactic acids.  Mild carbonation.  Medium to light bodied.  An exceptional value.

This is a great sour.  As most sours, this one doesn¬ít have much head at all.  The aroma is very sharp and almost "meaty".  A very musky, dark fruit aroma that really hits you but in a good way.  The taste is not as sour as some that I¬íve had but it is sour enough and is a well balanced beer.  Nice one to have just to sip while you are relaxing :)
Poured from bottle. A deep dark red color, nice medium head. This is a good sour. It has a nice sweetness too it. If you like this style, buy this beer.
On tap. Nice ruby red color. Dark tart cherries, wet wood, funk, cheese, brown sugar, some vinegar.
Can¬ít argue with this rating.  A super example of the style.  Lovely cherry taste throughout with a nice hit of sourness.  Pours a dark red color.   Part of the 2012 Downtown LA Craft Beer Crawl.
Draft at Capone¬ís. Pours a medium brown with little head. nose is acetic acid, cherries and lacto. first sip is malt vinegar with mild brown malt, finish is sour cherries. nice

A reddish ale with a soft dissipating head.  The aroma of cured cherries and complex sugars hit the nose and then the palate.  The beer is smooth with great balance of dark chocolate-cherry and rum flavoring.  A wonderful beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Lucky¬ís Belgian Beer Festival. This was the highlight of the evening. Pours hazy brown with a slight reddish note. Small beige head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is sour cherries, quite pleasing. Taste is complex with sour cherry notes balancing some initial sweetness. Notes of vinegar, chocolate, and some definite barnyard funk as well. Finish is tart. Very nice wild ale.

Refreshing! Aromas of sour cherries and damp wood. Zingy sweet tart flavors on the palate remind you this isn't your average brew. Loved it.

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...
Pours a nice dark brown color with a nice white foamy head. Fruity notes with grapes. with a hint of a steak sauce note. enjoy this beer more than I thought will definitely have this 1 again.

On tap at Farmhouse Tap and Grill in Burlington VT. Ruby mahogany with a ruby tan head. Nice sour and malt mix, alcohol, tart cherries, acidic. Moderate body and carbonation, musty sourness with a nice tart cherry and sweet malt balance with a long dry finish. Tasty.

Bottle at Tria.  Ruby red color, small head.  Very sour cherry ale - very smooth finish, however and found this beer to be excellent overall.  Very enjoyable, already looking forward to having this one again!

pours a dark amber hue with a small light brown head that is mostly diminishing
aroma of citrus dark fruits
flavor is tart all the way through

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur rouge√¢tre sombre, mousse moyenne d¬íaucune tenue. Pardonnez l¬íinculte mais ce n¬íest pas du tout mon style de pr√©dilection, d¬íautant que celle-ci est sans doute la plus aigre du style que j¬íai jamais bu! D√©finitivement trop acide pour moi, je ne me suis pas r√©gal√©! Carbonnation fine et assez abondante. Trouv√©e √† Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert.

Bottle.  Pours dark red with a very small off-white head.  Sour aroma of tart citrus/cherries, leather, earth and wood.  Great earthy tart flavor with notes of cherry, wood and funk.  Smooth but tart finish.  A great sour.
On tap at Rattle N Hum, July 2012. Very dark red with a small head. Really sour aroma and taste with wood, vinegar and fruit. Refreshing and nicely drinkable.
Pours a dark reddish brown color with a small canvas colored head. notes of malt vinegar, vinyl, pepper, meat, and wood. Sour mouthfeel with lively bubbles.

Great lambic that pours a deep reddish tan with not much head. Nose is very much of cherry. Taste is cherry with a tinge of vanilla, just playing the line between sour and overwhelming. The taste was great, although the palate let off and the sour became a bit much at the end.
One of my favorite beers at PIB ¬í12. Gorgeous dark red pour and red head, sour cherry and currant notes dominated, with a hint of vanilla. Starts sour without puckering and eases out.

11.2 oz into small tasting glass

A- Deep amber, fine head that fades fast.
S- Smells sour I guess? My palate is not very refined when it comes to sours so that¬ís the best I can do.
T- Sweet and sour seem fairly well balanced. Again, my palate is not refined enough to enjoy this, so I can¬ít say much more.
M- Fairly thick, low carbonation.
O- Sours are not my thing. As sours go, this is one of the better I have had, so I don¬ít want to rate it poorly.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-18-2012 03:09:43
Sour cherry aroma.  Flavor starts sweet, with a very sour, acidic finish.  This isn¬ít my favorite style, but this is still a great beer.

Brownish red colored pour. Nary a head and no lacing to be found anywhere. Acetic, sour fruit notes in the nose. Very tart bite up front. Nice sourness mixed with a slightly fruity note. Not bad. Would drink again.

Deep red color with a large head that quickly faded. Aroma is a mix of sour, vanilla/oak, and cherry. Taste is a very pleasant tart that seems more inviting then any other sour I've had. Finishes dry that welcomes another sip. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A great beer for the girl in you life that swears she doesn¬ít drink beer.  Sweet, tart cherry flavor with a lasting delicious finish.  No added fruit is masking this excellent sour, the gateway for all things delicious.

Bottle from New Leaf Market. Clear, deep amber pour with a fizzy whit ehead that fades quick. Nose is nice sour cherries, vinegar, lemon peels, hints of hay, funk and maybe some lingering vanilla beans. Balance leaning on the puckering vinegar side with more sour cherries, lemons, leather and underlying barn funk. Finishes tart with great carbonation. Pretty damn tasty.

Clear dark mahogany with a quickly fading tan head... tart lightly funky cherry oaky aroma, mild sweetness, more tart than sweet in this case cherry is relatively intense... lively fruity cherry mild tartness, mild sweetness, definitely a top notch oud bruin... intensely sour up front, fades quickly to a sweetness that is still overtaken by the sour... medium bodied, very flavorful...
Pours a dark red-brown with a minimal head.  Smell is cherry, dough, earthy.  Taste is very sour with a bit of sweetness - cherries, a little chocolate - very powerful.
Sour and sweet at the same time. Dark cherry flavor and color. Distinct Iambic tartness. On tap at The Blue Nile.

Poured on draft. Pours a brownish amber with a light khaki colored head of foam. The aroma is in your face with dry tartness. I get influences of cherry and maybe some strawberry? Taste is all sourness and very drying. Cottonmouth ensues. I really like this beer.

On tap at The Meddlesome Moth. Pours dark reddish amber with small off-white head. Aromas of sour cherries, some wood, dark malt, and light vanilla. Flavors of sour cherries, bit of vinegar, wet oak, and some vanilla. Finishes with good amount of mouth puckering goodness. Great sour and a nice surprise.

Bottle.  Pours a deep mahogany with almost no head or lacing but a steady stream of fine bubbles.  Aroma is sour cherries, some nice funk, bit of vinegar, some wood.  Flavor is sour cherries, puckering sourness, mild funky yeast, slight citrus, some pear, good bit of oak, wood, vanilla.  Mouthfeel is a bit astringent, fine carbonation, medium weight.  Love it.

(1st ever beer review); It pours with a brownish-red color with a decent  initial head.  The aroma is good but kinda leans towards the vinegar smell, however that seems to change as the beer gains some warmth in the glass.  It surprises you on the first taste... It¬ís a puckering sour with the taste of tart cherries and finishes clean.  Like other sours, time in a glass help expand the flavors that this beer has.  Don¬ít rush the 11.2 oz of sour ale and allow it to mature as you drink it.

Sweet & sour cherries, 
S - tart cherries, mild vinegar
T- vibrant sweet and sour cherries. Very well balance between the sourness and the sweet fruity cherries. Faint oakiness in there as well. 

Overall an exceptional beer! I would drink it again!

On draft at the Half Moon in Kennett. The pour was ruby red-tan, the head off white and average. The aroma was tart cherries, vanilla, faint faint oak. The flavor followed, tartness was present but not overdone, well complemented the base flavors, tannins and bret touches done well. Each sip seemed to change delicately with the temperature. Good stuff.
Smooth, easy-drinking. Not overly complex and more on the funky side. Sour cherry, touch of wood.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2012 Pours a dark red color with a small amount of head.  Big aroma of sour fruit, cherries, berries, and a little vanilla.  Taste is like having a liquid jolly rancher.  I haven¬ít had a lot of sour ales but this is definitely the most sour I¬íve had and I think it was too much for me.  Very acidic and vinegar like finish.  I appreciate what this beer does and I enjoyed drinking it, but its just not my favorite style.  Definitely an acquired taste and I¬ím not totally there yet.

On draught at DBA in Brooklyn, no cute story... just a beer on draught that I drank and rated. 

Pours a deep reddish brown with a small but well retained head. 

The aroma is lots of sour cherry, wet wood and a little bit of balsamic vinegar. 

The flavor is mostly lots of sour cherries, the beer is earthy, bracingly sour, only mildly sweet right up front but finishes very dry. 

I¬íd like to find a few of the bottles!

Bottle.  Aroma has huge notes of sour cherry, raspberry, citrus, vanilla and sweet tarts.  Awesome.  Dark brown reddish hue with a small off-white head that mostly diminished and left little lace.  Flavor is heavy sweet, tart and sour.  Palate is medium bodied and watery soft.  Overall a very nice sour tart brew that really delivered the tartness in spades.  A good one!
Draft at Falling Rock. Nice dark brown pour with ruby, red highlights. Small khaki head. Sour cherry aroma. Pungent, sour flavor with an acetic finish. Yummy.
Dark red color with a small head.  Tart and lightly sour aroma.  A bit of vinegar.  Hay, oak.  Very tart flavor.  Moderate cherry, oak, hay.  Acidic.

Bottle. Pours deep red/mahogany with an off-white head which quickly fades. No retention/lace. Aroma of sour cherry, wood, tannins, light dark fruit. Taste is moderately sour, woody, tannin, earth, light sweetness. Palate is dry, low carbonation, slick, sour finish. Good.

Bottle - Pours deep ruby red with a thin light tan ring of head. Dried cherries, white grape, some Turkish apricot, and some sour SweetTart notes. Very smooth. The taste...holy hell is this good. Big sour cherries, Smarties, vanilla, and a lots of bracing vinegar sourness. Finishes with big time Smarties and cherry. Both puckering and smooth on the finish, if that makes any sense. Wonderfully silky smooth palate, probably due to the fine-bubbled carbonation. Oh my God I love this beer.

Love this beer! Pours dark ruby brown with an off white head. Tart cherries on the nose. Tart cherry flavor throughout, yet deliciously bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl Bottle at Lost Property. Clear deep red to purple colour, off white head. Aroma of balsamic vinegar, cinnamon, tart red fruits, red grape juice, vanilla, you can tell there¬ís lambic in there. Flavour is rather tart at first, red fruits, sour lemon, red grapes, very vineous, light vanilla and cinnamon, tart fruity finish. Light bodied. Very tasty Flemish Red.

Draft. Enticingly tart, gently sweet and fruity aroma, lightly acetic and woody, with notes of cherry and red grape, some definite yeast funk is present here as well. Deep, dark red in color, clear, with a lasting, fine head. Flavor profile is fruity and features a strong degree of sourness throughout, tannic, dry, oaky and with a brief flash of sweetness, more yeast funkiness and farmy character appearing as well. Somewhat winey finish. "Warms" the mouth, with a sufficiently sharp, acidic bite, active on the palate, body is medium. Incredibly flavorful and complex, also stunningly sour. Wow, this was delicious.
On tap at the Brass Tap, poured a dark redish brown color, aroma of wet wood, cherries, cocoa, and a sligght twangy tartness.  Flavor is the same with some balsamic notes.
Dark red with whitish amber head.  Great sour beer.  Strong sour fruit overtones, balsamic aromas.
Reddish brown pour, mostly white head. Nice tart red wine vinegar, wet wood, some light fruit. Flavors are incredibly well integrated.  Loads of balsamic notes, red wine, sour fruit. Incredible.
Bottle, garnet brown color with thin foam ring, dusty wood and red wine aroma, flavor is quite tart with notes of oak and red wine , musty vinegar finish

Pours a dark reddish amber with a light beige head.  Extremely potent aroma.  Enticing as well.  Very, very sour and tart, with grape, cherry, and apple.  Taste is so sour it made my mouth pucker!  Cherry and apple come out the most, grape is still there, with vanilla notes underneath.  This is quite oily and sticky when you drink it.  Carbonation is softer, yet is easily apparent.  And needless to say the aftertaste is strongly sour and tart.  It lingers a long time also.  I must say that this is the most extreme example of this this style that I have ever tasted.  If you like these, you will be thrilled.  I am beside myself that I have found something this delicious.

I¬ím not usually a fan of this style - but I was impressed here. The body was a very nice and clean ruby red with light bubbles. The aroma filled your face with rich cherries, cocoa and earth - a lot like a bold red wine. The taste was as sush, but with a distinctive tart finished followed by a lingering yeast aftertaste. Nicely done.

When I started getting into sours a friend suggested this beer as a reference.  This beer is not over tart, goes down easy, and is very refreshing.  Please try this one if you want to taste some sour goodness.

330 ml. bottle. Pours a thick ivory head, long retention, with extensive lacing, over a clear, reddish copper (SRM 20) body....nose is acid, cherry, barnyard funk....taste is dried cherry, hints of plum, light cocoa, chocolate, hints of vanilla, medium acetic/lactic acid sourness, musty funk, minimal hints of sweetness as the sour ebbs on the finish....mouth feel light of medium, carbonation adds tingle to the sourness. This meets the style of a Flanders Red Ale (part of the larger Sour Ale grouping) exactly. The sourness, complex aromas and flavors of this beer are exceptional. It is quite delicious. BJCP 8/3/16/4/7

Dark, ruby color with beige head.  Poured from the bottle to a tulip.  Aroma is like the sour section of a candy shop.  Grape candy(not real grape), and tary, giving off more of a processed candy aroma than traditional sweets.  Taste is sweet until the sour patrol hits you seconds later.  Unique and unlike anything I¬íve ever tasted with the label "beer".  Almost like a liquid version of warheads or shocktarts.  Gone in minutes it drinks so easily.   Uniqueness overall defines this brew.  DO NOT drink it too cold.  Let it open up a little in the warm air.  The relevance makes it difficult to compare to anything I have ever tried in terms of beer.
Draft at Southern Brewing in Tampa.  Pours a clear, reddish amber color with a small beige head.  Aroma is amazing with the perfect amount of sourness.  Flavor is outstanding!  Truly delicious.
Bottle to oversized snifter. Looks good; rusty with little to no carbonation and thin lacing. Smells Good; tart and wild. Tastes very good; full and sour with a nice mouthfeel. Good stuff!

On tap at Roebling Tea Room in Brooklyn. Pours clear red, a sort of bright cherry-red veering into mahogany. Aroma is sour berries, hint of funkiness, and some miscellaneous other notes I can¬ít quite pin down. Flavor is dominated by the sour/tart/acidic notes, which are a complex mixture of fruit-tartness, lactic sour, even some lemon-ish acidity. Quite a bit of fruit sweetness just behind that. Pretty nice.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2012 Powerful sour in this bottle, with a whole slew of delicious puckering face-slapping tastes.  Starts with a sweet cherry lean, one that turns green and envious rather fast, with a sour apple middle that rolls into a tart, rich, deeply-oaked finish.  The oak and sourness linger on the palate for ages, despite a rather brisk carbonation.  A modest funky note begins to show as the beer warms, but it brings with it a fruity sweetness that rides an old leather saddle.  Not a pretty beer, but absolutely wonderful nonetheless.
Very cherry on the nose. Clear chestnut,medium head. Tangy cherry, a bit sweet for the style.Alcohol well concealed.

Bottle at home, from my Minneapolis Town Hall glass. I probably walked past this unassuming little bottle 5 or 6 times when I was Zipp¬ís, really glad Tyler pointed it out to me as I wouldn¬ít have picked it up without his recommendation. Pours deep ruby/brown,with a thin off-white head, and poor lacing. Nose is leather, tart cherries, funk, acid, demerara sugar, rum, and preserved fruits. Flavours are bracingly sour, but not acetic or over-the-top; lots of cherry, strawberry, funk, leather, semisweet in the mouth, then very drying as it moves into the finish. Like a better Duchesse.

OK - Im a dark beer lover, but the wife is gone for two weeks, and im trying to expand my horizons a bit. This was not the ticket apparently. The smell was ok, and i can definitely taste the cherries, etc. Has too much of a ¬íbite¬í though...strong vinegar, and not enough balance. I wouldnt say it was filtered through a jock strap, but it wouldnt be a stretch. I guess it¬ís a highly acquired taste.

33cl bottle thanks to Dutchdrebus. Dark red-brown color, small off-white to beige head. Smell pretty sour, vinegar, lightly fruits. Taste is very sour, vinegar, tart. Not dry sour and some sour fruityness is clearly present as well. Medium body, low to medium carbonation. Too much sharp sourless for me though.

Bottle @ home. Amber to red-brown colour with a head that is quickly gone. Smells very sour, cellar, brett, slightly dusty. Tastes sour, very fresh, red fruits, also some sweetness. Not bad! Gopd carbo, full body. Slightly dry in the aftertaste.

Light fruity aroma. A little bit sour but well balanced. A little bit sweet but fresh. Very easy to drink. Highly recommend.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 mL btle. Dark, deep mahogany in color w/ white head. Nose is outstanding w/ vibrant aromas of green apple, cherries, balsamic and a subtle hint of vanilla from the barrel. Everything on the nose follows through on the palate of this complex beer. The sourness is wonderfully balanced and is not sharp or acidic. Wonderful beer that shines with earthy cheeses or anything from the grill.

tulip.dark red color small withe head. Smell of apple, and citrus.
taste very sour and citric withe some hints of cherry. light body

Pours a clear ruby color with a thin tan head.  Aroma is fruity and tart with sour cherry and subtle oaky notes.  Flavor has some cherry vanilla notes and some sour funkiness...a bit of caramely sweetness and oak towards the end.  Mouthfeel is light and lively with a dry slightly oaky sour cherry finish.
Red-brown in color with an average sized off-white head. Aroma is of leather, raspberries, oak, must, funk, earth, and brown sugar. Taste is tart cherries, oak, leather, light funk, and berries.
Red in color, decent beige head, clear look. The smell is cherries, acidic, tart, fruits, and nice. The taste is good, tart, cherry, fruits, dry, and good.

11.2 oz bottle purchased at Lukas Liquors in Overland Park, Kansas.  02 is printed on the back label, not sure what that means.  The pour is a slight haze ruby copper brown with a one inch light tan head that lasted nicely. The aroma is bright citrus and cherry sour. The fruit of black cherry shows through nicely as well. Also a hint of vanilla present. The taste tart black cherry sour, acetic, but not overly so. The lemon citrus comes out and the back, along with vanilla woodiness. The flavors all meld and layer nicely on each other. The palate has great soft carbonation, and the bright acidity and sour really shine in the long finish. This is a nice Flemish Sour.

Bottle picked up at SL.. Love the nose on this... lots of cherries, slight saw dust, wood notes, tart/sourness. Dark red in color, small head that faded quickly. Taste follows the nose... Nice tart/sour cherry taste, some dark fruits, wood notes, really lively! Lots of flavor for a low alcohol beer. Very complex. Body has a good amount of carbonation but still smooth. Overall: I forgot what I paid for this but it really doesnt matter, this was very enjoyable, the rita hayworth of redheads! Thanks to matt for the rec!

On tap at Congregation Ale House. Nice tart nose, cherries and light hops, balsamic sweetness and light oak. Dark coppery brown clearn with creamy off-white lacing head. Medium-heavy body with medium-high carbonation. Starts tangy and tart, with sweet and sour cherries, lactic-balsamic acidity and caramel, oak. Tart finish, light astringency with nice cherry pie after. Delicious.
From tap. Pours a deep garnet red wih very little head.  Stong woody and sour aromas. Super sour taste with red fruit flavors. Very pronounced and distinctive

From Tap on ZBF 2012
A clear dark brown/red beer. White carb, quickly dissipated. Fruity Aroma with wood.  Long light bitter Finish

Thanks to curly for the trade. Dark brown, loose white head. Really nice aroma of cherry, lemon, and oak. Nicely tart, with a lot fruit character, plus citrus, vinegar, and oak. Tasty and easy drinking.
This is wonderfully sour and fruity.  Very very tasty.  This should probably be on your go get list.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2012 Sampled on tap at the Hay Merchant, Houston TX; April 2012
The beer arrives from the tap topped by a creamy, amber tinged, tan colored, one-finger thick head. The beer is a concentrated amber color. The nose smells primarily of lactic acidity, with a backdrop of fruity notes that hint at cherries. There is a touch of oxidized malt richness here as well some caramelized malt aromatics. 

The flavor is definitely tart, even leaning towards sour. It is quite dry up front, but does pick up some sweetness and even an acetic bit as it moves towards the finish.
