The acidity is predominantly lactic in character, which is good. Other flavors of cherry, some earthiness, maybe a touch of oak and some astringency are noticeable here.

This beer is actually fairly simplistic, it is satisfying and tasty though.

Purchased at Fox & Obel in Chicago, IL with the help of a Groupon, enjoyed on a Sunday afternoon prior to eating some homemade chili.  Appearance a cola like brown with a dark ruby red base and a small white head that rims around the glass.  Aroma of sour cherries, small touch of vanilla, bit of sour, smells nice and slightly complex.  Taste is definitely sour but not as sour as other sours I¬íve had.  Cherries are the dominating factor, and I do get a bit of the cocoa in the flavor as well which is unique.  It¬ís highly carbonated, kind of a belcher, which I haven¬ít particularly noticed from other sours I¬íve had.  It¬ís definitely not an easy drinker, a small sipper, but it is enjoyable.  Happy to have purchased.
Tap at hay merchant Houston. Dark copper and clear. Nose is slight sweet, a bit woody. Taste is a bit sugary, with hints of cherries and wood. Slight tartness on the end. Decent and unique.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Beautiful color.  Sweet smell with a sharp tart beginning.  Finishes with a bit of vinegar taste.  Overall, very nice beer.

A draft pour at The Local Beer Bar in Eureka, CA this came in the glass a very dark red with a small tan head.  Nose of ripe cherries with some sour notes.  Smells great. The body is medium, and the mouthfeel slick, The flavor is rich black cherry and a really pleasant sourness.  The finish is both malty and sour lambic. This is a sipping beer and it enjoyed it a lot from first sip to last drop.

Poured from bottle. Deep dark red with cream color head.smell of sour cherries with the usual funky characteristics of this style. Taste is initially puckering, then the sweetness of cherries and plumbs come through. Hints of malt at the end and not overly acidic. Taste is complex and slightly different every sip. A little to sour and tart to be called sessionable... my tastebuds could only handle one

Tallahassee, Fl  New Leaf Market - 11.2 oz bottle. Dark reddish-black brown pour with a light off-white head. Strong sour aroma with hints of raspberries and vinegar. Delightfully delicious sour flavor with some raspberry notes, some sour cherries, a bit of burnt chocolate. Nice puckery mouthfeel. One of the better sours I have had in a while, good character.

Aroma: smells a little like a vinegary red wine without the funky smell normally associated with sours.Appearance: light head as expected but a really nice, deep red-brown color.Taste: wow. A really tart flavor throught the entire taste. This is what a sour beer should taste like.Palate: thin but this class is.Overall: A great looking beer that defines what sour should taste like. It is the right beer to drink leisurely while sitting outside in the evening. Even at the low ABV I would not consider this a session beer because it is not one you could drink multiple times in an evening and enjoy.

Deep red color with a slight faint head.  Aroma of sour cherries.  Slight vinegar too.  Mouth is pretty nice.  Taste is sour stone fruit, lots of cherry with a hint of vanilla.  Not bad, but I couldn¬ít drink this all the time.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2012 Bottle at Eulogy. Poured a very dark red brown with a tiny head. Quite delicious moldy black cherry with flavors running the entire cherry tree root to stem.  Some slight cocoa flavors from the malt but full fleshy cherry dominates. Exhibits a lot of age and care. A few heavier malty flavors offset some of the sour bite though the blend between the elements is wonderfully smooth. Potent, yet noticeably better married to its mixed flavors than  your average lambic. A delightful find! Update: Had the draft version a few months later. Still great, but was noticeably sweeter and fruitier.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, light brown, mostly lasting.
Body is dark amber/red.

Aroma is lightly malty (caramel), lightly yeasty (horseblanket), with notes of cherry, old wood, Mandarin orange, honey.

Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately to heavily acidic.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, moderately to heavily acidic, lightly bitter.

Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

Very nice...a bit sweeter than sourheads will probably want, but there¬ís quite a bit of sourness to counteract that so it ends up just seeming "bigger" than it is.  It doesn¬ít really have the depth or pizzazz of 4+ examples, but it¬ís quite pleasant and doesn¬ít do anything wrong.

From the Bottle. Not much aroma but that¬ís made up for in the taste. Initial sweetness followed by a tart cherry sourness that lingers on the palate for quite some time, also some earthy notes present from the wood. Soft mouth feel and light carbonation.. Very good beer. I need to pick up some more bottles!

Pours dark reddish brown  with an off white head that slowly fades. Aroma is cherries, wood, and vinegar. Taste is sour cherry and some bread. Some drinks had more sweetness at first then it finishes sour. This is very good.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2012 Poured a deep brown, slight red hue, and a small tan head that quickly dissipated. Aroma of tart cherry, light vanilla, light Brett, but I¬ím not picking up the cocoa. Taste is tart cherry from the start and finishes very sour. Mouthfeel is moderately thin, which is surprising. If you like mouth-puckering sour, this beer is for you. Delicious.

Bottle. Reddish brown color. Caramel, oak and red fruit in the aroma. Sour flavor, overshadowing the also present sugary sweetness. Toffee, soft red fruit. Mouthpuckering lemon. Fairly short aftertaste.

A clear dark red/brown colored beer, with a beige head. The aroma has sour with wood notes. The taste is sour, wood notes and a little bitter. The aftertaste has a little sweet moving to sour with some notes of wood.

Appearance is a ruby hue with a white carb. Smell is of acidic fruit and wood. Taste is great. Super sour and dry, with the fruit melding well in the funk. Thick coating on the tongue that makes the flavor more pronounced, somehow. Really fruity and sour. Great beer.

A wonderfully drinkable lambic. Not so sour it feels like a gimmic. Sour enough, though, to share. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2012 Another great rotational offering at Angler¬ís in Lawrence.  Tart, funky, with everything you could ask for in a lambic.  Perhaps a bit on the mediciney sweet side which is why its not in the top tier for me.

Bottle @ VBPF¬í12.
Cuivre, fin blanche.
Ar√¥me fruit√©, aigre, l√©ger malt et caramel.
En bouche, aigreur persistante, note de toffee/caramel sur un fruit√© rouge aigre.Vraiment tr√®s agr√©able comme ce c√¥t√© malt√© caramel se m√©lange √† cette aigreur, le tout ayant une pointe de douceur vanill√©e.
With no Supplication in sight, I had no choice but to make the plunge with this one. Surprisingly good, sour beer, I miss GT when rating beers..

33cl, exclusive brew, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex sour brew, vinous/sour and slightly woody/fruity, balanced, clear, small head, very good brew, ¬íVery nice to see that Bockor makes this kind of beer!¬í

Bottle thanks to portableparty!  Dark clear mahogany pour, a little light lacing and very tart cherry aroma.  Flavor is also tart dark cherries, a little sugar, muddled raspberries and finished very dry and sour on the aftertaste.  Very nice.

Draft pours clear amber/mahogany, creamy beige head. Aroma of sour lemon/berry/unripe fruit, oak, wine, vanilla, cherry, lactic, Bretty funk. Taste is sweaty, heavily soured, earthy, fungal/basement. Light body, some nice sweetness to balance all the sour, sharp sour finish, dry.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2013 Re-rate. Draft at craft ale house. Pours hazy reddish with a huge off white head. The aroma has a lot of vinegar and cherry juice. The taste is lightly tart, sour cherry, abrupt finish but very nice. Very good sour.

11.2 oz bottle.  Deep, clear purple brown with a thin beige coating and bubbles on the edge.  Nose is red wine vinegar, sour cherry and horse blanket.  Juicy with a sour bite and a sparkle.  Taste is raspberry jam, cranberry and toffee with a touch of cigar in the finish.  Bright and fruity with spot-on carb and acidity.

Such an enjoyable sour ale. Amazing sweet/sour balance of flavor. Rich orange candied sour notes that seem to continue forever. Dark cherry notes with some vanilla  on the finish. Really good. Highly recommended.
Der saure Beginn wirkt leicht ges√º√üt, was aber nicht schlimm ist. Frisch, angenehme Kirschnoten, rund, sehrs√ºffig. 11/10/11/11/11/11
Bottle thanks to Mar. Puts light brown/red with off-white head. Aroma is very acidic and dusty. Flavor is acidic, rustic, cherry. Light mouthfeel with fizzy carbonation. Overall, excellent brew.
Very strong sour beer. Red in color with a thin, white head. This beer really makes your glands water!

Bottle at Gainsbar. Dark red/brown colour with little golden head. Aroma is predominately sour but with a touch of sweetness too. Lots of cereal, dark fruit, marzipan and lots of acidity. Taste is very sour, vinous, then mellows in mouth to sweeter yet still sour finish. Quite spiky, and plenty of sour fruitiness.

Dark, clear reddish-amber with a small ring of off-white head. Aroma of sour cherries, chocolate, sour apple, and vanilla. Taste is good and sour and a bit sweet and woody. Medium bodied and slightly syrupy. Very nice.
Wow, I was lucky to have this.  What a solid sour ale.  Great funky nose, must and oak.  Taste is green apple, cherry, subtle oak.  Amazing carbonation and mouthfeel.

Dark ruby, fluffy tan head. Smells of tart cherries and raspberries, sugar and sweet caramelized oak, apples, limes. Has a burst of tart and acidity, cherries and a multitude of berries with some lemon bringing out the citrus, evident sweetness and strong sourness. Strong up front sourness and acidity, with a nice sweetness all around like granulated sugar, reminds me of the feeling of eating a pear. Bit of a sipper with the sweetness and acidity.

From notes.  First reviewed 6/28/2011.  Served on tap in a tulip at Hopleaf.

This comes out with a dark brown addition to a cherry color, with just a little light able to sneak through. An off-white ring is all the head I get.

From the aroma, I can tell this one is going to be sour. Great tart cherry aroma, with a bit of raspberry, vanilla, and oak. The vinegar nature of the beer is already apparent.

The flavor is fully tart, there is no doubt about it. A robust dark orchard fruit blend is led by red cherry, with a good amount of vanilla and oak adding some depth to the flavor without getting in the way of the strong vinegar and tartness. After a few sips, my taste buds recover from the tartness a little bit, and sweet cherry and raspberry flavors are noticeable at the beginning of the sip. 

This is sour and acidic enough to keep me salivating from first sip until five minutes after I am finished with the glass. Still medium bodied, with lightly bubbly / lightly creamy medium carbonation. A tannic dryness finishes out each sip.

This really connected with what I was after at the moment. The combination of dark fruits and a fire hose blast of sour really rocked my palate.

11.2oz bottle. Rating #267. Clear brownish/amber/red pour with a thin white head. Fruity and a little musty, raspberries, grapes and cherries all combined and very sour. Sweet and tart at the same time, kinda like smartees, tart berries and a real nice clean finish. Real nice stuff. (2210)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Pours pretty brown with a tinge of red with nice white head with soapy bubbles on top. Aroma is basalmic vinegar and sour cherries. Not much funk in there. Taste is very sharp sour with a bit of clean funk in the finish. Taste is very much of sour cherries with a bit of lingering sweetness. Mouthfeel is fairly syrupy, but that is a bit expected. Absolutely great beer and preferred to the similar rodenbach grand cru.

Bottle. Pours clear brown red with a nice soapy foamy off white head that slowly fades to a tight foamy collar. Aroma is tart cherries and candied sour sugar and slight funk. Taste is puckering sour cherries and very acidic, some wild funk and lactic tastes as well. Palate is medium and solid carbonation with a acidic puckering dry finish. This is one awesome sour!

11.2 oz. bottle served in a tulip. Pours a very reddish brown with a finger of off white head. Bottle conditioned.  Sour cherries and vinegar in the aroma. Light bodied. Very tart and acidic, more tart cherries. Sour pucker in the finish. Little bit of oak. Very drinkable. Nice to see this in bottles.
Simply amazing from tap. Dark brown with a thin head. The nose is loaded with vegetal/balsamic notes. Medium bodied sour with plenty of tart berry an field greens. Long finish.

On tap at hot city pizza for beer week. Aroma is of sour cherry, makes my mouth water. Flavour is also dominated by sour cherries, some cocoa in the way background. This is very close to Russian river supplication, or perhaps visa versa.

33cl, on draft at Cafe Hollander. Pours a reddish brown color with an off white, almost pick, head. Aroma is oaky, fruity, tart cherry. Medium on the palate with average carbonation. Flavor is sour, more oak and tart cherry, with a light, sour finish. Very tasty.
#1256 draught; nose is barn yard, little hay, cranberry, gingerbread, red pepper, petrol, feel is mediumwatery, carb is medium, taste is cranberry, dry sauvignon blanc, later red pepper,

Draft. Really nice, tart, Flanders Red. Aroma of vanilla. Very sweet, very tart, with strong presence of cherries. Beautiful tartness on the palate. A great beer to pair with a hearty meal, or even as dessert. I?d prefer this one in fall or winter.
Bottle.  Pours dark brown with an off white head.  Aroma of wood, cherries.  Nice good sour flavor.  Really well done.

Bottle.  Deep red with a thin lasting off-white head.  Aroma is sour, of cherries, vanilla, citrus, wood.  Taste is sweet, quite sour.  Lots of cherry, very acidic.  Dry finish with a little more vanilla.  Refreshing.  Pretty light bodied, average carbonation, oily.  Really good sour.
A bit tart but very refreshing. Hints of cherry and vanilla. Smooth finish. Aroma is strong.

Very complex sour. The palate alone leads you on a journey through a sweet, tart, and sour progression. Loaded with tons of flavor, Bockor presents flavors of cherry, green apple, oak, vanilla, and plums. I love this beer. It¬ís great for sipping and very satisfying to all of your senses.

7/II/2012 33cl bottle from Brugs Bierfestival @ home - BB: 17/I/2014 (2012-107) 
Clear red to red brown beer, small yellowish head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: fruity, red berries, sour cherries, bretta touch, wood notes. MF: good carbon, light to medium body. Taste: fruity start, bit sweet sugary, strawberries, lemon juice, some tobacco, dry. Aftertaste: lemon juice, very sour but still some sweetness lingering, dry wood notes. Very pleasant easy drinkable beer. Too bad they don¬ít sell this in Belgium...

Pours dark dark red with a smell off white head. Aromas of cherries, slight vanilla, other dark fruits. Taste, sour apples and tart cherries with vanilla undertones, nice sour acidic finish, dry finish with mouth puckering that you can¬ít prevent. This is delicious.
Bottle pours dark red, clear with nice white head...good amount of carbonation. Aroma very nice, dark fruit, acidity and complex.  Taste full of dark fruit, mild sourness, very nice.

(Bottled) Clear dark brown with a small head. Mild aroma of wet wood and balsamico, too cold to find any nuances (it¬ís like 5 degrees C inside the festival hall). Flavor of cherries, leather, vinegar, dried fruit. Refreshing. Light to medium body, tart and acetic palate with low CO2. Quite enjoyable in small doses. 4284

Little off-white head, dark red-brown beer, clear. Lactic acid, buttermilk and citruspeel. Sour, lactic, wood, brown sugar. Lipsmacking sourness and acidburn, body thinned by the acids. As good as the old brown that I remember.  Because whatever the commercial hoompah says, this is NOT a new beer. It was one of my favourites 25 years ago, already!

Une massive pr√©sence acide en ar√¥me annonce ce qui nous attend, une massive pr√©sence acide en bouche. Quelque part au milieu de la gorg√©e, le jus de cerise bois√© s¬íexprime mais est aussit√¥t rabattu par l¬íacidit√©. Probablement la bi√®re la plus s√ªr que ma bouche ait rencontr√©. Ass√®chement brutal garanti.

Explosion of flavor on the entire palate. Complex sour flavor yet balanced and very drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle:  The aroma consists of moderate cherry, light funk, vanilla, lemon, and a touch of oak.  It pours a dark copper that is mostly transparent when held to the light.  It has a small off-white head that diminishes fairly quickly to a thin film outlined by a thicker ring.  The flavor starts with moderate tart cherry.  The finish turns sharply sour cherry along with some lemon, light vinegar, vanilla, and a touch of oak.  Lightly sweet cherry lingers on the tongue for a little bit.  As it warms, the sweetness becomes a little more prominent and mellows the sourness a touch.  It¬ís medium bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, a very nice Flemish Sour, but I wouldn¬ít put it in the elite class.

A very enjoyable beer. Very nice frothy head, beautiful deep brown and ruby colors. Oaky sharpness in the aroma, fruity and sourish. Lots of fruit-skin type flavors, makes your mouth pucker but has an excellent sweetness balance. Acetic but not overly so. Easy to drink.

Clear amber pour thin off white head ..... aroma of sour cherries, light oak, funk and vinegary/acidic ........ taste is of sour cherries, berries, vinegar/acidic, oaky and funky .... mouthfeel is sour and very dry  ...... finish is dry

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2012 On tap, pours a golden color with a slight head to it.  Smell is tart with almost a vinegar aroma.  Tart sour cherry that is delightfully balanced and does not leave you making a sour lemon face.  Great sour.
On tap at the common table.  Pours a deep Ruby red with a thin tan head.  The aromas are cherries, light vinegar.   The mouthfeel is zesty, vinegary and dry.  Nice beer!  Cheers!

11.2 ounce bottle, with an 01 stamped on the back label.  Served in a tulip, the beer pours a hazy reddish/brown color and has about a half inch light tan head.  Head retention and lacing are both decent enough.  The brew smells like tart cherries, oak, vinegar, and a bit of vanilla.  The taste is similar to the aroma, it tastes like tart and sweet cherries, vinegar, oak, dark fruit, and some sugar.  Even though the tart flavors are stronger, the sweet ones are still noticeable.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, it¬ís a bit creamy and is well carbonated.  I think it¬ís a good brew, I liked it.  $4.99 a bottle.
On tap at the Cheeky Monk.  Pours a reddish brown.  Strong cherry aroma.  Sweet and sour cherry, raspberry, apple, oak flavor.  Clean finish.

The best sour beer I¬íve had on draft in Texas so far.  Amber, not much head.  A good sourness with a wood aged flavor, full of tannin.  Nice to have some complexity with the sour as well as a lower alcohol content.

on draft which was a dark amber color. very nice sweet/sour aroma of fruit and vanilla, the first taste was like biting into a fresh lemon a sourness that turned into something wonderful. this is a very smooth beer with lots of complex flavors under the sour. a full pour next time i am there.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2014 On tap in a snifter.  Pours deep brown/ruby with a lacy head.  Aroma of sourness, some cherries and fruits, light malts and hops.  Flavor really sour.  Average texture.  A pretty good beer of this type.
Edit: 11.2oz bottle in a tulip.  Same color.  Aroma and flavor the same as before, but now I just like the style more.  A good dark sour.

Draft. Poured a cloudy brown color with a mostly lasting frothy light brown head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy sour tart cherry,  fruit and yeast aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sweet&sour dark fruit flavor with a medium to heavy sour dark fruit finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer for style.

Tap at the Repub.  From notes. Pour is a very slightly hazy red brown, with just a ring of head that fades almost instantly and leaves no lacing. Aroma is light lactic notes, a fair bit of nutty and woody character, a slight amount of raisin malt.  Taste is similar, with just enough tartness to let you know its there, as well as a nice biscuit and cracker finish that really works well. Could drink a lot of this.

Draught pours brownish red with very little head. Aromas are vinegar, sour fruit, and lemon. Taste is sour lemon, tart cherry and cereal on the back end. Medium body no carbonation. Overall a very delicious, classic Sour ale
Quite sour, fuzzy fizzing, deep brown translucent. Malty and sweet, dates, caramel. Arima of tree SAP and fall.

On tap at the Thirsty Monk in Asheville.  Pours dark ruby with a thin beige head. Nose of cherry skins, wood, vanilla, and acetic notes.  Taste adds more of a granny smith apple tartness.  Light palate.
Tap. Nice dark color big tan head. Nice sour smell with light sweetness.  Tart!  Yet still smooth.

On tap at Apex with mcberko, pours a clear deep orange / red with a tiny off-white head. Aroma of sour fruits, funk and some sweetness. Flavour of sour red fruits, citrus, light worcester sauce, light sweetness and light spice. Well-balanced, smooth for the style. Really nice.

On tap at Hasselt Beer Festival, Hasselt, Limburg, Belgium 12.11.11 in company of Loz, Jackie, Simon and David.   Pours a light chestnut colour with a small rim of bubbles. The aroma reminded me of the De Dolle Orbier Special Reserva, quite lovely nose. Fruity, tangy and with a great sourness in the mouth, some dark fruits, ossibly summer fruits such as bitter cherries, there is wet wood and the sourness rules supreme but it is a lovely sourness. Possibly my favourite of the day. .  A8 A4 T8 P4 Ov16  4.0

On tap at Apex in Portland, split with Matts_Property, pours a hazy reddish orange with a small tan head. Aroma of tart fruits, some citric fruits and slight sweetness. Flavour is quite sour, with beautifully tart fruits and a bit of worcestershire sauce. Well-blended sour flavours. Very nice.
Tap at the Bistro BA fest. Pours dark ruddy amber with a beige smear. Nice cinous/sour aroma. Med body. Fairly sour. Vinous. Rather acidic. Very nice.

Draft at Mekong. Thanks Graham. Pours a clear ruby color with a large tan creamy white head. Good head retention and lacing. Tart aroma with notes of caramel, cherries, stone fruits, earthy notes and a slight vinegar note. The taste is tart cherries, strawberries, stone fruits, earthy notes. Medium bodied and refreshing.

A - Pours a cloudy hazy copper-dark-red color with a finger of white head. The head fades fairly quickly leaving behind some lace.

S - Aroma is full of sour ant tart cherries. Touch of other fruit sweetness. Very sour and acidic.

T - Kicks off with some strong sour cherry tartness and sourness. Very sweet as well. Through the middle, the beer mellows a bit and some funkiness comes through. The finish is a mix of sour and tart cherries with some sweet darker fruits coming through.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a very sour and acidic mouthfeel.

D - Very drinkable. Nice complex and rich sourness and sweetness.
sour with some sweetness, but no fruit.  very close to a lambic. red color, low barbonation. from a keg. yeast finish.
Draught. Sour and fruity aroma. Cloudy dark red brown colour. The flavour is nicely sour and a bit fruity. Lactic finish. Rather dry.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2012 poured from draft and poured a nice dark red color with a small head.

excellent aromatics with some funk, sour apples, cherries and spices. Nice depth as well with a good tart quality too.

medium/full bodied with a nice acidic bite to it. Very good feel as well. This is a real quality sour and gives just the right amount of sourness.

On tap at Modeste Bier Festival. Didn¬ít have any expectations whatsoever, but what a surprise! Almost as good asz the Foederbier from rodenbach, and that¬ís a compliment. Tart, acidic, complex... you name it, it¬ís got it! Great!
Dried cherry flavour,rather sour. More enjoyable than a Rodenbach, not all that good, though.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2014 10/17/14: on tap at Local Cantina.  Big cherry, apple, vinegar tart. Nice.  
9/29/11: On tap at toronado on our n. california trip.  Muted funk and vinegar aroma.  Tastes are red wine, vanilla, yeast, berries- cherry.  Medium sour.  Very good stuff.  7.8

Draught at Toronado. Amber-orange with a thick, fine head. Aroma of yogurt, cherry, caramel, and a bit of vinegar. Very sour flavor, with huge lactic notes, some vinegar, caramel and cherry. Great sweet-and-sour balance. Creamy and lovely. The real thing, though it claims to be a lambic¬óI would guess it is a Flemish Red. Good sourness.
Pours a deep blood red with thin white head.  Taste is of extremely sour cherries.  High carbonation. Very enjoyable.

If you like cherry sour patch kids, this is for you.  Very cherry, very tart, very good.  Had this on tap - had a nice head - color was hard to really tell due to the darkness of the pub.  VERY sweet - a bit much for my normal drinking pleasure, but the sweetness was appropriate given how tart it is.  Overall, very good.
Tap.  Pours deep ruby red with a small tan head.  Lots of tart/sour cherries with a nice woody finish.  Finishes dry.  Nice.

8-oz draft at Rattle w Erica. Pours deep red/purple with small head and leaves a vapory lacing on the glass. Aroma is faint fruit but little tart; taste is a grapey/winey tart explosion with long legs, which I always enjoy with sours. Good.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2012 On tap @ the Common Table.
Deep red pour with a decent off-white head.  Lots of oak in the nose with cherry, cocoa, and vanilla - flavor is tart cherry with some funk and wood.  Really well done sour!

On tap at Cheeky Monk in Denver.  Deep dark copper with light haze, and a small tan head.  Aroma of earthy sourness, slight dairy funk, and cherries.  Taste started a little too sour but it clamed down in the middle.  Dry throughout.  Flavor tones of earthy malt characters, but it interrupts the tart cherry goodness, and it doesn¬ít come out sweet enough.  Sourness is almost lemony, or citric.  I wasnt a fan.

Dark brown color with a red hue. No one from TN should ever say hue but I done did it. Aroma is amazing, sour cherries, apples, vinegar, nutmeg. Flavor is very sour with cherries, apples, spices. Face pukering sour. Id do a keg stand with this seriously. Amazing. Why did I only get a 4oz pour.

It is so tart with a full berry sweetness and nice long funky linger.  Deep cherry red with little head from a growler (yeah!!!) Very bright sour noise.  It is almost teeth gratingly sour.  Fruit pits. Earth. Dry finish.  Really nice. Glad i have another half growler.

Dark ruby pour with eggy compact head. Nose is sour cherry. Medium body. Super sour cherry.  Slighly bitter finish.

Similar vein to  rodenbach or monks cafe.  Very tasty!

On draft at Issacs.  Red pour with a strong aroma  of cherry and acid.


Again cherries appear in the taste with a mild, vanilla, wood and bit tart finish. Real Good!

On draft (guest)

I knew I had to come back for this after the staff at Lizardville was raving when it went on tap during a previous visit a few days prior. I am glad I did - this ranks right up there with Rodenbach Grand Cru as an excellent example of a Flemish sour. Striking that fine line between sweet and bone dry one pour of this will highlight any evening.

Aroma and appearance - A mysterious blood red body sparkled like the last vestiges of light battling against the rise of the moon. A dusty white head looked like flecks of dirt on a pristine winter snowfall. The sour burst of cherries pulls no punches about the intent of this beer. Tart and vinegary it is almost as sour as a good lambic.

Flavor and palate - Tart vinegar and cherries bite at the tongue. Nipping the taste buds with a robust sour intensity rivaled by few other Flemish beers it is not meek. By the end of the glass every corner of the palate is crying out for mercy. I would love to see this resurface again as it deserves a revisit.

Appearance is razor clear reddish brown with tight bubbles, 1 finger head and good retention.  Aroma is cherries, sourness, wheat, and cider vinegar.  Taste is puckeringly sour with cherries and wheat on the aftertaste, also a hint of funk on the finish.  Body is medium with lower than average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, and dry finish.  Overall, this beer kicks ass.  I love sours and this is a really delicious example!

Draft at Imbibe Wine. Nose is light acidity, caramelized sugar, fruity berries, yeast, and merlot wineyness. Clear red-brown with a medium, heavily lacing off white head. Flavor is tart cherries, significant sour notes, and very light woody vanilla. Great stuff to happen onto on a random visit to a local shop!

Draft.  Enticingly tart, gently sweet and fruity aroma, lightly acetic and woody, with notes of cherry and red grape, some definite yeast funk is present here as well.  Deep, dark red in color, clear, with a lasting, fine head.  Flavor profile is fruity and features a strong degree of sourness throughout, tannic, dry, oaky and with a brief flash of sweetness, more yeast funkiness and farmy character appearing as well.  Somewhat winey finish.  "Warms" the mouth, with a sufficiently sharp, acidic bite, active on the palate, body is medium.  Incredibly flavorful and complex, also stunningly sour.  Wow.

On Tap at the Bullddog NE.
Poured a dark ruby almost brown with a tight thick tan-ish head.
aroma was light acidic fruity cherry, hints of wood.
Flavour was tart vinagary, cherry, medium to decent sourness. 
Very tasty and balanced sour.

On tap at Falling Rock Tap House, pours a dark ruby with a slight amber hue and a medium khaki head. Aroma of brett and cherries. Really sharp hanging sweetness of cherries wraps around the tongue and falling into brett. Full bodied and delicious!

Smells of acidity and nag champa. Flavor is bold sour and malt, like a Belgian hippie in my glass. Very clear with no head to speak of. Enjoyable but the acidity of this beer hurts my stomach after a glass. Painful bliss!

Tap. Murky ruby brown with a pure white head. Dark cherries, slight sweetness and light vinegar in the aroma.  Nice sourness, tart, vinegar, very sour fruitiness, acidic, and a lactic finish. Medium to lighter for the body with vibrant carbonation.  Very solid.
This poured a ruby red color with a biege head. Aroma was very sour, lots of funky and dust too. Flavor was dampened towel, light cheese and light tart fruits. Decent.

Tap at the Moth. Pours a very pretty ruby red color. Nice highlights and a foamy beige head. Very pretty! Aroma is definitely sour. Sharp tones of sour fruit and gently sweet flavors. Tingles over the palate big time. Flavor is very sour, so much so that it almost brings tears to my eyes. Dark fruit such as cherry and perhaps raspberry are tasted with some woody notes. Finish is sour that turns slightly sweet. It¬ís growin on me.
vinegar and some fruit with soda water carbonation and some band aid. tart with a mellow warming finish.

On tap. Deep dark red color, funky aroma with vinegar and cherry.  Wonderfully funky and sour with some sweetness.   Vinegar present, but horseblanket flavor was more predominant. Very well crafted. Super.

On draught at The Trappist.  Great crisp sour aroma. Beautiful ruby red, clear. Off white head lingers with adequate lacing. Sour with nice sweet malt coming through. Nice fruits as well.  Good carbonation - maybe a little much as it is spritzy, but it is a cuvee.  Dry finish is pleasing.

Poured blood red. Very little head, if any. Smells of sour cherries. I love sour beers that immediately pucker up your lips and this one doesn¬ít disappoint. Had to let it warm a little, but worth the wait.

On tap, rare treat to have this beer on draft in PA. Pours a cloudy dark red color with thin ring of off white lacing. Medium carbonation. Aromas of wheat, oak, sour cherries, lactic acid, caramel malt. Taste is ridiculous, and very puckery especially upfront. the sourness then fades to give an awesome malt profile with notes of walnuts or maybe chestnut. Further tasting notes of green grapes, cocoa powder, and some other tart fruits. Very drinkable and balanced sour ale.
Tap at the moth.  Deep amber/red with a cream head.  Nose is tart, acidic, wood, and tannic.  Excellent on the palate, flavor is very tart/sour, acidic, sharp, bitter, delicious.

Pours a nice burgandy brown colour, with lots of creamy beige head and lacing.  Aroma of wine, fruit in particular cherries. A nice cherry bitterness not over kill or too vinegary. Nice dry finish, I like this one!

Draft. $8.00 a glass at Pracna on Main. Served in a Snifter class. Dark brown reddish color with light tan head. Sweet cherry aroma with a slight sour twang to it. Some lemon as well. Light/medium mouthfeel. Sweet tart cherry flavor with a nice sour note to it. Not overly sour. Slight earthy ending. Dark fruit notes with a lingering tartness. Not bad.
Dark red, small off-white head. Huge apple/cherry tartness but not to the point of being off-putting.

Draft. Poured a dark red color with a small head. Aroma was entirely solid sour fruit. Very tart. I saw multiple people turn this one down. Flavor was sour fruit, with a few touches of oak. I¬ím no expert on sour ales, but this one was good.
Growler pour. Brownish color. Light head.  A very nice sour beer.  Actually one of the better ones I¬íve had in a while.  Refreshing smooth and tart.

Pours dark reddish black, like a black cherry, with off white head.  Aroma has notes of green apple slight raspberry and blackberry, cherry, touch of apple vinegar, and some sweet bread.  Taste is big acetic tart apple, raspberry, cherry, and blackberry sweet notes in the background with a touch of straw and biscuit, with a very dry finish.  Delicious and sour, though not overly complex and a touch thin.

I didn¬ít know of this beer before I saw it on the menu but I went for it and was really really pleased.  It has a great sourness which, while not jaw-numbing, resonates well.  The fruits are rich and dark, with blackberry and wild cherry, and they finish with a nice sweet note.  Great palate, both sour and tingly.  Very fine beer. (on tap at Rattle N Hum, NYC)

Draft, goblet, poured lovingly.  Just a bit of head that quickly recedes to a gentle lacing around the glass.  Aroma is slightly woodsy, malty, a touch of sherry.  Color is a rainbow of tawny amber at the edge of the glass, to garnet, to a deep core of ruby brown.  Palate is very balanced, medium mouthfeel, low to medium effervescence.  Flavor is a grainy malt with a very light hint of residual sweetness.  Sour character is present but not dominant and follows the malt closely towards a dry finish.  Quite simply one of my top favorites.

Draft at RnH during the Sours Gone Wild Event with Pat, Andrew, Dallas & Bobby. It was pretty great getting the opportunity to sample this in 5 different stages. But the Rouge was a head above the rest. Pours a deep ruby red body. Aroma is sour fruit. Mouthfeel is very tart but not overly sweet, with some notes of cherry coming through.

On tap at the map room. Pour is murky dark amber with a modest off white head into this tulip. This is a brew that I had to warm up to; letting it breath a bit really helped. Cranberry and cherry on the nose, with a bit of earthy quality, coupled with a modest hop profile. I feel like I keep getting hellertau hops from this brew, but I doubt that is the case. The brew is ultimately very fruity; cherry pits, cranberries, apple skins, while a vinegar and earthy base is present on the back end. Its not too sour, really, as far as I am concerned. This is just a terrific brew
At rattle n hum during beers gone wild.  Given out in installments... Young, 50/50, and old.  Old was tart and sour; eh.
Pours reddish with with a decent amount of lacing. Aroma is sour cherries, oak and vinegar. Very sour to start off with then is balanced out by fruits. Overall a great beer. I love this style.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2012 Pours dark ruby with two fingers of creamy tan head. Nose shows cherry skins, a mild sweetness balanced with a mildly acetic acidity. Some sweet spice. Nice cherry tartness with a mild perceptual sweetness. Acidity shows much more at the beginning, loses it with warmth. Nice tart palate

Draught at Milltown.  Pours a dark plum red with some small white lace.  Almost eveything looks nice in these little cantillon glasses.  Nose of vinegar, oak, cherry skins.   Extremely drinkable yet still sour, nice cherry fruit, slight vinegar finish.  A lovely flemish red.

Pours a ruby red that almost looks black in the right light. Looks like merlot. Nice cherry notes on the nose. The taste has a sourness that balances out the fruit. It¬ís a very delicate beer. It¬ís far from smarties in a glass. The sourness shocks the taste buds and then this subtle fruit taste washes down the back.

Pours dark red/brown with a thick white head. Aroma is of sour cherries, dirt, cloves, and a little bit of vinegar. Flavor is very acidic with notes of tart cherries, oak and caramel. Still not my favorite style, but not bad.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2017 (23.04.2011) 1980 Vintage [email¬†protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */: +/- 30 year old, the taste has become a bit thin and weak, slight chlorine taste has started creeping in, slightly sour with touch of vinegar and red berries & dusty cherries, very slightly acidic, thin body, pretty much no carbonisation /// (24.04.2017) tried a fresh bottle, should take proper notes, its a pretty good sour kriek brew.

Draft at The Map Room in Chicago. Wonderful surprise. Deepest ruby-red pour, thin off white head on still body. Nose is rich fruit, cherry, cranberry but also apples. Effervescent, tart sip - really full and tasty fruit body. Red and tart. Much fruitier than most ¬íreds¬í of the style. A step up into the sour world. Very very tasty.

On draft at Falling Rock.  Pours dark red-amber with a white head.  Nose is funk, vinegar, sour cherries, slight yeast, and some sour fruit (red grapes, maybe?).  Flavor is similar with a hint of dark sour fruity sweetness before vinegar and tart take over.  Medium-bodied and an enjoyable beer.

draft at falling rock.  Pours muddy red brown with small gray head.  Aroma is sour funk, with some cherries and cheese noticeable.  Smooth and medium bodied with a tart, slightly puckering finish.  Flavor of old cheese, sour cherry, raspberry, hay, malts.  Very nice.

What a wonderful and surprisingly delight to see when I visited Angler¬ís in Lawrence.  Draft pour into a 12oz goblet.  Color is thick and dark-pit cherry.  Some sediment in there, this was near the bottom of the keg.  Low clarity and a medium head.  Aroma is tangy and sour cherry pit juice.  Its light an not heavy on the acetic or the lactic qualities.  The flavor follows suit, absolute joy to drink.  Light and refreshing, yet definitely sour.  Right to style and perfect for a beautiful spring day.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: draft at Blue Monk, maroon amber pour, aroma of red wine vinegar, sour cherries, cherry ludens, taste has a very sharpe acidic flavor, mouth puckering that hits you right in the jaw joints. lighter mouthfeel. very nice sour
This is a very bold, sour and puckering beer. Poured a deep red with a fruity smell to it. Very interesting.

Good sour cherry/apple aroma with hint of yeast. Good balanced sour that is easy to drink and still has elements of a non-sour beer (slight hop/citrus).
12oz snifter.
Pours a combo of rusty red and brown. Aroma of sour cherries, vinegar and barnyard...some serious funk.The beer is certainly sour on he palate and a little in the dry side

This beer pours a dark amber with a nice white head that has great retention and very nice lacing.

The aroma is very nice and tart with notes of vinegar.

The taste is great, very tart throughout with a nice smooth finish.

Mouthfeel is good and this is very drinkable despite its tartness.
Probably the best Flemish red out there, Tart, with a nice sourness, but just super drinkable.

The Fulton Grand, Brooklyn tap ($7 ($5 happy hour hehe)): Pours a reddish color with a white head. Aroma is of sour cherries, yeast, some winy notes, and a few other ambiguous fruit flavors. Pretty sour. Definitely more sour than Duchesse, which I had previously on the same day. Rather tart, but that could have been surmised. Cherry throughout. There is also a sweetness throughout. Rather well-balanced and doesn¬ít try to overpower the drinker with sourness.

Reviewed from notes. On tap at Pizzeria Paradiso - Georgetown.

Pours a nice cherry red with a bit of brown as well. Nose brings forward a good deal of sourness as well as some cherries and oak. A bit of an acetic character. The taste is vinegar, cherry, oak, and a bit of sweetness. Great, creamy mouthfeel. Drinks quite well, although the acetic character gets to be a bit much after awhile.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-20-2010
Potent sour beer. Not for the faint of heart is the balance between the sourness and the malt. You won¬ít soon forget drinking this beer.

(draught) pours a clear golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of citrus fruits, peaches and leather, cherries, bread dough and brown sugar, nicely balanceed. flavour is mostly the same, cherries and lemons with lots of grain and a light sour touch, a little tame. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Tap @ Stumbling Monk. Hazy amber pour with a short white head leaving minimal, coarse lace. Sour nose with a hint of funk (that never really materialises). Very sour up front: lemon juice and sour cherries. Some apricot and peach sweetness enters in the middle and matches the tartness, especially as it warms. Finish is medium length and tastes like a Sweet Tart. Medium body and carbonation, you‚Äôll have to search hard to find any hoppiness. I like it, but one glass is enough.
On tap at Rattle ¬íN¬í Hum.  A very good sour, dark body with no head.  Simplistic,simply very sour cherry .  Medium mouthfeel.  Some lace dots.  I cannot pass up this style.
A deep, dark fruit taste. It¬ís sweet, and puckery sour. It¬ís a "flanders red ale", a dark brown draft. This is one sour punch in the mouth that you¬íll gladly ask for seconds. Very good beer.

Tasted on tap at the Celebrator Anniversary Party on 2/20/2011. This sour ale pours a medium reddish brown from the tap. Medium sized beige/off white foamy head. The aroma is malty, musty, fruity, sweet and cherry. A medium bodied sour. The malts are fruity and sweet, tart and slightly funky. Nice cheery flavors. The hops are herbal. Nice carbonation. The sweet cheery flavors are balanced by the wood, funk and tartness. A very drinkable sour. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is tart.
Poured bright red, tart cherries, bready malty, little wood, slight vinegar, clean dry finish.

Tap. Deep black cherry colored pour and crystal clear. Thin white head. Huge nose of sour cherries and vinegar. Monster on the tongue - sharp as a Sour Patch Kid candy. Very sweet. Mostly cherries. Really good.

Draft at Capone¬ís. Looks like cough syrup, red/burgundy body with a foamy pink head, sorry but I just can¬ít rate a pink/red beer high in appearance even if it¬ís loaded with fruit. Aroma of cherries, sourness, graham crackers....basically a sour cherry pie. Flavor of sour cherries, grahamn crackers, and medicine. Medium bodied with average carbonation and a lingering aftertaste. This is one really nice fruity sour beer.

Deep ruddy garnet pour.  The nose is softly tart with a touch of cherry fruitiness on the back and a soft sweetness through the middle.  A whole lot fruitier than I recall the Ommegang version being with significantly less tartness as well.  A little bit of sugary flavour as well as the younger, less complex tartness.  It seems to lack the real funked out intensity of the original Ommegang version - a little rushed to market perhaps?

Old note, @ Tylers Apex. Good aroma, tart, sour, fruity, cherry raspberry type fruits, sour, but not funky. Clean reddish brown color¬í little to no head, no lace. Sour flavor. Lite body, smooth watery mouthfeel, tart sweet finish. Tasty, nice sweet moments mixed in with sourness. Glad I bumped into this.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: poured on tap at the publick house in brookline, ma. deep red color. heavily sour, somewhat malty, notes of wine, berries, medium body

Sample at Big Beers 2011in Vail. Red chestnut with very slight haze. Moderate carbonation with thin off white head. Aroma is sour, like lemonheads candy. Nose also has some salted meat - which doesn¬ít carry through to flavor. Flavor is of sour apple with sour cherry in the finish. The sourness is nicely tempered by malty sweetness - lending a very nice complexity, particularly in the finish.. Light mouthfeel - probably accentuated by the accidity. Overall, a very nice sour beer. Seems to be more complex than most and feature much less wood than U.S. versions.

4oz sample @ Rattle N Hum, New York

Sour, sweet kriek. Easy to drink, well balanced, Not too sweet or too sour. Dark red, no head.

Draft@ 4th ave pub. Dark brown color with no head or carbonation. Smells of tart fruit, sour cherries and apples. Taste is sour and fruity with a nice balance. This is awesome. Rivals rodenbach anyday.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2011 On tap @ Maple Tree. Ruby colored with a small head.  Very favor full,  sour apples and cherries but just a little too intense sour, acidic finish.  This is a sipper and could barely finish it.  If sour was toned down a bit this would be a staple in my fridge.  

edit:  Had this a second time and thught it was great again but not too sour.  Not sure if it was my mood or a changing palate. Recommended
deep red color, very green apple, moderately sour, well balanced. Decent sour beer.
Date: 9/6/2010   Source:Mekong   Clear amber brown with little head. Caramel malt aroma with light spicy funk and hint of sourness. Flavor follows aroma. Quite dry with a lightly sour finish.

On draught. Terrific. Classic. Sour acetic notes along with well-balanced slightly sweet malt and well-cloaked alcohol make for a fantastic, memorable sour red experience.  See also Rodenbach and Duchesse.

[Tap] Pours a ruby red color with a small amount of head. Sweet fruity aroma includes cherry and berries. The taste is of tart cherries, funk, and sweet malts. Lingering tart and slightly lactic finish. Good balance and fine bubbles of carbonation. Nicely done.
Sourness is mild but pleasant and gets better as you drink. Nicely balanced with sweet malts and caramel flavors. Excellent dark sour

Tap @ Rattle N Hum.
Brown/amber and clear with a bit of head. Aroma is not very strong, bit of sour fruit note, apple and cherry. Sourness is somewhat harsh on the palate, with a touch of sweetness to balance it out. Solid with a nice sour finish. Tried this next to the Rodenbach Grand Cru, and have to say that I preferred the Rodenbach because the Bockor had a somewhat mild aroma and was a bit more harsh.

Pours a Dark red with a thick beige head.

Nose is of a solid sour fruit with tones of oak and vanilla.

A malty balance surrounds the sour cherry center of this medium bodied brew. A slight sweetness helps create a magnificent balance. It creates a dry and acidic finish with is just wonderful.

 One of my favorite sour ales. just well done without having to go completely over the top. A lesson in balance.

Draft served in a tulip at 33 Wine Bar in St. Louis.  Pours a clear red, with just a little bit of a dull brick red color to it and an inch-thick beige head that leaves in about a minute.  Aroma of tart cherries, a lot of sweet and tart grapes, metal, sour funk, and red apple skins.  Flavor of sweet and tart red and white grapes, sweet cherries, sour funk, oak, and a light mineral note.  Light-medium bodied, with initially crisp carbonation that mellows quickly and a tart, fruity mouthfeel.  Nice sour, but the metallic note is holding it back from being even better.
Tasted on tap at Falling Rock in Denver, Colorado. Deep red-brown appearance.  Sour, a bit fruity aroma.  Somewhat sour but very tasty and very nice full flavor.

On tap at Hop Leaf, Chicago (second visit). Dark ruby red, juicy vinegary aroma of sour cherries. Wonderful sour cherry flavour, lightly funky, crisp and tart with woody nuances. JJ¬ís remarks: " I¬ím not gonna lie to you. I don¬ít know what the fuck this is because I¬íve been drunk since we had that imperial stout at 3pm. "
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: On tap at City Tap House.  Pours an amber brown color with an off-white foam head.  Has an aroma of vinegar.  Sweet and tart with a clean finish.  Thin to medium mouthfeel.
Pours amber with small head.  Aroma is cherry and grass.  Taste is tart cherry with a sour sweet finish.

The awesome aroma of wild yeast and sour berries with a bit of resiny. Sweet malts. The ruby amber brown color with almost no head is the usual for a sour. The flavor is similar to the Rodenbach grand cru with sour cherries and a sharp but palatable tart to finish.

On tap at Mekong for the Flemish Sour Ale Throw Down on 09/09/2010. Vintage 2008. Clear reddish brown body with a small off-white head. Tart fruit and funk aroma with light cherry. Sweet cherry, tart and light balsamic vineagar flavor. Medium body with moderately high carbonation. 7/3/8/4/16 - 3.8

On tap at Mekong for the Flemish Sour Ale Throw Down on 09/09/2010. Vintage 2009. Clear reddish brown body with a small creamy off-white head. Sweet fruit, light cherry with a moderate tart and acidic aroma. Tart flavor with ltos of fruit and cherry. Medium body with moderately high carbonation. 8/4/8/4/16 - 4.0
From the tap poured a dark brown color with a fair amount of head.  Nice tart flavor with a lingering finish.
Bottle of 1980. Light sour whiskey smell. Taste lightly sour with a whiskey and apple touch. Very good beer considering the age although it is more like a liquor at this age.

30 years old bottle. Not 100% sure if it is this one, cause the bottle I tasted at 10 sept 2010 was a bottle from 1980. A 30 year old bottle at Kulminator. There is no ABV at the bottle, very little information is given. That it is from "bockor"... So a 30 year old bottle had to be something less or more special... Orange amber coloured. About no carbonation. But that¬ís normal at this age. Just a very; very, very small head. Sour fruity smell, some caramel and alcohol comes up. Taste is the same as the smell. More liquor then beer ofcourse due the age. The feeling cause of the lack of carbonation is also about a liquor. Alcohol, sourness (but not to overwhelming at all). Had to think about the 30 years so rated a bit higher maybe. Sour-sweet mostly sour, but ok, specially for the age.

On tap at 4th Ave Pub. Pours a deep amber/mahogany with a light head. Aroma is all dark fruit and funk, not letting on to the sour bite. Tastes of lots of dark fruit--mostly cherry, a bit of plum and raspberry--with some wood notes. Very tart, but well balanced. The mouthfeel was fairly thick for a sour ale, but well carbonated and easy to drink. Overall, really delicious and a crisp and refreshing beer for a hot summer day.

Last beer of the FS 10th party! .. Pours a deep maroon purple .. light but sticky head, light lacing .. smell of tart sugar, cherry skins, plums, and other dark dirty delicious things .. . its like sitting on a cloud, on top of two clouds .. . good tartness level, but still well balanced .. i don¬ít want your repo thugs coming after me! you can take your tooth back!!

On tap at Toronado - asked the bartender about the beer and he said he personally thought it compared to RR Consecration... Big enough reccomendation for me to try it right there. Very dark red color and little head. Quite tart but not a pucker face sour level for me. Nice, but not too strong a hint of cherries. Nice smooth mouthfeel, and by the time I got to the bottom of the small glass, I really had grown a large liking for this sour. A very nice "hidden gem" for me.
Tap at Ebenezer¬ís.  Pours deep, red-tinged mahogany into a tulip. Off-white head quickly recedes to hug rim. Dark cherry aromas. Spritzy tart cherry upfront with a lasting sour finish.  Nice.

Garnet pour with a half finger beige head. The aroma is cherry dark fruit, lots of woody acetic notes, and funk. The flavor holds tons of acetic acid with a huge sour overripe dark fruit character. The palate is thick and viscous for the style with supple carbonation and a dry finish.
Pours brown with a red hue off white head. aroma of dark sour cherries.  Taste incredibly sour as well with cherry predominating once more and lots of sour funk. Love it
UPDATED: AUG 23, 2010 Great sour and fruit (cherry) aroma.  Dark red. Ballet on your tongue!  Sour  and fruit in flavor with lasting finish.
On tap at Toronado SF. Clear red pour with a thin beige head. Aroma of tart cherry and malt. Nice crisp sour flavor with some fruit and a sweet malty and tart finish.

Murky mahogany in need of a good polish and dull garnet lurk underneath a fluffy head of tan puff while lace wanders hither and fro. Lifting the taster to my nose reveals a cornucopia of red apple skins, kiwi, apricot, granny smith tartness, red and black plums, green grapes, and black cherries; hold the syrup please. Phew! Tart and sweet, backing her up is a solid cast of melba, bread crust, and burnt sugars, especially of the brown variety. Her tart character nips at the back of my nose with each snuff, and I have to fight to remain seated. I am a sucker for sour, after all. Smitten, I willingly go in for the kill. She is gentle at first, a lure to bring me in further where she hits me head-on with a rich middle and silken finish of cream, vanilla, and frothed milk. Her finish leads me right into the next quaff where I revel in plum, green, and red grape skins, delightfully bitterly acidic and tart. Green apples, granny smith especially, round out her middle before surrendering me once more to her silky finish. As my tongue squeals in tart delights, black and red cherries with pits crunch between my teeth. Her malt backbone is a silent partner which is just fine with me. Instead, I revel in an increasingly acidic presence tempered only by her creamy vanilla finish. Exquisite. I could sup her all day long. After my hefty 10 Commandments from Lost Abbey, she was a wonderfully timed refreshing treat.


Revisiting the classics is all well and good, but sometimes nothing can beat that virgin taste adventure where one is totally caught by surprise in the most delightfully invigorating ways possible. If you have a sour tooth like me, or think you might, grab a bottle (or draft) of the Cuvee de Jacobins Rouge from Bockor Brewery and let the affair begin.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2012 Only a slightly sour nose. Deep amber, runny, and not much head. Very
tart flavor and so dry it leaves you thirsting for water. Causes severve chest congestion or allergic reaction for me.

Draft at Map Room. Poured a clear garnet color with an off white head. Smelled of clove, cherry, and a splash of red wine vinegar. Light to medium bodied and decidedly acidic with sour cherry, oak, and red wine vinegar flavors. Tart and dry.

Clear deep reddish amber with a medium beige head. Sour aroma with plenty of lacto, red berries and wood. Flavour was sour with lacto, sour berries, roasted malt, caramel and oak. Finished sour and dry.

Stone Sourfest. Deep, clear amber with thin ring of white head. Nose is acetic tartness and fruits. Flavor is sour fruit tartness, great depth and levels of sour tartness lasts throughout the taste. Medium body with lively carbonation accents the acetic tartness, great prototype of the style!

On tap at Bluebird Tavern outside Burlington. Absolutely gorgeous garnet colored pour with a small white head. Nose holds lots of fruity funk, cherry, plum, and tart raspberry-- fantastic aroma. Flavor is also phenomenal- big fruit presence, with characteristics of cherry, raisin, strawberry, raspberry, and plum. This intermingles with the beautiful tart and sour complexion, creating an awesome depth to the beer. The mouthfeel is highly effervescent, and tart fruit isn¬ít overdone, making this incredibly crisp and refreshing. I love this beer.

This is a very fine sour ale which pours a crystal clear amber color w/ a neat white head that¬íd make you think you were getting a boring old amber ale from the looks of things. Spending a second w/ the nose on this thing though will avow you of this notion. It has a deep tart cherry character which is very lovely and it gets even better once you taste it. The palate has a decent weight to it but the beer is quite sour w/ vigorous carbonation so it drinks quite easily. I am impressed by this beer. It strikes me as somewhat refreshing and something that you could drink in moderate quantity but you could also linger over it for some time if you so choose.

Tap @ Victory...  Poured deep, burgundy with a white head.  Some noticeable funk, but still very clean.  Hints of berries, cherries, candied sugars, bubblegum, grains, and a yeast sourness in the finish.
UPDATED: JAN 21, 2015 Rather tart but some nice sweetness to balance.  Wine like qualities. Serving: Draft

quality stuff here with some really nice complexity. notes of curry, balsamic/malt vinegar, mineral notes with some iron-like character, coriander. very little true "malt" character, more sort of raw and doughy mid-palate. even lower on the hops. really nice brett presence -- tart cherries that fade to more of an almost strawberry taste, and the typical "barnyard" ntes come off to me as, well, dry cloth, but in a much more appealing way than that sounds. complex, delicious, layered, and very refreshing. a perfect accompaniment to banh canh do bien, as it turns out.

Bottle, via Maxxdaddy I think @ RBWG 2010.  Pours a clear reddish body with a small fizzy white head.  Nice sour nose with lots of cherry skins, a little acetic with a touch of oak.  The flavor is dry and tart with a more noticeable oak note.  A little brighter than the Ommegang Rouge.  Mouthfeel is crazy drying with a heavy raw oak tannic finish.  Nice, but not as good as the Ommegang Rouge.

On draft at Capital Alehouse Innsbrook.  Pours a clear brown with fair khaki head ring and some lacing.  Nose is like an old, stale cherry poptart.  Flavor is very sweet, almost like a pixie stick, but has a mildly acidic, solid sour tone that gives a nice balance.  Dark fruitiness, sweet and dry on the palate. Decent enamel remover.  Not the best sour, but not the worst either.  The high price is a shame though....

Like a slightly toned down/less acidic Rodenbach Grand Cru. Normally, that would be a bad thing, but it went down great on draft at the Map Room, Chicago. I¬íd like to try this again while less "hop enhanced", as I remember it being delicious, but the above is all I had jotted down as notes.

1990 bottle @ kulminator 
head: tiny 
colour: dark amber, caramel 
smell: salty/sour, caramel, malts, water 
taste: sweet/sour start, vintage , licqourice , fruity sweet finish
Draft at CAH.  Pours ruby with earthy, fruity tart nose.  Tastes of sour fruit, cherry, malt, berry, with an earthy palate and a smooth finish.

Draft @ Brouwer¬ís Sour Fest; dense brown with trace white head; zesty cherries with a strong, warming sourness; mild vinegar with yummy sour cherries, barnyard funk and mild poopy cheese; so much more texture and zesty sourness here compared to the other sours sampled; lovely strong tartness with creamy texture; great stuffEarlier Rating: 4/15/2010 Total Score: 4.2Draft @ Bottleworks; clear light brown prickly nose and nice acidic sourness; light tam head lasting ; mild grape skins, brown sugar; not too heavy, a little oaky sweetness too; good stuff; some berry creaminess; yummy; dry, cookie finish; raspberries too; a damn good sour

Draft. Pours reddish amber with an off white head. Funky bretty aroma with some light rhubarb like sweetness. The flavor has an excellent balance of funky tart bretty notes and cherry/rhubarb-esque fruity sweetness, followed by a nice dry and tart finish. Very good.

On tap at Stone Bistro. Pours a very nice and deep red color with some copper highlights and topped by a small off white colored head of foam. The aroma shows notes of soured black cherries, old wood, acidic, and some caramel malts that adds sweetness. The flavor follows with a good amount of acidic fruit to go with the sour cherries and pits, oak tannins, and some vinous grape character also. Good balance of sour and tart fruits in this one. Medium bodied and easy to drink wih ample carbonation leading to a sour cherry finish. This is very similar to Ommegang Rouge. Nice Flanders red style brew.

The beer pours a dark reddish-amber with a tan colored head. The aroma is very wine like with some tart grapes and cherries as well as some woody notes. The flavor is very dry with lots of medium tart cherries and grapes. There is also some tannic oak notes. This is a very wine like beer that is very easy to drink.

Where: On pump @ 4:20 @ RB ESG
Appearence: Pochissima schiuma, ma da un colore oro brillante molto attraente.
Aroma: Buona Intensit√†. Mettendo il naso nel bicchiere con gli occhi chiusi sembra di entrare in una stalla con tanta fieno bagnato, in secondo luogo un intenso profumo di fiori di campo ed erba bagnato; fruttato molto leggero.
Taste: Buon equilibrio iniziale tra dolce ed acido..resta una lieve acidit√† nel finale..Persistenza Moderata
Palate:  Corpo medio e bassissima carbonazione il finale √® astringente
Overall: Buon lambic..Abbastanza equilibrato... non intenso ma tanto sporco da essere abbastanza pulito come lambic :)

On tap. Pours deep merlot with a brown hue and a lasting brown head. Aroma has tart grapes with an underlying wine note. Flavor begins with tart grapes and a hint of alcohol with a slight hint of wine on the back of the tonugue.

(Draught) clear deep amber with lasting creamy offwhite head. Nose of sour cherry, light wood, honey, and other fruits. Taste of mildly tart cherry and other tart fruits. Sola-like carbonation that finishes quite creamy. A nice flanders red.
Tap @ Boston/NY 2009. Clear brownish color, short head. Aroma of cherry, raspberry, oak wood. Tart taste, oaky. Why did I have to travel all the way to the US to get this? :-)

Draft. Dark ruby beer with a dark cream colored head. Tart/sour aroma. Sour/tart flavor with acetic notes, red fruit, and light oak. Medium bodied. Tart, sour flavors linger with acetic notes and fruit.

Toronado.  A good to very good Flanders Red, which is always a treat.  I tried this beer against Rodenbach Grand Cru, and, though it wasn¬ít quite up to that world class beer, it still had a quite good showing.  Cuvee des Jacobins Rouge looks about the same as any Flanders Red, perhaps leaning toward red rather than mahogany.  Small white head.  This beer smells and tastes of raspberries, cherries, oak and sour.  It¬ís actually not too far from the Rodenbach beers - perhaps three quarters of the step between normal Rodenbach and the Grand Cru, though without that beer¬ís lovely feel.  The beer was a bit more acidic than the Grand Cru, and it was fruitier and sourer to the GC¬ís woodier, more refined nature; still quite good.  This was a satisfying Flanders red and a very good beer.

On tap at The Ginger Man. Pours a dark ruby with a small creamy off white head that leaves good sticky lacing. The aroma is a sweet fruit with cherry and yeast. Thin mouthfeel with a sour fruit with a nice dry finish. Easy to drink, a very good sour ale.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2011 Tap at Palm Tavern.  Pours to a red body with a decent off-white head.  The aroma is sour with a very nice cherry and big toasted malt on the back end.  Acidic flavor of cherries and malt and big palate that has a growing sweetness on the finish.

Pours a brilliant red, copper, brown color with an off white head. The aroma is very complex with lots of tart berries, leather and old, wet blanket funk. The flavor is a real sour shot to the palate with mouthwatering sour berries, and a rich caramel cherry backbone. Not real funky, just pure sour ecstacy.

Draft at Hopleaf. Deep dark and brooding. The aroma has definite aspects of vinegar. Textbook Flanders, this drinks with a velvatine sourness -- glistening with a kiss of cherry, this is a delicious night cap. (#3907, 5/8/2010)

On tap at Flatbread, Burlington.
Aroma : Big cherries. Tart. Lots of cherries.

Taste : Cherries and tart. Hints of oak and a bit sour.

Overall : Pretty straight forward but quite good. Nice cherry profile and nice tartness. Not as good as the Cascade Kriek to me.

A: The pour is a muddy mahogany color with plenty of red highlights to it. There¬ís not much in the way of head, however.

S: The nose is very typical for a Flanders red ale. While there¬ís certainly a strong vinegar component, it¬ís not overwhelming. There are also plenty of sour cherries and some oak.

T: The flavor is quite acidic, but well balanced between the lactic and acetic acids. The sour cherries are prominent and juicy, along with a touch of oak which dries the beer out a bit.

M: The carbonation is moderate, but the beer still has a slightly slick feel on the tongue. The finish is dry and crisp.

D: One of the better examples of a Flanders red ale that I¬íve had lately. Very nice acidity and fruit flavors. I look forward to having this one again.

On tap at Stone.  Dark copper brown with cream colored head.  Nose gives only a hint of what¬ís to happen in the mouth.  Big burst of deep pungent sour followed by yeast smack.  Not the high dry sour.  Deep and in the back.  Full mouthfeel.  Lout of salivation but never the dry finish.  Long lingering mouthfeel and afters.  Nice one.

mobile rating. acedic balsamic vinegar and sharp oak. husky grains, light roasted wood, light toasted grains. fried onions and vinegarette and what else? hmm. highly acetic; texture is light; body is somewhat thin. Earlier Rating: 11/7/2009 Total Score: 4draft at falling rock.  unfiltered dark burgundy with a black cherry tinged small head.  vibrant but soft nose of creamed tart cherry skins, medium wood presence, good, pure pedio.  tangy, zesty, rich but not full on the palate.  ripe black cherries, tart, sour and mildly acidic (lactic) dark fruit.  sugar content is good, acid content well played.  body is silky, smooth and light.  wonderful stuff.
Draft @ Max¬ís. Dark red pour with some slight tan head. Some cherry and raspberry notes, acetic acid, along with woody notes. Both sweet and sour notes, decent sour.
Dark reddish brown with a fizzy white head. Sour vinegar aroma. Tart sour fruit and lemon taste with an acidic finish.
On tap at Collins. Pours deep red brown with a minimal head. Vinegar and red fruits in the aroma. Impressively balanced sour with red fruits, some fresh apple, dusty, a bit of biscuit. Lively palate.

On tap at Stone Bistro.  Pours a dark cloudy brown/amber, thin white head.  Sour apples, berries, vinegar, and oak.  Good sour, not among the best, but still very decent.  Wasn¬ít sure what this was when I ordered it, but glad I did.

on tap at The Cheeky Monk in Denver, CO on 4/7/10... dark red pour with a big 3 finger off white head... sour apple / acidic nose with a touch of yeast... big round sour body with a sweet front and a smooth tartness... sour apple finish... excellent sour!
Sampled at the Rose and Crown in Palo Alto. Poured into a tulip glass. Pours dark redish brown. Really a strong sour bite to it. Flavor is very good and well made. Malts are wonderful. Great brew.

Sampled at RBWG 2010.  A nice amber pour. The aroma is sweet and sour cherries with a nice malt backing.  The flavor is super sour with cherries, sweet tarts, malt, and a nice softness. This really reminds me of sweet tarts.

Draught at The Trappist.   My girlfriend is a flanders red fan, and she went back for seconds of this.   One of the best Belgian sour ales that I have had, with great overall chracter, but the dryness-to-sour balance that American brewers like RR and Lost Abbey are going for these days.   Rodebach should take note.   Dark red in color with a beige head.   Fantastic aroma of vanilla, oak, cherry and sour fruit.   The flavor is pretty sour for a Belgian Flanders red, but has a nice malt balance nonetheless, and a slight cherry sweetness rounding it out.   Medium-light body with a dry, acidic finish.   I could just smell this for days.   I had no idea what to expect when ordering this, but I¬ím definitely a fan.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2012 Bottle¬Ö RBWG ¬ë10¬Ö This beer rocks!... Mostly clear, light brown ale with a small, fat-bubbled, off-white head. Earthy, woody, funky nose with black cherry and barnyard notes. Medium-bodied with moderate carbonation. Fruity and fairly sour. Finishes tart, lightly sweet, then dry. Like Ommegang¬ís version, I could drink this brew all day, every day. World class Flanders Red!

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2014 This was the wife¬ís beer at Cap Alehouse Innsbrook, post Monument Avenue 10k, on tap.  Deep amber, slight head.  Nose of pleasant sweet malts and sour cherries.  Flavors matched - sweet, cherry accented malts moving into a nice, lactic sour finish.  Very well balanced.  Pleasant on the palate.  Maybe even a very faint hint of oak, although I don¬ít even know if this ever saw a barrel.  This is a superb Flemish Sour.  RERATE:  August 31, 2014, about 4 and half years after the initial rating.  Also on draft, from De Fles Winkel growler fill.  I would now describe the sour finish as a vinegar acetic sour finish, but otherwise, notes are the same.  Still really nice stuff.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2010 
Name: Cuvee des Jacobins
Date: March 12, 2010
Mode: Growler
Source: Tasting
Appearance: clear amber, fine beige head, drippy lace
Aroma: tart caramel aroma, fruity tartness, light mustyness
Flavor: sweet and tart fruity flavor, touch of musty funk, light bitterness
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.2/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: **+ /4

In short: An tasty Flemish-sour ale low on oak/tannins with an acidic touch.  Very good beer.
How: Tap at Sunset Grill, Boston
The look: Clear ruby body topped by a small off-white head
In long: Nose of sour cherries and other Flemish sour.  Taste is most classic Flemish Sour except with less oak-tannic than with a classic like Rodenbach Grand Cru and a little more acidic.  A little sweet.  I didn¬ít take that much notes except that I noted that this tasted rather similar to Ommegang Rouge Grand Cru that I had not so long ago.  Not that I¬ím entering my rating I realize that Ommegang Rouge Grand Cru is also brewed at Bockor!  And both beer are not bottled, tap only!  Strange coincidences.  Could it be the same beer?  I don¬ít want to jump to conclusions.  I¬ím just connecting the dots here.  And when I¬ím done I may have a drawing of a giraffe, or maybe a bear with a jar of honey.  Too early to tell.

Tasted on draft at Quenchers. Pours very dark amber with a thin white head. Nose of brett, vinegar, red apple, citrus, and some cereal. Flavors of red wine vinegar, sour raspberry, red apple, and quince. Carbonation is very lively with a lighter body and a medium finish. This is a great example of what a sour beer should be. It isn¬ít the best, but a prototypical example.

Bottle opened on the bus ride from Dunedin Brewing Co. to Cigar City Brewing. Pours clear amber color with off white head. Sour cherry aroma. Flavor is tart cherry, caramel and some wood. medium body with oderate carbonation. Thanks to whoever opened this.
bottle pours deep red with a thin off white head.  Kriek like sour cherry aroma.  Extremely tart cherry and apple skins.
On tap at Stone Brewery Bistro.  Brown red color.  Buttery sweet Duchess type flavor.  Medium sourness hidden in a sea of light sweetness.  Smallish head.  Delicious.

Draught at Falling Rock Tap House.  Pours clear, ruby-brown with a medium, frothy, off-white to light tan head, good retention and lacing.  Aroma is sour fruit, sweet malt, spice, light hops, and cherries.  Flavor is medium sour lactic, sweet malt, caramel, and cherry.  Medium body and carbonation.

Reddish Mahogany pour with a tiny offwhite head.  Aroma is tart cherry, wet cherry wood, acetic acid, some light brown sugar.  Mouth is creamy but not overbearing, relatively drinkable.  Flavor is tart cherry pit, woody, sour fruit and a bit of sweet malt.  Really quite good.

On tap at Blind Lady Ale House (San Diego, CA): Pours an intensely hazed, reddish/copper/brown and topped with a nice two-finger beige head that dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma of tart cherries, balsamic vinegar, light chocolate, and under-ripened fruits such as apple, grape, and banana. Flavors are similar. Extremely tart in the beginning of the mouthfeel, but quickly rounds out towards a more balanced and smooth finish. Drinkability: Really quite good overall, but lacks complexity to other sours (Russian River... and there¬ís just no comparison). Pairing: Godiva cherry cordials. Rebuy: Yes. #338 on 13032010. DG.
nice amber/red color.  smells very nutty.  good and sour!   very dry and very smooth.   would definately drink again.  is that cherry??  woot.

draft at uber. pours a cloudy dark brown with a dense, creamy tan head. plenty of sheety and stringy lace. big forward cherry balsamic nose, smells like a classic marinade. creamy medium body, soft carb. balsamic, cherry, and dark fruits on the mid palate. sweet and easy drinking. mild tart finish.

A burgundy red ale with a thin pinkish white head. In aroma, pleasant cherries,, light horseblanket funk, epsom salts. In mouth, a well balanced sweet and sour ale, sour cherry candy, light lactic notes, very well done. On tap at American Flat Bread, Jan. 11 2010.

Draft at the Three Penny Taproom - Poured a cloudy dark reddish-brown in color with a decent sized light tan head that produced some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is tart/acidic with plenty of light fruits (grape, cherry, apple).  Flavor is medium sour with lots of fruit... mixed bag of flavors in here... cherry, apple, lemon/citrus.  Finish is short and very clean.  Really good.

From tap at Monks Kettle. Pours dark redish with a small off-white head, nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is dark cherry fruity and light acetone to dry phenolic. Sour, dry and slight wooden touch. Citric andcherry fruity. Lingering citric and fruity into a dry and mild fruity finish.

Tap at Max¬ís Belgian Fest 2010.  Pours a nice deep reddish copper with a fizzy head fades to nothing.  Aroma is nicely fruity, prickly sharp acid, big sharp cherry pit and black cherry, fruity and big caramel malts that have turned to aceto.  Flavor is lightly prickly upfront then gets more acidic in the back- lots of acetobacter, some cherry pie, pitty, tannic, cyanide, mineral, sharp overall very clean and somewhat easy to drink- although a lot of aceto prickliness.  Very nice.
Draft.  Pours a crimson body with a thin white head.  Tart cherries a bit medicinal i suppose, rasp and light acidic wood notes.  Balsamic and wooden accented cherries.  Sweet and sour, decent.

Slightly opaque red tinted brown pour with a thin white head.  Fruity grape aroma.  Sweet with a good deal of tartness.  Smooth and easy to drink.  Very enjoyable though a bit too much syrupy sweetness.

It¬ís a bit too sweet, but it does have a nice tartness and the fruit is extremely bright and delicious. Sparkling carbonation keeps the beer from being too heavy. If I had to compare it to anything, I¬íd say it¬ís an improved version of the Lindemans.

Pours rusty copper in the glass, fluffy white head.  Beautiful tart aroma, reminds me of its half-brother.  Similar bracing tart foundation as the Ommegang Rouge, but this beer replaces some of the dry oak with what reminds me of saccharin and it pulls me out of the transcendent experience I¬íve had and returned for.  Don¬ít get me wrong, this is a very good sour, I¬ím just left wanting more.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2010 Tap at Malt and Vine.  Pours slightly reddish brown with a small white head on it.    Aroma is sharply sour, vinegary, and lemony.  Pretty puckering flavorwise, with more bright lemon and a touch of balsamic vinegar.  Good cherry, apple, and berry notes.  Little bit of wood and earth on the finish.  Good amount of carbonation to it and a fairly full mouthfeel.
on tap at uber tavern. medium brown color with a big head. very fizzy mouthfeel, carbonated with a distinct cherry flavor.

On tap at stone.  Pours dark red and clear with a small tan head.  Aroma is sweet and sour with some vinegar, cherries, and other dark tart fruits.  Flavor is more dark berries, sweet with a pleasing tartness.  Palate is moderate with soft carb and a sharpness.

On draft at Capones.  Pours a dark yet clear coppery amber with a medium sized light beige head.  Aroma of sour apples, vinegar, cherry and bread notes.  Taste of vinegar with hints of apples, bread notes and a touch of cherry.  Sour.
On Tap at the Trappist, Downtown Oakland. Served in a long stemed snifter. Ruby with a nice white head. Sour fruity aroma, flavor is nice tart with good fresh cherry bite. Very tasty

UPDATED: APR 9, 2012 Tap. Deep brown hue with an off-white head.  Aroma of funk, red wine, sour, wood. Taste is sour, vinegar, cherry, light sweetness.  Acid. Medium bubbles. Dry finish. 7/4/7/4/15:3.7 
Bottle (marked as 02 on the back) re-rate: Pours with a clear deep bronze hue with red highlights. Off-white head at first, acid causes it to fade to a ring. Some lace left behind. Aromas are of funk, sour cherries, lacto, oak, light grassy notes, wet wood, mild acetobacter, a hint of earth/cocoa, red wine, very mild brett. Fruity esters, dark fruit, currants, no real malt character. Flavors show a good strong acidity, tons of esters, unripe plum, black cherry, currants. Strongish acetic acid, a mild sweetness backing it all up. Lingering acidity on the palate. Leaves the mouth salivating. Somewhat musty in the finish. Light vanillin, tannin, dry. 

Very lively carbonation, acidic and dry. Pretty solid, out of the bottle, hope it stays easy to find.

Tap at Capone¬ís. Pours out a reddish hued brown color with a thin off white head. Nice aroma of sour cherries, oak and some yeasty-bread notes. Taste is very complex, tart cherries, tart granny smith apple, raspberry, some earthy notes and a touch of some sour dough bread in there too.
